original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i sampu ta tantra r'a dza t'i ka aa ma n'a ya ma nydza ri n'a ma /
analyzed: shr'i sampu ta tantra r'a dza t'i ka aa ma n'a ya ma nydza ri n'a ma /
translated: Śrī-samputa-tantra-rāja-tikā-amanāyamanjari-nāma.

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i rgya cher 'grel pa man ngag gi snye ma zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i rgya cher 'grel pa man ngag gi snye ma zhes bya ba /
translated: The glorious commentary on the king of tantras, the perfect union, called the Collection of Instructions.

original: bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Bhagavān Vajrasattva.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug thugs rje chen po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug thugs rje chen po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Avalokiteśvara Mahākaruṇika.

original: rdo rje sgeg mo'i dga' ba shin tu mang dang gnyis su med pa'i sku yis 'gro rnams kyi //
analyzed: rdo rje sgeg mo'i dga' ba shin tu mang dang gnyis su med pa'i sku yis 'gro rnams kyi //
translated: With the body of the one who is non-dual with the abundant joy of Vajra Lāsya,

original: mun pa'i tshogs rnams nub par mdzad pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis nang gi 'od zer 'char mdzad kyang //
analyzed: mun pa'i tshogs rnams nub par mdzad pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis nang gi 'od zer 'char mdzad kyang //
translated: The emanations cause the mass of darkness of beings to set, and the inner light rays to rise.

original: gang gi stobs ni gnyug ma'i spros med shes rab mchog dang thugs rje yang dag sbyor yin pa //
analyzed: gang gi stobs ni gnyug ma'i spros med shes rab mchog dang thugs rje yang dag sbyor yin pa //
translated: The power of which is the perfect union of the innate, unelaborated supreme prajñā and compassion,

original: rdo rje'i dbang phyug de yis khyed la chen po'i sa yi phun tshogs rol pa mdzad gyur cig / phal cher mgon po de yis bdag / byin gyis brlabs pas de gsung gi / don ni rang nyid gsal smra ste //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbang phyug de yis khyed la chen po'i sa yi phun tshogs rol pa mdzad gyur cig / phal cher mgon po de yis bdag / byin gyis brlabs pas de gsung gi / don ni rang nyid gsal smra ste //
translated: illuminated by his blessing,

original: dbul po la ni ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dbul po la ni ma bzhin no //
translated: like a mother to her son.🔽Moreover, I will write

original: gzhan yang rmi lam du mthong ba'i //
analyzed: gzhan yang rmi lam du mthong ba'i //
translated: about what I have seen in dreams🔽and what I have heard from the speech

original: rdo rje btsun mos bskul ba'i phyir //🔽@2a * // rin chen lta bu'i yang dag sbyor //
analyzed: rdo rje btsun mos bskul ba'i phyir // @2a * // rin chen lta bu'i yang dag sbyor //
translated: of the Vajra Queen.

original: sems can don du dbye bar bya //
analyzed: sems can don du dbye bar bya //
translated: In order to benefit sentient beings,🔽I will analyze the true union,🔽which is like a jewel,

original: gang yang mang dag bla mas rgyas mdzad pa'i //
analyzed: gang yang mang dag bla mas rgyas mdzad pa'i //
translated: as urged by the Vajra Queen.🔽The clusters of wish-fulfilling trees

original: man ngag dpag bsam ljon pa'i snye ma ni //
analyzed: man ngag dpag bsam ljon pa'i snye ma ni //
translated: of the many esoteric instructions🔽of the guru have become

original: 'bras bu'i dga' ston gags med gyur rnams kyis //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dga' ston gags med gyur rnams kyis //
translated: a feast of fruits without obstruction.🔽I will generate them

original: 'gro ba tshim bya'i ched du bskyed par bya //
analyzed: 'gro ba tshim bya'i ched du bskyed par bya //
translated: in order to satisfy migrating beings.

original: 'dir nges par brjod par bya ba la sogs pa thos pa med na phal cher dam pa rnams nyan pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir na brjod par bya ba la sogs pa sdud pa pos don gyi shugs kyis 'phen zhing gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir nges par brjod par bya ba la sogs pa thos pa med na phal cher dam pa rnams nyan pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir na brjod par bya ba la sogs pa sdud pa pos don gyi shugs kyis 'phen zhing gsungs pa /
translated: Here, if there is no mention of the definite object of expression, and so on, then for the most part the holy ones will not engage in listening, and so on. Therefore, the compiler has implied and stated the object of expression, and so on.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, since without hearing the expression “thus have I heard,” etc., the holy ones generally do not engage in listening, etc., the compiler projects the sense of the expression “thus have I heard,” etc., and speaks.

original: 'dir brtag pa bcu'i bdag nyid dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir brtag pa bcu'i bdag nyid dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: Here, the glorious Heruka Tantra, which has the nature of ten investigations, is the subject matter.

original: de'i ston pa po ni 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de'i ston pa po ni 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: Its teacher is the Blessed One Vajrasattva, who has the nature of the result tantra.

original: brjod par bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yang ngo //
translated: It is also the subject matter.

original: de mngon du byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis na rgyu'i rgyud dang thabs kyi rgyud kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de mngon du byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis na rgyu'i rgyud dang thabs kyi rgyud kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should also be called the cause tantra and the method tantra, because it is the very cause for realizing that.

original: de lta na yang bstan par bya ba dang ston pa po'i 'brel pa dang / rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i 'brel pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa brjod do //
analyzed: de lta na yang bstan par bya ba dang ston pa po'i 'brel pa dang / rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i 'brel pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa brjod do //
translated: Nevertheless, the relationship between the object of teaching and the teacher, the relationship between the expression and the expressed, and the relationship between cause and effect are described.

original: gdul bya rnams kyis kyang dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i don rtogs pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyis kyang dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i don rtogs pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is that those to be trained understand the meaning of the Shriparamādya.

original: rdo rje lta bu bde ba chen po ro @2b gcig pa 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa byed pa 'bras bu rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o zhes 'phangs so //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu bde ba chen po ro @2b gcig pa 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa byed pa 'bras bu rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o zhes 'phangs so //
translated: The ultimate purpose is the attainment of the Great Seal, the essence of the result Vajradhara, which is the single taste of great bliss like a vajra, which benefits all migrating beings.

original: de skad du yang //🔽dgos pa bsdus pa'i don bcas shing //
analyzed: de skad du yang // dgos pa bsdus pa'i don bcas shing //
translated: Thus it is implied.🔽And it is said:🔽The meaning of the purpose is summarized.

original: tshig don bcas shing mtshams sbyar bcas //
analyzed: tshig don bcas shing mtshams sbyar bcas //
translated: The meaning of the words is summarized.🔽The connection is summarized.🔽The refutations and replies are summarized.

original: brgal len bcas pa mdo yi don //
analyzed: brgal len bcas pa mdo yi don //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is summarized.

original: smra pa rnams kyis brjod par bya //
analyzed: smra pa rnams kyis brjod par bya //
translated: The speakers should express it.

original: zhes pa'i rigs pas dgos pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rigs pas dgos pa brjod pa'o //
translated: By this reasoning, the purpose is expressed.

original: bsdus pa'i don la sogs pa brjod par bya ste //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don la sogs pa brjod par bya ste //
translated: The summarized meaning and so on should be expressed.

original: de la rab tu byed pa dang por bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rim pa gnyis mdor bstan cing /
analyzed: de la rab tu byed pa dang por bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rim pa gnyis mdor bstan cing /
translated: In the first chapter, the two stages, which consist of the creation stage and the perfection stage, are briefly taught.

original: gnyis par ni rgyu'i rgyud rdzogs pa'i rim pa kho na rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis par ni rgyu'i rgyud rdzogs pa'i rim pa kho na rgyas par bshad do //
translated: In the second chapter, the causal continuum, which is the perfection stage, is explained in detail.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag gis ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa kho na rab tu rgyas par bshad par mngon par gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag gis ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa kho na rab tu rgyas par bshad par mngon par gsal bar byas so //
translated: In the third and fourth chapters, the perfection stage is explained in great detail.

original: lnga par ni rim pa gnyis po 'di yang dbang bskur ba kho na la bstan par bya zhing goms par bya'o zhes rim pa gnyis kyi yan lag tu dbang bskur ba rnam par spros so //
analyzed: lnga par ni rim pa gnyis po 'di yang dbang bskur ba kho na la bstan par bya zhing goms par bya'o zhes rim pa gnyis kyi yan lag tu dbang bskur ba rnam par spros so //
translated: In the fifth chapter, initiation is elaborated as a branch of the two stages, stating that these two stages should be taught and practiced only in the context of initiation.

original: drug par ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbang bskur ba thob cing rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob par 'dod pas dbang po rab la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi dngos kyi thabs phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor gyi dngos su ba'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rim pa🔽bsgom pa kho na nges par bzhag go //
analyzed: drug par ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbang bskur ba thob cing rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob par 'dod pas dbang po rab la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi dngos kyi thabs phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor gyi dngos su ba'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa kho na nges par bzhag go //
translated: In the sixth chapter, since one obtains the conventional and ultimate empowerments and wishes to obtain the state of Great Vajradhara, the method of the supreme siddhi of mahāmudrā is definitely established to be the perfection stage alone for those of best abilities.

original: bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa dang bcu gcig pa dang bcu gnyis par dbang po 'bring dang rtul po dag gis rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa rim gyis dang cig car bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas bsgom par bya'o zhes
analyzed: bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa dang bcu gcig pa dang bcu gnyis par dbang po 'bring dang rtul po dag gis rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa rim gyis dang cig car bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas bsgom par bya'o zhes
translated: In the seventh, eighth, ninth, tenth, eleventh, and twelfth chapters, the perfection stage is to be meditated upon by those of medium and average abilities, preceded by the meditation on the creation stage gradually and instantaneously.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dngos su ba'i thabs bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dngos su ba'i thabs bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: Thus the creation stage, which is the method of the perfection stage, is clarified.

original: bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga pa dang bcu drug par de ltar rim pa gnyis sgom pa po'i rnal 'byor pa las dang po pa'i mngon par 'dod pa sgrub pa'i don du nye bar gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi brda yongs su shes🔽pa'i ched du thabs kyi yan lag ngag gi brda la sogs pa rnams gsungs so //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga pa dang bcu drug par de ltar rim pa gnyis sgom pa po'i rnal 'byor pa las dang po pa'i mngon par 'dod pa sgrub pa'i don du nye bar gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi brda yongs su shes pa'i ched du thabs kyi yan lag ngag gi brda la sogs pa rnams gsungs so //
translated: In the thirteenth, fourteenth, fifteenth, and sixteenth chapters, in order to accomplish the aims of the yogi who is a beginner in the two stages, the intimate signs of the yoginis who are close to him are taught for the sake of knowing them completely.

original: bcu bdun par brda shes pa rjes su gzung ba'i don du gnas pa la sogs pa 'du ba'i gnas gsungs so //🔽bco brgyad par der 'dus pa'am gzhan gyis rim pa gnyis bsgoms pas thabs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa kho na'i yul longs spyod pa'i don du rim @3a * //
analyzed: bcu bdun par brda shes pa rjes su gzung ba'i don du gnas pa la sogs pa 'du ba'i gnas gsungs so // bco brgyad par der 'dus pa'am gzhan gyis rim pa gnyis bsgoms pas thabs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa kho na'i yul longs spyod pa'i don du rim @3a * //
translated: In the seventeenth chapter, the places of assembly such as the abode are taught for the sake of caring for those who know the signs.

original: pa gnyis dang phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: pa gnyis dang phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: In the eighteenth chapter, in order for those who have assembled there or others to enjoy the domain of the pure branches of the means by means of the two stages, the purities of the two stages, the aggregates, and so on are clarified.

original: bcu dgu pa dang nyi shu par rnam pa de lta bu'i yang spyod pa med na phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ma yin no zhes pas kun du bzang po'i spyod pa gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: bcu dgu pa dang nyi shu par rnam pa de lta bu'i yang spyod pa med na phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ma yin no zhes pas kun du bzang po'i spyod pa gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: In the nineteenth and twentieth chapters, by saying that if there is no such conduct, it is not the spiritual attainment of the Great Seal, he clarifies the conduct of Samantabhadra.

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig pa dang nyi shu rtsa gnyis par de'i rjes su rab tu byed pa gsum par gsungs pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang rtsa'i gnas kyi khyad par rnam par gzhag pa yang legs par gzhag par mdzad do //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig pa dang nyi shu rtsa gnyis par de'i rjes su rab tu byed pa gsum par gsungs pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang rtsa'i gnas kyi khyad par rnam par gzhag pa yang legs par gzhag par mdzad do //
translated: In the twenty-first and twenty-second chapters, he also properly sets forth the completion stage and the special topics of the channels as taught in the third chapter.

original: nyi shu rtsa gsum pa dang rtsa bzhi par ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'di ltar bsgom pa'i don du phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor dang sbyin sreg la sogs par 'dzin pas slu ba las grol ba'i ched du rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor dang sbyin sreg dang mchod🔽pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gsum pa dang rtsa bzhi par ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'di ltar bsgom pa'i don du phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor dang sbyin sreg la sogs par 'dzin pas slu ba las grol ba'i ched du rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor dang sbyin sreg dang mchod🔽pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan to //
translated: In the twenty-third and twenty-fourth chapters, for the sake of cultivating this completion stage, he extensively teaches the completion stage mandalas, fire pujās, and so on, in order to free one from the deception of grasping at external mandalas, fire pujās, and so on.

original: nyi shu rtsa lnga pa dang rtsa drug pa dang rtsa bdun pa dang rtsa brgyad par sngar bshad pa'i brda dang lta stangs bzhi po rnams dang las rab 'byam yang thabs kyi yan lag nyid kyi phyir na rab tu spros so //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa lnga pa dang rtsa drug pa dang rtsa bdun pa dang rtsa brgyad par sngar bshad pa'i brda dang lta stangs bzhi po rnams dang las rab 'byam yang thabs kyi yan lag nyid kyi phyir na rab tu spros so //
translated: In the twenty-fifth, twenty-sixth, twenty-seventh, and twenty-eighth chapters, the four topics of signs and gazes explained above and the various activities are elaborated because they are branches of the method.

original: nyi shu rtsa dgu par ni rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu'i rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa dgu par ni rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu'i rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: In the twenty-ninth chapter, the nature of the vajra and bell is taught.

original: sum cu par bgrang phreng la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sum cu par bgrang phreng la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the thirtieth chapter, the rosary and so forth.

original: sum cu rtsa gcig par 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gcig par 'pho ba'o //
translated: In the thirty-first, transference.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis par thabs kyi yan lag nyid kyis na sngags rnams bsdus so //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis par thabs kyi yan lag nyid kyis na sngags rnams bsdus so //
translated: In the thirty-second, the mantras are summarized because they are branches of the method.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum par ni rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms pas phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi bltams pa dang / byang chub pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa rnams kyis skye ba bstan to //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum par ni rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms pas phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi bltams pa dang / byang chub pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa rnams kyis skye ba bstan to //
translated: In the thirty-third chapter, the emanations of the great seal nature are taught by the meditation of the perfect mandala and the emanations of birth, enlightenment, turning the wheel of dharma, and so forth.

original: sum cu rtsa bzhi par ni bgegs nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du thabs kyi yan lag gtor ma gsungs so //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bzhi par ni bgegs nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du thabs kyi yan lag gtor ma gsungs so //
translated: In the thirty-fourth chapter, the subsidiary rite of the sacrificial cake is taught for the purpose of pacifying obstacles, and so forth.

original: sum cu rtsa lnga par ni thabs kyi yan lag thang sku dang glegs bam dag go //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa lnga par ni thabs kyi yan lag thang sku dang glegs bam dag go //
translated: In the thirty-fifth chapter, the subsidiary rite of the painted image and the book are taught.

original: sum cu rtsa drug par ni sngar gsungs pa'i gnas la sogs pa rnams su tshogs la 'du ba na rnal 'byor ba'i rol mo la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug par ni sngar gsungs pa'i gnas la sogs pa rnams su tshogs la 'du ba na rnal 'byor ba'i rol mo la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In the thirty-sixth chapter, when the assembly gathers in the previously taught places, and so forth, the music of the yogin, and so forth, are taught.

original: sum cu rtsa bdun par ni de ltar zhugs pa bsgom pa dang ma bral ba la phyi rol gyi phyag rgya med par phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ma yin no zhes pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi dngos su pa'i thabs rigs kyi sgeg mo bsten🔽pa nges par byas so //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun par ni de ltar zhugs pa bsgom pa dang ma bral ba la phyi rol gyi phyag rgya med par phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ma yin no zhes pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi dngos su pa'i thabs rigs kyi sgeg mo bsten🔽pa nges par byas so //
translated: In the thirty-seventh chapter, it is ascertained that the means of directly achieving the power of the great seal is to rely on the seal of the clan's beauty, since the power of the great seal is not without the external seal for one who is thus engaged and not separated from meditation.

original: sum cu rtsa brgyad par ni de ltar phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi dus su rnal 'byor can gyi dbang phyug gi gtsug gi nor bu la bsnyen bkur @3b bla na med pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa brgyad par ni de ltar phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi dus su rnal 'byor can gyi dbang phyug gi gtsug gi nor bu la bsnyen bkur @3b bla na med pa gsungs so //
translated: In the thirty-eighth chapter, the worship of the crest-jewel of the lord of yogins at the time of the attainment of the Great Seal is taught.

original: sum cu rtsa dgu par ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs par ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'di'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par dang sgyu ma'i rnam par 'phrul pa sum cu rtsa gsum par mdor bstan pa rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa dgu par ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs par ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'di'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par dang sgyu ma'i rnam par 'phrul pa sum cu rtsa gsum par mdor bstan pa rgyas par bstan to //
translated: In the thirty-ninth chapter, the nature of this Bhagavān who is endowed with the perfection of his own aim and the magical emanation of the thirty-three are taught in detail, having been indicated in brief in the thirty-third chapter.

original: bzhi bcu par rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'di dag 'bras bu'i rgyud yin zhing /
analyzed: bzhi bcu par rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'di dag 'bras bu'i rgyud yin zhing /
translated: In the fortieth chapter, these perfections of one’s own and others’ aims are the causal continuum of the result.

original: skyes bu'i don gyi mchog 'di thams cad kyang rtog pa'i dra ba mtha' dag drungs phyung ba'i bla na med pa'i shes rab dang thabs bsgom pas dam tshigs bsten pa med na phun sum tshogs pa ma yin zhes dam tshig bsten pa gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gyi mchog 'di thams cad kyang rtog pa'i dra ba mtha' dag drungs phyung ba'i bla na med pa'i shes rab dang thabs bsgom pas dam tshigs bsten pa med na phun sum tshogs pa ma yin zhes dam tshig bsten pa gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: All these supreme aims of persons are not perfect if they are not based on the observance of the vow, by cultivating the unexcelled wisdom and means that uproot the entire net of conceptualization.

original: de ltar bsdus pa'i don gyis rgyud kyi don thams cad phul du byung bar bstan pa'i don du rgyud kyi 'brel pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsdus pa'i don gyis rgyud kyi don thams cad phul du byung bar bstan pa'i don du rgyud kyi 'brel pa brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having stated the connection of the tantra in order to teach that the entire meaning of the tantra is excellent by means of the summarized meaning,

original: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po rnams kyis bde blag tu 'chad pa dang / gzung ba'i ched du mdor bsdus pas mngon par brjod pa'i don gyi tshig gi don bshad pa la sogs pa gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po rnams kyis bde blag tu 'chad pa dang / gzung ba'i ched du mdor bsdus pas mngon par brjod pa'i don gyi tshig gi don bshad pa la sogs pa gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin bshad par bya'o //
translated: for the sake of the expounders and listeners easily explaining and retaining it, the meaning of the words of the expressed meaning will be explained in brief, and so forth, as appropriate.

original: de la 'di skad ces pa la sogs pa 'dzum pa mdzad do'i tshig mthar thug pa dang por gleng gzhi ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces pa la sogs pa 'dzum pa mdzad do'i tshig mthar thug pa dang por gleng gzhi ste /
translated: Therein, “thus” and so forth are the final words of the smile. The first is the nidāna.

original: 'di yod na bstan pa rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yod na bstan pa rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when this exists, the teaching is well-established.

original: yul dang dus dang ston pa po dang 'khor tshogs pa ni bstan pa'i dang po'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang ston pa po dang 'khor tshogs pa ni bstan pa'i dang po'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of the first teaching is the assembly of the place, time, teacher, and retinue.

original: de rnams med na bstan pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams med na bstan pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when those are absent, the teaching is not tenable.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: dad ldan 'jug pa'i yan lag tu //
analyzed: dad ldan 'jug pa'i yan lag tu //
translated: For the faithful to enter,🔽the teacher, retinue, witness,

original: ston pa 'khor dang dpang po dang // yul dang dus dag nges bstan pa //
analyzed: ston pa 'khor dang dpang po dang // yul dang dus dag nges bstan pa //
translated: place, and time are definitely taught.

original: rang nyid tshad mar grub ched du'o //
analyzed: rang nyid tshad mar grub ched du'o //
translated: For the sake of establishing oneself as valid.

original: zhes so // 'dir rang nyid tshad ma ni sdud par byed pa'i 'o //
analyzed: zhes so // 'dir rang nyid tshad ma ni sdud par byed pa'i 'o //
translated: Here, one's own validity is for the sake of compilation.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa bzhin chos bstan pa de ltar gdul bya mtha' yas pa rnams rjes su 'dzin pa yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa bzhin chos bstan pa de ltar gdul bya mtha' yas pa rnams rjes su 'dzin pa yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
translated: In that, the Blessed One, just as he fully awakened, taught the Dharma in that way, and thus perfectly entered into caring for limitless disciples.

original: yang de'i dus na skal pa med par gyur pa'i gdul bya gzhan rnams yod de /
analyzed: yang de'i dus na skal pa med par gyur pa'i gdul bya gzhan rnams yod de /
translated: Moreover, at that time, there were other disciples who became unfortunate.

original: de rjes su gzud pa'i ched du bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs pa kho na'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhus pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis /🔽'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes byas nas nga'i chos bsdu bar bya'o zhes chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdor gsungs te /
analyzed: de rjes su gzud pa'i ched du bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs pa kho na'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhus pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis / 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes byas nas nga'i chos bsdu bar bya'o zhes chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdor gsungs te /
translated: In order to introduce others to this, the Lord’s disciples, the Bodhisattvas, blessed by the Lord, will say,🔽“Thus have I heard,” and will collect my teachings.

original: des na sdud par byed pas de bzhin kho nar bsdus so //
analyzed: des na sdud par byed pas de bzhin kho nar bsdus so //
translated: Thus the compiler will collect them just as he has heard them.

original: 'dir sdud pa po ni su yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir sdud pa po ni su yin zhe na /
translated: Here, who is the compiler?

original: ming nges par byed pa 'dis ci bya ste /
analyzed: ming nges par byed pa 'dis ci bya ste /
translated: What is the use of specifying his name?

original: bcom @4a * //🔽ldan 'das kyis bka' gnang ba kho nas des brjod pa'i phyir 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kho na'i gsung ste /
analyzed: bcom @4a * // ldan 'das kyis bka' gnang ba kho nas des brjod pa'i phyir 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kho na'i gsung ste /
translated: The Lord

original: sdud par byed pa ni rjes su brjod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sdud par byed pa ni rjes su brjod pa kho na'o //
translated: has given him permission to speak, and so he speaks. Here, the compiler is only repeating the Lord’s words.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyud rnams su mtha' mar yang sdud pa po'i ming ma brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyud rnams su mtha' mar yang sdud pa po'i ming ma brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the compilers’ names are not mentioned at the end of the scriptures.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor chen por gtad pa'i khur yin pa nyid kyi phyir na thams cad kyis smra bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor chen por gtad pa'i khur yin pa nyid kyi phyir na thams cad kyis smra bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Because it is the burden entrusted to the great assembly by the Bhagavān, it is not to be spoken by all.

original: de'i phyir ston pa po las ji skad thos pa bzhin du gcig gis smra bar byed cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir ston pa po las ji skad thos pa bzhin du gcig gis smra bar byed cing /
translated: Therefore, just as it was heard from the teacher, one should speak.

original: de las gzhan pa de la shes pa dang ldan pa rnams kyang de'i rjes su sems par byed do zhes pa na bsdu bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa de la shes pa dang ldan pa rnams kyang de'i rjes su sems par byed do zhes pa na bsdu bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: And those who are wise in that [teaching] should reflect on it. Thus, it should be compiled.

original: 'dir zhu ba po yin pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje snying po'o zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir zhu ba po yin pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje snying po'o zhes gsung ngo //
translated: Here, it is said that because he is the questioner, he is the Vajragarbha.

original: gzhan yang gdul bya'i skye bo'i dbang gis ston pa po kho na sdud pa por 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gdul bya'i skye bo'i dbang gis ston pa po kho na sdud pa por 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it will be explained that due to the power of the disciples, the teacher himself becomes the compiler.

original: de la bsdu bar bya ba'i rgyud kyi don mtha' dag phyin ci ma log par yid la mngon du bzhag par 'di skad ces pa'i tshig phrad 'dis gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de la bsdu bar bya ba'i rgyud kyi don mtha' dag phyin ci ma log par yid la mngon du bzhag par 'di skad ces pa'i tshig phrad 'dis gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: There, by this phrase thus have I heard, he clearly presents to the mind the entire meaning of the Tantra to be compiled without error.

original: de'i phyir ae wam gyi yi ge 'di rgyud kyi don mtha' dag gis don dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ae wam gyi yi ge 'di rgyud kyi don mtha' dag gis don dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this syllable EVAM is taught to be meaningful with respect to the entire meaning of the tantra.

original: rgyud kyi don yang shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis na yi ge gnyis kyi cha shas su gyur pas gnas pa'o zhes 'doms par mdzad do //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don yang shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis na yi ge gnyis kyi cha shas su gyur pas gnas pa'o zhes 'doms par mdzad do //
translated: And the meaning of the tantra is the nature of wisdom and means, which is taught to be present as the component of the two syllables.

original: ae wam gyi ye ges spyir bshad nas khyad par du rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur bas na zlos pa nyid med do //
analyzed: ae wam gyi ye ges spyir bshad nas khyad par du rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur bas na zlos pa nyid med do //
translated: Since EVAM is explained in general and will be explained in detail later, there is no redundancy.

original: de ltar na yang 'di ni ngag chen po gcig tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'di ni ngag chen po gcig tu gyur pa ste /
translated: Thus, this is a single great statement,

original: rgyud gcig tu brjod do //
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu brjod do //
translated: which is expressed as a single tantra.

original: bdag gis zhes pa bdag nyid kho nas rang nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das las thos kyis brgyud pas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes pa bdag nyid kho nas rang nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das las thos kyis brgyud pas ma yin pa'o //
translated: I myself means that I myself, not through a lineage, heard it from the Bhagavan.

original: thos pa zhes pa rna ba'i rnam par shes pas tshig las dang yid kyi rnam par shes pas don las rtogs kyi /
analyzed: thos pa zhes pa rna ba'i rnam par shes pas tshig las dang yid kyi rnam par shes pas don las rtogs kyi /
translated: Hearing means understanding the words through the ear consciousness and the meaning through the mental consciousness.

original: 'di bdag gis mngon sum du byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di bdag gis mngon sum du byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This was not something I actualized.

original: bcom ldan 'das kho nas 'dir rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes chos la gus pa nye bar ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kho nas 'dir rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes chos la gus pa nye bar ston to //
translated: The Blessed One alone has realized all aspects here, thus he shows respect for the Dharma.

original: yang na rtogs pa yang mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid kyis ston pa po la ston pa'i 'du shes bskyed nas /
analyzed: yang na rtogs pa yang mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid kyis ston pa po la ston pa'i 'du shes bskyed nas /
translated: Or, by the absence of pride in realization, he generates the perception of the teacher towards the teacher.

original: chos rin po che nyan pa'i bdud rtsis mi ngoms pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang gsan na /
analyzed: chos rin po che nyan pa'i bdud rtsis mi ngoms pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang gsan na /
translated: If the great bodhisattvas and all the tathagatas listen with insatiable thirst for the nectar of hearing the precious Dharma,

original: gzhan phra mo rnams kyis lta ci zhes bslab pa'i don du thos pa smos so //🔽de ltar spyir nye bar @4b 'phangs nas khyad par du /
analyzed: gzhan phra mo rnams kyis lta ci zhes bslab pa'i don du thos pa smos so // de ltar spyir nye bar @4b 'phangs nas khyad par du /
translated: what need is there to speak of the lesser ones? Thus he mentions hearing for the sake of training.

original: dus gcig na zhes pa la sogs pas gleng gzhi de rim gyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes pa la sogs pas gleng gzhi de rim gyis ston par byed do //
translated: Having thus generally indicated, he specifically teaches the nidana in sequence with at one time, etc.

original: gcig 'di ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs du mas nye bar thob pa tshes dang rgyu skar la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su ma bcad pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig go //
analyzed: gcig 'di ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs du mas nye bar thob pa tshes dang rgyu skar la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su ma bcad pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig go //
translated: It is not divided into days, lunar mansions, etc. It is an inconceivable special time.

original: de yang 'dir skad cig bzhi pa'i ngo bo la dus zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dir skad cig bzhi pa'i ngo bo la dus zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: And that is to be called “time” in the nature of the fourth moment.

original: dus gcig po der bcom ldan 'das de'i bdag nyid kyis bzhugs so zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: dus gcig po der bcom ldan 'das de'i bdag nyid kyis bzhugs so zhes 'brel to //
translated: At that one time, the Bhagavat himself abides.

original: yang na dus gcig na zhes pa skad cig las te /
analyzed: yang na dus gcig na zhes pa skad cig las te /
translated: Or, “at one time” means in one moment.

original: 'dis bdag nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo thob pa nyid gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dis bdag nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo thob pa nyid gsal bar byed do //
translated: This clarifies that he himself has attained the inconceivable door of liberation.

original: yang na dus gcig gi tshe 'di thos shing /
analyzed: yang na dus gcig gi tshe 'di thos shing /
translated: Or, “at one time” means that he heard this,

original: gzhan gyi tshe gzhan no zhes pas bdag nyid mang du thos pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe gzhan no zhes pas bdag nyid mang du thos pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: and at another time he heard something else. Thus he himself is said to be very learned.

original: yang na dus gcig kho na na 'di thos kyi gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin pas na /
analyzed: yang na dus gcig kho na na 'di thos kyi gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin pas na /
translated: Or, “at one time” means that he heard this, but not at another time.

original: rgyud sde rin po che 'di rnyed par dka' ba nyid du rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: rgyud sde rin po che 'di rnyed par dka' ba nyid du rtogs par byed do //
translated: One should understand that this precious tantra is difficult to find.

original: 'dis bdud bzhi po gzhom par bya bas na bcom pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis bdud bzhi po gzhom par bya bas na bcom pa ste /
translated: It is the conqueror because it conquers the four demons.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par brjod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par brjod do //
translated: It is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: de rdo rje rtse mor gsungs pa /
analyzed: de rdo rje rtse mor gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated in the Vajra Peak:

original: nyon mongs bdud sogs 'joms pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nyon mongs bdud sogs 'joms pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it conquers the demon of afflictions and so forth,

original: 'joms pa bcom pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'joms pa bcom pa zhes brjod do //
translated: it is called the conqueror of the conqueror.

original: shes rab kyis gzhom nyon mongs de //
analyzed: shes rab kyis gzhom nyon mongs de //
translated: The afflictions are conquered by wisdom,

original: de phyir shes rab bcom par brjod //
analyzed: de phyir shes rab bcom par brjod //
translated: therefore it is called the wisdom conqueror.

original: yang na 'di rnams kyis skal bar byed do zhes pa skal pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'di rnams kyis skal bar byed do zhes pa skal pa ste /
translated: Or, they are called conquerors because they make one fortunate.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams so //
translated: They are the qualities of the lord and so forth.

original: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba dbang phyug dang ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba dbang phyug dang ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: As will be stated: “The lord and so forth…”

original: skal pa de 'di la yod pas bcom ldan no //
analyzed: skal pa de 'di la yod pas bcom ldan no //
translated: Since that fortune is here, it is the Bhagavān.

original: yang na mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdud bzhi rnams bcom pas na bcom ldan te /
analyzed: yang na mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdud bzhi rnams bcom pas na bcom ldan te /
translated: Or, it is the Bhagavān because it conquers the four demons, which are the discordant side.

original: nges pa'i tshig gis na phyis pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gis na phyis pa'o //
translated: By way of etymology, it is the conqueror.

original: thams cad kyang de rnams yin zhing /
analyzed: thams cad kyang de rnams yin zhing /
translated: All of them are just that.

original: chos rnams thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba de pa bzhin nyid ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba de pa bzhin nyid ni de bzhin te /
translated: The suchness of all phenomena is just that.

original: de gshegs shing rtogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de gshegs shing rtogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Those who go and realize that are the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin nyid las byon pa yang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las byon pa yang ste /
translated: They also come from suchness,

original: 'gro ba'i don du spro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don du spro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they emanate for the sake of migrating beings.

original: gzhan rnams la de bzhin kho nar gsung ngo zhes pa nges pa'i tshig gis sgrub pas /
analyzed: gzhan rnams la de bzhin kho nar gsung ngo zhes pa nges pa'i tshig gis sgrub pas /
translated: They teach that to others just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: They are the tathāgatas.

original: de rnams kyi sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos kyi bdag nyid sku @5a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos kyi bdag nyid sku @5a * //
translated: Their emanations, enjoyment bodies, and dharma bodies

original: dang gsung dang thugs rnams so //
analyzed: dang gsung dang thugs rnams so //
translated: are their bodies, speech, and minds.

original: de rnams kyi de rnams kho na ni snying po ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi de rnams kho na ni snying po ste /
translated: Their essence is just that.

original: de ro gcig pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de ro gcig pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the single taste of the vajra holder.

original: de rnams de las byung ba'i phyir dang de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams de las byung ba'i phyir dang de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is because they arise from that and are of its nature.

original: glegs bam kha cig la snying po zhes klog pa med de /
analyzed: glegs bam kha cig la snying po zhes klog pa med de /
translated: Some texts do not read “essence.”

original: 'bri mkhan gyi skyon nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bri mkhan gyi skyon nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the fault of the writer himself.

original: bcom ldan 'das kho nas snying po'i sgra 'dir nye bar blangs pa ni rab tu byed pa bzhi par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kho nas snying po'i sgra 'dir nye bar blangs pa ni rab tu byed pa bzhi par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Blessed One himself has taken up this term essence, which will be explained in the fourth chapter.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje ste stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir la /
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje ste stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir la /
translated: That itself is the vajra, because it has the nature of emptiness,

original: de nyid btsun mo ste bla na med pa'i dga' ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid btsun mo ste bla na med pa'i dga' ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: and that itself is the queen, because it is the cause of unsurpassed bliss.

original: rdo rje snyems ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rdo rje snyems ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Vajragarvi is the embodiment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i de kho na yang bha ga chos 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i de kho na yang bha ga chos 'byung ste /
translated: Her reality is the bhaga, the source of phenomena,

original: de yongs su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir dang de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir dang de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: because it is the transformation itself and because it is its nature.

original: de skad du yang gnyis su med pa rnam par rgyal ba'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang gnyis su med pa rnam par rgyal ba'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Nondual Victor Tantra:

original: bha ga bcom ldan sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: bha ga bcom ldan sangs rgyas te //
translated: The bhaga is the blessed Buddha,

original: des na 'dod chags sun mi dbyung //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags sun mi dbyung //
translated: therefore one should not revile desire.

original: zhes so // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir zur gsum pa /
analyzed: zhes so // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir zur gsum pa /
translated: Since it is the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas, it is triangular.

original: bha ga'i bdag nyid can stobs bcu la sogs pa'i chos 'byung ba /
analyzed: bha ga'i bdag nyid can stobs bcu la sogs pa'i chos 'byung ba /
translated: It is the source of the Dharma, such as the ten powers, etc.

original: 'khyud pa'i brten par bya ba lha mo'i padma zhes bya ba rten gyi ngo bo la bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'khyud pa'i brten par bya ba lha mo'i padma zhes bya ba rten gyi ngo bo la bzhugs so //
translated: It is the abode of the goddess' lotus, which is the object of embrace.

original: mang po'i tshig ni rdo rje snyems ma ni btsun mo thams cad bsdus pa'i rnam pa can nyid kyi phyir dang / gdul bya'i dbang gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa thams cad kyi brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab so so'i nang du 'jug pa'i chos 'byung gi nang la gnas pa'i sna tshogs padma dang rdo rje la gnas pa'i
analyzed: mang po'i tshig ni rdo rje snyems ma ni btsun mo thams cad bsdus pa'i rnam pa can nyid kyi phyir dang / gdul bya'i dbang gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa thams cad kyi brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab so so'i nang du 'jug pa'i chos 'byung gi nang la gnas pa'i sna tshogs padma dang rdo rje la gnas pa'i
translated: The word many is because Vajragarbha is the form of the collection of all the queens, and by the power of the disciples, it is the subtle particle of all the things, moving and unmoving, of all the infinite world systems in the ten directions, which is the source of the Dharma, abiding within the various lotuses and vajras.

original: rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo can khang pa brtsegs par bzhugs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor nye bar ston pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo can khang pa brtsegs par bzhugs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor nye bar ston pa'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: and the great Vajradhara's mandala is revealed in the pinnacle of the vajra gem mansion.

original: 'dir rten gyi bdag nyid la khang pa brtsegs pa ma gsungs pa nyid na yang bha ga na gnas pa'i khang pa brtsegs par zhes don gyis te /
analyzed: 'dir rten gyi bdag nyid la khang pa brtsegs pa ma gsungs pa nyid na yang bha ga na gnas pa'i khang pa brtsegs par zhes don gyis te /
translated: Here, even though the mansion is not mentioned as the nature of the support, it is understood that it is the mansion situated in the bhaga.

original: dper na grong khyer na phyug po gnas so zhes pa grong khyer na gnas pa'i khang bzangs na'o zhes don gyis yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grong khyer na phyug po gnas so zhes pa grong khyer na gnas pa'i khang bzangs na'o zhes don gyis yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when it is said that a rich man lives in the city, it is understood that he lives in a fine house in the city.

original: de ltar ma gsungs pa ni don gzhan bsdu ba'i don dang / bde ba chen po'i sa gzhi gtso bo nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma gsungs pa ni don gzhan bsdu ba'i don dang / bde ba chen po'i sa gzhi gtso bo nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The reason it is not stated in that way is in order to include another meaning and to indicate the ground of great bliss as the principal.

original: khang pa @5b brtsegs pa yang de dang ro gcig pa kho na yin pas so //
analyzed: khang pa @5b brtsegs pa yang de dang ro gcig pa kho na yin pas so //
translated: And the mansion is of the same taste as that.

original: yang na nang gi bdag nyid can sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin spyan ma la sogs pa'i btsun mo'i bha ga rnams te chos 'byung dang sprul pa la sogs pa'i padma rnams te de rnams su bzhugs so //
analyzed: yang na nang gi bdag nyid can sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin spyan ma la sogs pa'i btsun mo'i bha ga rnams te chos 'byung dang sprul pa la sogs pa'i padma rnams te de rnams su bzhugs so //
translated: Or else, in the bhagas of the queens such as Lochana, who are of the nature of earth and so forth, which are of the nature of the inner self, or in the lotuses such as the Dharma source and the emanation lotus.

original: bzhugs so zhes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i thabs can gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyis mos pa sna tshogs pa gdul bya'i sems can gyi yid phrogs te aa wa rdzi ta wan kun nas 'dun par mdzad pa gang gi tshe yin pa de'i tshe
analyzed: bzhugs so zhes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i thabs can gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyis mos pa sna tshogs pa gdul bya'i sems can gyi yid phrogs te aa wa rdzi ta wan kun nas 'dun par mdzad pa gang gi tshe yin pa de'i tshe
translated: The phrase abides means that when the Bhagavan, by means of his various methods of body, speech, and mind, attracts the minds of the various sentient beings to be tamed, and when he causes them to gather around him,

original: de las der bdag gis thos so zhes snga ma dang sbrel lo //
analyzed: de las der bdag gis thos so zhes snga ma dang sbrel lo //
translated: at that time I heard this from him, connecting this to the previous phrase.

original: gnas par mdzad do zhes ma brjod pa ni de kho na nyid dun  bcom ldan 'das gang du yang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas par mdzad do zhes ma brjod pa ni de kho na nyid dun  bcom ldan 'das gang du yang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase abides is not used because in reality the Bhagavan does not abide anywhere.

original: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba /
translated: The phrase who is to speak

original: bha ga der de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' dag btsun mo dang bcas pa gnas so zhes pa der ni /
analyzed: bha ga der de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' dag btsun mo dang bcas pa gnas so zhes pa der ni /
translated: means that in that bhaga all the Tathagatas together with their queens abide.

original: dus kyi mtshams med par gnas zhes mngon par dgongs so //
analyzed: dus kyi mtshams med par gnas zhes mngon par dgongs so //
translated: He abides without the division of time.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i yul gsum du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa bstan pas stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i sku la gsal bar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i yul gsum du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa bstan pas stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i sku la gsal bar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the Bhagavān abides in the three realms, which are the three appearances, and that the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion is the co-emergent body.

original: sku de kho nas kyang rgyud bstan pas yang de dang ro gcig par bstan to //
analyzed: sku de kho nas kyang rgyud bstan pas yang de dang ro gcig par bstan to //
translated: And, since that body is taught in the tantra, it is also taught to be of one taste with it.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po rdo rje ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po ste thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems rdo rje kho na ste /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po rdo rje ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po ste thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems rdo rje kho na ste /
translated: Or else, the essence of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas is the vajra. The Bhagavān is the lord of all tathāgatas, who is the vajra of bodhicitta, the nature of great compassion.

original: de'i btsun mo phyag rgya chen mo bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab chen mo kun du bzang mo'i ming gzhan can no //
analyzed: de'i btsun mo phyag rgya chen mo bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab chen mo kun du bzang mo'i ming gzhan can no //
translated: His queen, the great seal, is the Bhagavatī, the great wisdom, Samantabhadrī, who has another name.

original: de'i bha ga ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i bha ga ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Her bhaga is emptiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das de der bzhugs te de'i bdag nyid du gyur nas ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin gyis te /🔽dbye ba mtha' dag gi mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i bar du brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma dang mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma dang phyag
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de der bzhugs te de'i bdag nyid du gyur nas ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin gyis te / dbye ba mtha' dag gi mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i bar du brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma dang mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma dang phyag
translated: The Bhagavān, having entered there and become of that nature, with the nature of one taste,🔽without grasping at the supreme of all divisions, is said to be in saṃsāra, together with the bodhisattvas, tathāgatas, yogins and yoginīs, ḍākas and ḍākinīs, mudras, maṇḍalas, and millions of mantras, who are beyond description and even beyond being indescribable.

original: rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang sngags bye ba phrag rnams dang lhan cig tu rnam par rtog pa med kyang sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyi dbang las sems can rnams thams cad la ci bya zhes smra ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o @6a * //
analyzed: rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang sngags bye ba phrag rnams dang lhan cig tu rnam par rtog pa med kyang sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyi dbang las sems can rnams thams cad la ci bya zhes smra ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o @6a * //
translated: Although he is without conceptuality, he remains in the manner of asking, “What can I do for all sentient beings?” due to the power of the impetus of his previous aspirations.

original: zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i don te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /🔽yid bzhin nor bu ltar rtog pa'i //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa / yid bzhin nor bu ltar rtog pa'i //
translated: As it is said:🔽The winds that are like a wish-fulfilling gem

original: rlung rnams kun gyis bskyod bya min //
analyzed: rlung rnams kun gyis bskyod bya min //
translated: are not to be moved by conceptuality.

original: de ltar gnas kyang sems can gyi //
analyzed: de ltar gnas kyang sems can gyi //
translated: Even though he abides in that way,

original: re ba ma lus rdzogs par mdzad //
analyzed: re ba ma lus rdzogs par mdzad //
translated: All hopes are fulfilled.🔽And:

original: ces pa dang / 'khor lo 'khor ba'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: ces pa dang / 'khor lo 'khor ba'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of the revolving wheel,

original: bya ba med pa'i skyob pa la'ang //
analyzed: bya ba med pa'i skyob pa la'ang //
translated: Even to the protector who is without activity,

original: 'du byed 'phen pa'i shugs las ni //
analyzed: 'du byed 'phen pa'i shugs las ni //
translated: By the force of the impulsion of compositional activity,

original: bstan pa yang dag rab 'jug byed //
analyzed: bstan pa yang dag rab 'jug byed //
translated: The teaching is correctly engaged.

original: ces so // gang yang 'dir ae wam gyi yi ge la sogs pa'i don gzhan yang 'dir dang rgyud gzhan rnams su gsungs pa ni bstan pa gzhan kho na yin cing gdul ba'i skye bo rnams kyis gzungs thob pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: ces so // gang yang 'dir ae wam gyi yi ge la sogs pa'i don gzhan yang 'dir dang rgyud gzhan rnams su gsungs pa ni bstan pa gzhan kho na yin cing gdul ba'i skye bo rnams kyis gzungs thob pa'i don du ste /
translated: Also, the other meanings of the syllables evam and so forth that are taught here and in other tantras are other teachings, and they are for the purpose of disciples attaining retention,

original: yi ge gcig tu don gyi phung po chen po 'phangs nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge gcig tu don gyi phung po chen po 'phangs nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a great mass of meaning is implied in a single syllable and retained.

original: de bzhin du de rnams don chen po nyid kyis mchog tu bkra shis pa nyid kyis na rgyud kyi dang por nye bar bstan to zhes kyang gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de rnams don chen po nyid kyis mchog tu bkra shis pa nyid kyis na rgyud kyi dang por nye bar bstan to zhes kyang gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, it is made clear that they are taught at the beginning of the tantra because they are of great meaning and because they are supremely auspicious.

original: 'dir de brjod pa po nyid kyis na 'di rnams sdud pa ru 'thad pa ni ma yin te phan tshun 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir de brjod pa po nyid kyis na 'di rnams sdud pa ru 'thad pa ni ma yin te phan tshun 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is not tenable that the one who speaks of them is the compiler, because mutual connection is not tenable.

original: don de yang dag gzhan rnams su nye bar dmigs par bya ba'o zhes pa 'dir rnam par bshad pa'i 'bad pas ci bya /
analyzed: don de yang dag gzhan rnams su nye bar dmigs par bya ba'o zhes pa 'dir rnam par bshad pa'i 'bad pas ci bya /
translated: And what is the purpose of explaining this, “The meaning is to be observed in other texts”?

original: de ltar dus dang yul dang ston pa po phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar dus dang yul dang ston pa po phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the perfection of time, place, and teacher has been stated.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The perfection of retinue is stated:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug bye ba phrag brgyad cu'i dbus su zhes so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug bye ba phrag brgyad cu'i dbus su zhes so //
translated: “Then, in the center of eight hundred million lords of yoga, the Bhagavān…”

original: rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Yoga is the union of method and wisdom.

original: de la dbang phyug ni dbang 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: de la dbang phyug ni dbang 'byor pa ste /
translated: The lords of that are the powerful ones.

original: de thob pa nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rnams te /
analyzed: de thob pa nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rnams te /
translated: Because they have attained that, they are the lords of yoga.

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams so //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams so //
translated: They are the great bodhisattvas who are the lords of the ten stages.

original: mang po nyid du nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis na rigs mthun pa rnams las rdo rje snying po nges par gzung ba'i don du dang por bstan gyi /
analyzed: mang po nyid du nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis na rigs mthun pa rnams las rdo rje snying po nges par gzung ba'i don du dang por bstan gyi /
translated: Since he is indicated as many, in order to definitely include the vajra essence from among those of the same type, he is taught first.

original: 'khor 'di rnams kho na tsam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khor 'di rnams kho na tsam ni ma yin te /
translated: This retinue is not just that alone,

original: de rnams mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are limitless.

original: gang mjug tu gsung bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang mjug tu gsung bar 'gyur ba /
translated: As will be stated later,

original: de nas rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma dang mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma dang byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs rnam pa du ma ste @6b thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor rnams zhes so //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma dang mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma dang byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs rnam pa du ma ste @6b thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor rnams zhes so //
translated: “Then the yogis and yoginis, dakas and dakinis, and bodhisattvas, eighty million in number, and the assembly of many tathagatas, the entire retinue…”

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi sems mkhyen pa nyid kyis yang dag par sbyor ba nyan pa'i skal ba dang ldan par 'khor rnams rtogs shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi sems mkhyen pa nyid kyis yang dag par sbyor ba nyan pa'i skal ba dang ldan par 'khor rnams rtogs shing /
translated: The bhagavat, with the knowledge of the minds of others, realized that the retinue was fortunate to hear the correct yoga and

original: rdo rje snying po gsol ba 'debs par nus par gzigs nas /
analyzed: rdo rje snying po gsol ba 'debs par nus par gzigs nas /
translated: saw that they were able to supplicate the vajra essence.

original: ma bskul bar gsol ba 'debs pa po med do zhes pas na bskul bar dgongs pas /
analyzed: ma bskul bar gsol ba 'debs pa po med do zhes pas na bskul bar dgongs pas /
translated: Since there is no one who supplicates without being urged, he thinks, I will urge them.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po'i don 'di ni mgo smos pas shes pa kho na'i sems can rnams kyi spyod yul lo zhes gsal bar byed cing 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po'i don 'di ni mgo smos pas shes pa kho na'i sems can rnams kyi spyod yul lo zhes gsal bar byed cing 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: He smiles, illuminating, This meaning of the king of tantras is the domain of only those sentient beings who understand merely through the statement of the topic.

original: mgo smos pas go ba nyid kyis dgongs pa de rtogs nas rdo rje snying pos gsol ba 'debs par zhugs so zhes ston to /
analyzed: mgo smos pas go ba nyid kyis dgongs pa de rtogs nas rdo rje snying pos gsol ba 'debs par zhugs so zhes ston to /
translated: It shows that Vajragarbha, having realized that intention by understanding merely through the statement of the topic, engages in supplicating.

original: mdzad ma thag tu ni bar ma chad par ro //
analyzed: mdzad ma thag tu ni bar ma chad par ro //
translated: Immediately means without interruption.

original: stan las te zla ba'i dkyil 'khor las so //
analyzed: stan las te zla ba'i dkyil 'khor las so //
translated: From the seat means from the moon maṇḍala.

original: sa la zhes pa ni stan la ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa la zhes pa ni stan la ma yin pa'o //
translated: On the ground means not on the seat.

original: 'di yang ma 'ongs pa rnams la yang gsol ba 'debs pa slob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang ma 'ongs pa rnams la yang gsol ba 'debs pa slob pa'o //
translated: This also teaches supplicating for the sake of future [students].

original: gsol ba 'debs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The supplication is stated:

original: nyan par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Listen, and so on.

original: ye shes kyi dbang po zhes pa la ye shes ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad byang chub pa rtogs pa phun sum
analyzed: ye shes kyi dbang po zhes pa la ye shes ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad byang chub pa rtogs pa phun sum
translated: The faculty of exalted wisdom is the exalted wisdom of the five exalted bodies of Vairochana and so forth, which are the nature of the mirror-like exalted wisdom and so forth.

original: tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs pa ste /
translated: Exalted wisdom is the complete realization of all aspects of all phenomena through the perfection of the abandonment of all afflictions together with their predispositions and the perfection of the abandonment of all obstructions to omniscience.

original: de la dbang po ni mchog tu dbang thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po ni mchog tu dbang thob pa'o //
translated: The faculty is the attainment of the highest power.

original: yang na mchog gi dbang phyug thob pa des seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa ston pa po'i tshogs kyi gtsug gi nor bu nyid kyis na dbang po'o //
analyzed: yang na mchog gi dbang phyug thob pa des seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa ston pa po'i tshogs kyi gtsug gi nor bu nyid kyis na dbang po'o //
translated: Alternatively, the faculty is the crest jewel of the assembly of teachers such as Hari, Harihari, and Vasu­garbha, who have attained the highest sovereignty.

original: yang na me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis na ye shes ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams yin la /
analyzed: yang na me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis na ye shes ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams yin la /
translated: Alternatively, the exalted wisdoms such as the mirror-like exalted wisdom are the five exalted bodies of the Tathagatas such as Vairochana.

original: de rnams kyi dbang po bdag po ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbang po bdag po ste /
translated: The faculty is the lord of those exalted wisdoms.

original: de skyed pa po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de skyed pa po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the producer of those exalted wisdoms.

original: de'i phyir bdag lta bu rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i ston pa ni khyod kho na'o zhes pa'i bsam pa ni gsol ba 'debs pa po ye shes kyi dbang po zhes bod pa po'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag lta bu rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i ston pa ni khyod kho na'o zhes pa'i bsam pa ni gsol ba 'debs pa po ye shes kyi dbang po zhes bod pa po'i 'o //
translated: The one who makes this request is called Jnanendvara, the lord of knowledge.

original: ae ma'o rdo rje snying po dris shig ces pa tshig yongs su bsgyur bas 'dri par 'dod pas zhes sbrel lo //
analyzed: ae ma'o rdo rje snying po dris shig ces pa tshig yongs su bsgyur bas 'dri par 'dod pas zhes sbrel lo //
translated: The complete transformation of the words ask the vajra essence is connected with one who wishes to ask.

original: ae ma byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes kyang sbrel bar bya'o //🔽mgo smos @7a * //
analyzed: ae ma byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes kyang sbrel bar bya'o // mgo smos @7a * //
translated: The words amazing great bodhisattva are also to be connected.

original: pas go ba nyid kyis mnyan par 'os pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i nyan pa po rdo rje snying po la sogs pa rnams ngo mtshar gyi spyod yul nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: pas go ba nyid kyis mnyan par 'os pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i nyan pa po rdo rje snying po la sogs pa rnams ngo mtshar gyi spyod yul nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The one who is worthy of listening and is a suitable listener, Vajra Essence and so on, is amazed because of being the domain of amazement.

original: ae ma zhes ngo mtshar bar byas nas bod pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma zhes ngo mtshar bar byas nas bod pa'o //
translated: Having been amazed with amazing, he speaks.

original: rdo rje stong pa nyid ye shes snying po nang du byas pa 'di'i yin pa zhes pa rdo rje snying po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje stong pa nyid ye shes snying po nang du byas pa 'di'i yin pa zhes pa rdo rje snying po'o //
translated: The vajra is the essence of the wisdom of emptiness. His is Vajra Essence.

original: de ltar shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bshad nas thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bshad nas thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: Having thus explained the perfection of wisdom, he speaks of the perfection of compassion.

original: brtse ba chen po legs so legs so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: brtse ba chen po legs so legs so zhes pa ste /
translated: Great compassion, excellent, excellent!

original: snying rje chen po ni shin tu legs pa nyid kyi phyir legs so legs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni shin tu legs pa nyid kyi phyir legs so legs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says excellent, excellent because great compassion is itself excellent.

original: bdag cag ni 'dir zab mo'i chos la skal pa med pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bos zhes dogs pas so so'i skye bo nyan pa po'i bsam pa sgyid lug pa bsal ba'i ched du bod par byed pa ni chen po zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bdag cag ni 'dir zab mo'i chos la skal pa med pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bos zhes dogs pas so so'i skye bo nyan pa po'i bsam pa sgyid lug pa bsal ba'i ched du bod par byed pa ni chen po zhes pa ste /
translated: Since they think, We have not been called by the Lord here because we lack the good fortune for the profound Dharma, he says great in order to remove the dispiritedness of the listeners who are ordinary beings.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub las che ba'i byang chub la sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub las che ba'i byang chub la sems dpa' ste /
translated: A bodhisattva is one who is courageous with regard to enlightenment, which is greater than the enlightenment of sravakas and so on.

original: bsam pa 'di rnams kyi yin pa zhes pas byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams so //
analyzed: bsam pa 'di rnams kyi yin pa zhes pas byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams so //
translated: Those who have this intention are great bodhisattvas.

original: yon tan rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams te de rnams kyi 'byung gnas ni rten rnams so //
analyzed: yon tan rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams te de rnams kyi 'byung gnas ni rten rnams so //
translated: Qualities are powers, fearlessnesses, and so on. Their sources are the supports.

original: tshig gnyis pos ni 'di rnams kyi shes rab dang thugs rje'i rang bzhin nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig gnyis pos ni 'di rnams kyi shes rab dang thugs rje'i rang bzhin nyid gsungs so //
translated: The two words “great” and “secret” indicate the nature of their wisdom and compassion.

original: de ltar shes rab dang thabs gsal bar gyur pa nyid kyis khyed kyang 'di nyan par dbang ba'o zhes gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab dang thabs gsal bar gyur pa nyid kyis khyed kyang 'di nyan par dbang ba'o zhes gsal bar byas so //
translated: Thus, by the clarity of wisdom and means, you are empowered to listen to this.

original: de ltar gyur pa kho na'i gzhan rnams kyang 'di la dbang ba'o zhes kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa kho na'i gzhan rnams kyang 'di la dbang ba'o zhes kyang bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, it is also taught that others are empowered to listen to this tantra.

original: rgyud thams cad la zhes pa /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad la zhes pa /
translated: “ In all tantras” means

original: de rnams la yod pa'i gsang chen yang 'dir dogs pa med pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams la yod pa'i gsang chen yang 'dir dogs pa med pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: that the great secrets that exist in those tantras are expressed here without hesitation.

original: gsang chen rnam pa mang po bshad par bya ba nyid kyis na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsang chen rnam pa mang po bshad par bya ba nyid kyis na gsungs pa /
translated: Since the many kinds of great secrets are to be explained, it is said:

original: de thams cad ces pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad ces pa'o //
translated: “All of them.”

original: bla na med pa'i chos nyan par rung ba nyid kyis bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i chos nyan par rung ba nyid kyis bsngags pa'o //
translated: It is praised because it is suitable to listen to the unsurpassed dharma.

original: rab tu dga' zhing zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu dga' zhing zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “ Very joyful” and so on.

original: rab tu dga' ba kho na las dregs pa med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i ched du yang yang du phyag byas pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba kho na las dregs pa med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i ched du yang yang du phyag byas pa'o //
translated: He prostrates again and again in order to establish that he is not arrogant at all, only in the highest joy.

original: ci zhes pa ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhes pa ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: What? is what is to be expressed.

original: ci ltar zhes pa tshad ma'i rnam pa dris pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes pa tshad ma'i rnam pa dris pa'o //
translated: How? is the question about the form of valid knowledge.

original: ci zhes pa chos rnams thams cad kyi thun mong pa la ste /
analyzed: ci zhes pa chos rnams thams cad kyi thun mong pa la ste /
translated: What? is the commonality of all phenomena.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo ci zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo ci zhig pa'o //
translated: What is its own nature?

original: thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyis gsang chen no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyis gsang chen no //
translated: It is the great secret because it is not the object of all.

original: yang @7b dag sbyor byung zhes pa ni dang po'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa'o //
analyzed: yang @7b dag sbyor byung zhes pa ni dang po'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa'o //
translated: The word correct is added to the first arising.

original: ci ltar zhes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dris pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dris pa'o //
translated: How? is the question about the nature of cause and effect.

original: de la ste yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba las sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba ci ltar dang ci zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de la ste yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba las sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba ci ltar dang ci zhig pa'o //
translated: What? is what becomes the characteristic of the accomplishment from the correct application.

original: thams cad kyang de yin la rgyud rnams kyang yin pas zhes pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyang de yin la rgyud rnams kyang yin pas zhes pa /
translated: Since all are that and also continuums, it says continuums.

original: rgyud ni rgyun rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyun rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: A continuum is the three types of continuity.

original: de skad du yang 'dus pa phyi mar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'dus pa phyi mar gsungs pa /
translated: The Later Guhyasamaja Tantra also says this:

original: rgyud ni rgyun zhes bya bar brjod //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyun zhes bya bar brjod //
translated: Tantra is called a continuum.

original: rgyun de rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyun de rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: That continuum is threefold.🔽It is classified in terms of basis,

original: gzhi dang rang bzhin nyid dang ni //
analyzed: gzhi dang rang bzhin nyid dang ni //
translated: nature, and

original: mi 'phrogs pa yi rab dbye las //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa yi rab dbye las //
translated: incorruptibility.

original: mdor bstan pa'i tshig rnams kyi rgyas par bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'i tshig rnams kyi rgyas par bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: The extensive explanation of the words of the brief presentation is stated:

original: rang bzhin rnam pa rgyu yin te //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam pa rgyu yin te //
translated: The nature is the aspect and the cause;

original: de bzhin mi 'phrogs 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin mi 'phrogs 'bras bu'o //
translated: similarly, the incorruptible is the result.

original: gzhi ni thabs zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: gzhi ni thabs zhes bya ba ste //
translated: The basis is called the method;

original: gsum gyis rgyud kyi don bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gsum gyis rgyud kyi don bsdus pa'o //
translated: the meaning of tantra is summarized by these three.

original: zhes so // dngos po rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo ni rang bzhin dang rnam pa zhes pa don gzhan ma yin te rang gi ngo bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes so // dngos po rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo ni rang bzhin dang rnam pa zhes pa don gzhan ma yin te rang gi ngo bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The empty essence of things is not a different object than the nature and the aspect; it means their own essence.

original: de rgyu ste nye bar len pa'i byed pa po rgyu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de rgyu ste nye bar len pa'i byed pa po rgyu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
translated: That is the cause, the appropriating agent, the causal vajra holder.

original: gang 'di rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dri mas ma gos pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i sangs rgyas nyid de kho na ni dri ma med pa nyid thob pa'i mtshan nyid can sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang 'di rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dri mas ma gos pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i sangs rgyas nyid de kho na ni dri ma med pa nyid thob pa'i mtshan nyid can sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this very Buddhahood, which is not sullied by the stains of beginningless habitual propensities, which is established by own-nature, is the cause of Buddhahood, which is characterized by the attainment of stainlessness.

original: gal te yang ngo bo nyid kyis 'di rnams 'od gsal bar gyur pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang ngo bo nyid kyis 'di rnams 'od gsal bar gyur pa ma yin na /
translated: And if these are not by nature luminous,

original: sol ba bzhin du bkrus kyang dri ma med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sol ba bzhin du bkrus kyang dri ma med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not become stainless even if washed, like coal.

original: de 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated by the noble Maitreya:

original: thams cad la ni khyad med kyang //
analyzed: thams cad la ni khyad med kyang //
translated: Although there is no difference in all,

original: de bzhin nyid ni dag gyur pa //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni dag gyur pa //
translated: when suchness is purified,

original: de bzhin gshegs nyid de yi phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs nyid de yi phyir //
translated: it is the Tathagata. Therefore

original: 'gro kun de yi snying po can //
analyzed: 'gro kun de yi snying po can //
translated: all beings have his essence.

original: zhes so // rgyu de las glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral ba las gang dri ma dang bral ba nyid thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa de ni mi 'phrogs par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes so // rgyu de las glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral ba las gang dri ma dang bral ba nyid thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa de ni mi 'phrogs par brjod par bya ste /
translated: From that cause, the result, which is the vajra-holder of the result, whose nature is the attainment of freedom from the adventitious defilements, should be called “invincible,”

original: bag chags kyi dri ma rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: bag chags kyi dri ma rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: because it is not overcome by the defilements of the latent proclivities.

original: 'phrogs pa ni yang dag par 'phrogs pa ste 'grib pa'am sdud pa'o //
analyzed: 'phrogs pa ni yang dag par 'phrogs pa ste 'grib pa'am sdud pa'o //
translated: “ Overcome” means to be overcome, to diminish, or to be gathered.

original: dri ma med pa nyid thob pa'i thabs te lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ngo bo ni gzhi zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dri ma med pa nyid thob pa'i thabs te lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ngo bo ni gzhi zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The method for attaining the state of being stainless, the cooperative condition, which is of the nature of the creation and completion stages, should be called “the basis,”

original: de la brten nas skye ba dang gnas pa'i phyir na myu gu'i sa gzhi bzhin no //
analyzed: de la brten nas skye ba dang gnas pa'i phyir na myu gu'i sa gzhi bzhin no //
translated: because it is the basis for the arising and abiding of the result, like the ground for a sprout.

original: thabs de yang dngos su ba @8a * //🔽ni phyag rgya chen po 'grub pa'i dus su /
analyzed: thabs de yang dngos su ba @8a * // ni phyag rgya chen po 'grub pa'i dus su /
translated: That method is, in fact,

original: phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor las 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rjes su bsgrub pa ste /
