analyzed: phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor las 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rjes su bsgrub pa ste /
translated: the subsequent practice, which will be explained in the context of the yoga of the consort, at the time of the accomplishment of the great seal.

original: de'i yang dngos su ba'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / de'i ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yang dngos su ba'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / de'i ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The method for that is the completion stage, and that is the generation stage.

original: de'i yan lag rnams ni las rab 'byam dang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i yan lag rnams ni las rab 'byam dang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Its branches are the various activities, the consecration, and so forth.

original: de ltar rgyu'i rgyud dang 'bras bu'i rgyud dang thabs kyi rgyud ces pa rgyud gsum rnams kyis rgyud kyi don khyad par du rtogs par bya ba bsdus so //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu'i rgyud dang 'bras bu'i rgyud dang thabs kyi rgyud ces pa rgyud gsum rnams kyis rgyud kyi don khyad par du rtogs par bya ba bsdus so //
translated: Thus, the meaning of tantra is summarized by the three continuums, which are the causal continuum, the resultant continuum, and the method continuum.

original: 'dus pa la sogs pa rnams zhes pa la 'dus pa ni brjod par bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'dus pa la sogs pa rnams zhes pa la 'dus pa ni brjod par bya ba'i don te /
translated: The “aggregates, and so forth” are the topics to be expressed.

original: de ltar ni 'dus pa phyi mar /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dus pa phyi mar /
translated: Thus, in the Later Guhyasamāja, it states:

original: sku dang gsung thugs rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: sku dang gsung thugs rnam pa gsum //
translated: The three aspects of body, speech, and mind

original: gsang ba zhes par brjod par bya //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes par brjod par bya //
translated: are to be expressed as “secret.”

original: 'dus pa tshogs par rab brjod de //
analyzed: 'dus pa tshogs par rab brjod de //
translated: The gathering is expressed as “assembly,”

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mngon brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mngon brjod pa'o //
translated: and all buddhas are expressed as “manifesting.”

original: zhes so // stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi nyid kyis na /
analyzed: zhes so // stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi nyid kyis na /
translated: Since the wisdom of the single taste of emptiness is the elixir,

original: so sor rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir sku gsung thugs ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: so sor rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir sku gsung thugs ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The three are body, speech, and mind, because of being the nature of the three vajras.

original: skal pa med pa'i skye bo'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gsang ba ste sba bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: skal pa med pa'i skye bo'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gsang ba ste sba bar bya ba'o //
translated: It is secret, to be concealed, because it is not the domain of the experience of ordinary people.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis na 'gro ba'i don gsal bar gyur pa de'i 'dus pa ni bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin bcu gsum pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa la tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis na 'gro ba'i don gsal bar gyur pa de'i 'dus pa ni bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin bcu gsum pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa la tshogs pa ste /
translated: The assembly of that is the assembly of the thirteenth stage of Vajradhara, the nature of great bliss, because of being the nature of all buddhas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de sangs rgyas thams cad mngon rjod byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de sangs rgyas thams cad mngon rjod byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, that is the expression of all buddhas.

original: de bzhin du dpal bde mchog ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal bde mchog ste /
translated: Similarly, it is glorious supreme bliss.

original: shr'i ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin zhing /
analyzed: shr'i ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin zhing /
translated: Śrī is nondual intuition.

original: sham ni bde pa ste /
analyzed: sham ni bde pa ste /
translated: Ca is bliss.

original: khams gsum las 'das pa'i phyir mchog go //
analyzed: khams gsum las 'das pa'i phyir mchog go //
translated: It is supreme because it transcends the three realms.

original: mchog tu bde ba chen po gnyis su med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sku can 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyi bkod pa la mkhas pa'i spyod pa can /
analyzed: mchog tu bde ba chen po gnyis su med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sku can 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyi bkod pa la mkhas pa'i spyod pa can /
translated: He has a body of inconceivable nondual supreme great bliss. He is skilled in the display of various forms such as cakravartins and so on.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun du rtog pa ma lus pa so sor nub kyang ka la ping ka'i ltar snyan pa'i sgras chos bstan pas sa bcu'i dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshim par mdzad cing /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun du rtog pa ma lus pa so sor nub kyang ka la ping ka'i ltar snyan pa'i sgras chos bstan pas sa bcu'i dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshim par mdzad cing /
translated: Although all conceptions together with their imprints have disappeared, he satisfies the bodhisattvas who are lords of the tenth ground with his Dharma teachings, which are like the melodious voice of a kalaviṅka bird.

original: skal pa ji lta bar sprul pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis sa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa sems can gyi phung po ma lus pa smin par mdzad grol bar mdzad pas /
analyzed: skal pa ji lta bar sprul pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis sa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa sems can gyi phung po ma lus pa smin par mdzad grol bar mdzad pas /
translated: In accordance with their fortune, he ripens and liberates the entire mass of sentient beings, such as the lords of the grounds, through various emanations.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i steng 'og min gyi gnas @8b stug po bkod pa rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo can la sogs pa'i ming can gyi khang pa brtsegs par srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bdag nyid can phyag rgya chen po'i
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i steng 'og min gyi gnas @8b stug po bkod pa rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo can la sogs pa'i ming can gyi khang pa brtsegs par srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bdag nyid can phyag rgya chen po'i
translated: In the Akaniṣṭha realm of the Pure Abodes, in the palace called “the summit of the vajra gem,” and so on, he abides in the state of nirvāṇa that does not abide in either existence or peace, the great seal,

original: mtshan gzhan can byang chub chen po mngon du mdzad nas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan gzhan can byang chub chen po mngon du mdzad nas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: which is another name for great awakening.

original: de bzhin du kye rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du kye rdo rje ste /
translated: Similarly, he is Hevajra.

original: he yig gis ni snying rje che //
analyzed: he yig gis ni snying rje che //
translated: The syllable he is great compassion.

original: badzra'ang shes rab brjod par bya //
analyzed: badzra'ang shes rab brjod par bya //
translated: Vajra should be said to be wisdom.

original: snying rje chen po ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje ste /
translated: Great compassion is the compassion that is without reference point, which is the activity for the welfare of all beings without exception.

original: de yang 'dir lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dir lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, here it is the nature of coemergent great bliss.

original: shes rab ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: shes rab ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: Wisdom is the wisdom of emptiness.

original: de yang stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bzhin kho nar rdo rjer brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bzhin kho nar rdo rjer brjod par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, because it is of one taste with emptiness, it should be said to be a vajra, just like emptiness.

original: de ltar na stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa sku bzhi pa kye'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de ltar na stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa sku bzhi pa kye'i rdo rje'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of great bliss, which is of one taste with emptiness, is the four-embodiment Hevajra, which acts for the sake of all migrating beings.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' kho na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ni 'dus pa dang bde mchog dang kye'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis thams cad du brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' kho na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ni 'dus pa dang bde mchog dang kye'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis thams cad du brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, glorious Vajrasattva himself, is the nature of the Guhyasamaja, Heruka, Hevajra, and so forth, and is to be expressed everywhere.

original: thabs dang rgyu yang ngo //
analyzed: thabs dang rgyu yang ngo //
translated: He is the method and the cause.

original: de rjod par byed pa nyid kyis na de ltar tha snyad du byas pa ni gzhung gi rgyud kyi khyad par 'dus pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa nyid kyis na de ltar tha snyad du byas pa ni gzhung gi rgyud kyi khyad par 'dus pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The texts that express him in this way and make such conventions are the special tantras of the scriptures, such as the Guhyasamaja.

original: de rnams kyi gleng gzhi ni thog ma'i rgyu yang dag par sbyor ba rgyu'i rgyud de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gleng gzhi ni thog ma'i rgyu yang dag par sbyor ba rgyu'i rgyud de /
translated: The nidana of those is the cause tantra, the perfect application of the initial cause,

original: gang gi phyir 'di yod pa kho na na thabs kyi rgyud byed pa po 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di yod pa kho na na thabs kyi rgyud byed pa po 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: because only when this exists does the method tantra, the engaging agent, exist.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes de ma thag tu brjod zin to //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes de ma thag tu brjod zin to //
translated: because it would be unreasonable in any other way.

original: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: The correct is the non-erroneous,

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no valid cognition to invalidate it.

original: nges pa ni tshad ma dang lung gis grub pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni tshad ma dang lung gis grub pa'o //
translated: The certain is that which is established by valid cognition and scripture.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: brtse ldan sdug bsngal gzhom don du //🔽thabs rnams la ni mngon sbyor mdzad //
analyzed: brtse ldan sdug bsngal gzhom don du // thabs rnams la ni mngon sbyor mdzad //
translated: the compassionate one, for the sake of destroying suffering,🔽is devoted to the means.

original: thabs byung de rgyu lkog gyur pas //
analyzed: thabs byung de rgyu lkog gyur pas //
translated: The means is hidden from view,

original: de 'chad pa ni dka' phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'chad pa ni dka' phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult to explain.

original: lung dang rigs pas rnam dpyod pas //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas rnam dpyod pas //
translated: By analysis with scripture and reasoning,

original: sdug bsngal rgyu ni yongs su brtag / ces pa'i rigs pa las /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu ni yongs su brtag / ces pa'i rigs pa las /
translated: the cause of suffering is thoroughly investigated.

original: gus pa dang bcas par bar ma chad par dus ring por goms pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum so so rang gis rig par bya bas mngon du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas par bar ma chad par dus ring por goms pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum so so rang gis rig par bya bas mngon du mdzad pa'o //
translated: Through devotion, uninterrupted, for a long time, the Bhagavān actualized it with the intuition of the yogin, which is to be realized personally.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams kho na'i mngon sum gang yin @9a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams kho na'i mngon sum gang yin @9a * //
translated: That which is the intuition of only the Bhagavāns,

original: pa ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i de kho na nyid kyi spyod yul can nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: pa ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i de kho na nyid kyi spyod yul can nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Because it has the domain of the reality of all aspects.

original: de kho na mi slu ba nyid kyis de kho na nyid rnam pa thams cad pa la mi 'khrul ba dngos so //
analyzed: de kho na mi slu ba nyid kyis de kho na nyid rnam pa thams cad pa la mi 'khrul ba dngos so //
translated: By means of that non-deceptive reality, the reality of all aspects is non-erroneously actual.

original: des chos rnams thams cad mtshan nyid med par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: des chos rnams thams cad mtshan nyid med par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: By means of that, the Bhagavān Buddhas know all phenomena to be without characteristics.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It does not follow that the knowledge of all aspects is an entity,

original: de yang chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus shing rang bzhin med pa nyid du de rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus shing rang bzhin med pa nyid du de rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is included among all phenomena and they have fully awakened to its lack of intrinsic nature.

original: de skad du yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects has the characteristic of direct perception.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata has fully and completely awakened to the fact that the Tathāgata is without defining characteristics.

original: zhes so // de'i bstan pa mchog tu che ba'i rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i bstan pa mchog tu che ba'i rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: This is inferred from the greatness of his teaching.🔽The treatise that is not contradicted

original: mthong dang ma mthong ba dag la //
analyzed: mthong dang ma mthong ba dag la //
translated: by what is seen or not seen,

original: rigs pas grub dang rang tshig gis //🔽gnod med bstan bcos gang yin te //
analyzed: rigs pas grub dang rang tshig gis // gnod med bstan bcos gang yin te //
translated: by reasoning or by its own words,

original: gzung bar bya zhes pa'i rigs pa'am /
analyzed: gzung bar bya zhes pa'i rigs pa'am /
translated: should be accepted.

original: lung gis kyang tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis nges pa'o zhes pa'i don to zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lung gis kyang tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis nges pa'o zhes pa'i don to zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the reasoning or the scriptural citation that is ascertained by those who see only a little.

original: 'di gleng gzhi'i sgra'i shugs kyis rtogs par bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'di gleng gzhi'i sgra'i shugs kyis rtogs par bya ba'i don te /
translated: This is the meaning that is to be understood through the power of the statement in the nidāna.

original: cig shos ltar na gnod par byas pa nyid kyis na yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang sgrub par byed pa med pas na ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ci ltar gleng gzhi nyid yin /
analyzed: cig shos ltar na gnod par byas pa nyid kyis na yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang sgrub par byed pa med pas na ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ci ltar gleng gzhi nyid yin /
translated: If it were otherwise, then because it would be contradicted, it would not be correct, and because there would be no proof, it would be uncertain. So how could it be the nidāna?

original: 'di yang phyin ci log pa'i bdag la sogs par lta ba la mngon par zhen pa seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang / dbyig gi snying po rnams kyi yul ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di yang phyin ci log pa'i bdag la sogs par lta ba la mngon par zhen pa seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang / dbyig gi snying po rnams kyi yul ma yin zhing /
translated: This is also not the domain of the lion, the thief, and the heart of wealth, who are attached to the view of a distorted self, and so on.

original: nyan thos gang zag gi bdag med pa nyid mngon sum du byas pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa rnams kyi yang ste /
analyzed: nyan thos gang zag gi bdag med pa nyid mngon sum du byas pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa rnams kyi yang ste /
translated: It is also not the domain of the śrāvakas, who have abandoned the afflictive obstructions by directly realizing the selflessness of persons.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag yod pa'i phyir dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang ste shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig yod pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag yod pa'i phyir dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang ste shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig yod pa'i phyir la /
translated: It is also not the domain of the pratyekabuddhas, because they have one part of the obstruction to omniscience.

original: de'i phyir gsang chen no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsang chen no //
translated: Therefore, it is the great secret.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba 'chad pa ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid ces pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba 'chad pa ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid ces pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the correct application is “the nature of wisdom and method.”

original: shes rab ni stong pa nyid dang de'i ye shes kyang ste stong pa @9b nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab ni stong pa nyid dang de'i ye shes kyang ste stong pa @9b nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom is emptiness and the wisdom of that, because they are of one taste with emptiness.

original: thabs ni dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po 'gro ba'i don byed pa lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thabs ni dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po 'gro ba'i don byed pa lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The method is the great compassion that is without reference points, which benefits migrating beings, and has the nature of the connate great bliss.

original: shes rab dang thabs de dag gnyis su med par gyur pas gang gi bdag nyid de rang bzhin yin pa de ni de skad de /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs de dag gnyis su med par gyur pas gang gi bdag nyid de rang bzhin yin pa de ni de skad de /
translated: Since those two—wisdom and method—are nondual, the nature of that is called “the union of wisdom and method.”

original: yang dag par sbyor ba zung 'jug gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba zung 'jug gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The union of wisdom and method is the essence of union.

original: de skad du yang 'dus pa phyi mar /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'dus pa phyi mar /
translated: In the Later Guhyasamāja, it says:

original: shes rab thabs ni snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: shes rab thabs ni snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: The union of wisdom and method

original: rnal 'byor zhes par mngon par brjod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes par mngon par brjod //
translated: is called “yoga.”

original: rang bzhin med gang shes rab ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin med gang shes rab ste //
translated: The absence of nature is wisdom;

original: thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes so // mchog tu byung ba zhes pa /
analyzed: thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do // zhes so // mchog tu byung ba zhes pa /
translated: method is the characteristics of entities.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams las mchog tu gyur pas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi bdag nyid rnams 'di las byung zhing skyes pas na mchog tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams las mchog tu gyur pas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi bdag nyid rnams 'di las byung zhing skyes pas na mchog tu byung ba'o //
translated: “Supremely arisen” means that because it is supreme compared to the hearers and so on, the qualities of the results—the states of clairvoyance and so on—arise from it.

original: ma ning ni gtsug lag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma ning ni gtsug lag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The neuter is the very scripture.

original: 'dis ni gleng gzhi nyid mngon par gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni gleng gzhi nyid mngon par gsal bar byed do //
translated: This makes clear the very nidana.

original: de kho na'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: yang dag par sbyor ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “rightly applied, etc.”

original: yon tan rnams 'dis yang dag par kun nas 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: yon tan rnams 'dis yang dag par kun nas 'dzin par byed /
translated: By this, the qualities are rightly grasped.

original: yongs su rgyas par byed ces pas ting nge 'dzin te rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rgyas par byed ces pas ting nge 'dzin te rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: They are fully developed, thus it is samadhi, non-conceptuality.

original: 'on kyang sgom pas rnam par g-yeng ba ma lus pa bzlog pas ting nge 'dzin par byed pa la 'di mchog tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgom pas rnam par g-yeng ba ma lus pa bzlog pas ting nge 'dzin par byed pa la 'di mchog tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, since all distraction is stopped by cultivation, it is samadhi.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par byed cing /
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par byed cing /
translated: The mind in equipoise knows things as they are,

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba can du de'i yon tan rnams 'gyur ro zhes ting nge 'dzin gyi sgra brjod pas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba can du de'i yon tan rnams 'gyur ro zhes ting nge 'dzin gyi sgra brjod pas gsal bar byed do //
translated: and its qualities follow from that. Thus, it is made clear by the word samadhi.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsung bar 'gyur ba mtshan nyid ces pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsung bar 'gyur ba mtshan nyid ces pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is said: “the characteristic, etc.”

original: ting nge 'dzin par byed pa kho na las mtshon par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin par byed pa kho na las mtshon par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is only the concentrator that is indicated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: zhes pa'i don to zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to zhes pa ste /
translated: The meaning of that is:

original: 'di ni lhur len pa nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: 'di ni lhur len pa nyid kyi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “endeavor.”

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba'o zhes pa'i don brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba'o zhes pa'i don brjod kyi /
translated: “Arising” means “birth.”

original: 'byung ba dngos po'i rkyen gyi mtha' can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dngos po'i rkyen gyi mtha' can ni ma yin te /
translated: The meaning is expressed, but it is not the end of the condition of the entity of arising.

original: de kho na 'byung ba'o zhes gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na 'byung ba'o zhes gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the same basis as “that itself is arising.”

original: yang na de kho na ste /
analyzed: yang na de kho na ste /
translated: Or, “that itself”

original: yang dag par sbyor ba ni ting nge 'dzin par byed pa las glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral bas mchog tu ste 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du 'byung ba'o zhes pa @10a * //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba ni ting nge 'dzin par byed pa las glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral bas mchog tu ste 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du 'byung ba'o zhes pa @10a * //
translated: is the correct application. It arises as the supreme nature of the result, the vajra holder, by being free from adventitious stains through concentration.

original: mchog tu 'byung ba ste byed pa po la aa tsa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu 'byung ba ste byed pa po la aa tsa'o //
translated: The supreme arising is the agent.

original: de lta bur gyur pa zhes pa bshad zin pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa zhes pa bshad zin pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: “Such” is distinguished by the previously explained distinctions.

original: brtan pa ni ri dang chu klung dang rgya mtsho dang sa gzhi dang rlung la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: brtan pa ni ri dang chu klung dang rgya mtsho dang sa gzhi dang rlung la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: The “stable” are the natures of the world of the environment, such as mountains, rivers, oceans, earth, wind, and so on.

original: g-yo ba ni sems can rnams so //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni sems can rnams so //
translated: The “moving” are the sentient beings.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las byung ngo zhes pas dngos po rnams te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las byung ngo zhes pas dngos po rnams te /
translated: Things arise from the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin de gnyug ma'i ngo bo gang gi bdag nyid de rang gi ngo bo yin pa de ni de'i bdag nyid can te de las gzhan pa'i brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin de gnyug ma'i ngo bo gang gi bdag nyid de rang gi ngo bo yin pa de ni de'i bdag nyid can te de las gzhan pa'i brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of those is the intrinsic essence, which is its own nature. It has that nature because there is no nature of stable and moving things that is other than that.

original: brtan pa la sogs pa rnams ni byis pa rnams kyis kyang rtogs par bya ba nyid na yang de'i rang bzhin 'di rtogs bya ma yin pa nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi cha la ma goms pa las so zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: brtan pa la sogs pa rnams ni byis pa rnams kyis kyang rtogs par bya ba nyid na yang de'i rang bzhin 'di rtogs bya ma yin pa nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi cha la ma goms pa las so zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Although the stable and so on are to be understood even by childish beings, the fact that this nature of theirs is not to be understood is due to lack of familiarity with the aspect of reality.

original: 'di mtshon par bya zhing mngon sum du bya'o zhes pa 'dis te bsgom par bya bzhin pas so zhes pa mtshan nyid do ;
analyzed: 'di mtshon par bya zhing mngon sum du bya'o zhes pa 'dis te bsgom par bya bzhin pas so zhes pa mtshan nyid do ;
translated: This is indicated by this is to be realized and actualized, since it is being cultivated. This is the definition.

original: / ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par sres su dpag pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid la yang sgom pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jug pas mngon du bya ba de bzhin du 'di'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: / ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par sres su dpag pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid la yang sgom pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jug pas mngon du bya ba de bzhin du 'di'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Just as impermanence, etc., are to be realized by the nature of the thing to be inferred, so too is this, he thinks, by the engagement of the nature of cultivation.

original: bshad pa 'di la yang dag par sbyor ba yang de yin la mchog tu byung ba yang yin zhing mtshan nyid kyang ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di la yang dag par sbyor ba yang de yin la mchog tu byung ba yang yin zhing mtshan nyid kyang ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: And this is the correct application, and it is also the supreme, and it is also the definition, he thinks, connecting the words.

original: de ltar rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes 'bras bu'i rgyud gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes 'bras bu'i rgyud gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the effect arises from the cause, he states the effect-continuum.

original: yang na thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Or, everything, etc.

original: tshig gi don rnams ni sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don rnams ni sngar bzhin no //
translated: The meanings of the words are as before.

original: gleng gzhi nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags la sogs pa ston pa'i 'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags la sogs pa ston pa'i 'o //
translated: The setting is the teaching of the mantra, etc., by the Blessed One.

original: rdo rje ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rdo rje ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: The vajra is emptiness, and vajra-holder is the vajra-holder.

original: stong nyid rdo rjer brjod par bya //
analyzed: stong nyid rdo rjer brjod par bya //
translated: is to be called the vajra of emptiness.

original: zhes mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is stated in the Vajra-Tent of the Dakinis.

original: de'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po dang snying rje'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyi sems pa gang gi yin pa de rdo rje sems dpa' ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po dang snying rje'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyi sems pa gang gi yin pa de rdo rje sems dpa' ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The nature of that is the thought of the mind which is the nature of great bliss and compassion. He who has that is Vajrasattva, the Holder of the Vajra.

original: khyad par du gyur pa'i thabs kyis phan btags pa'i rgyus 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed do zhes thabs kyi rgyud gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa'i thabs kyis phan btags pa'i rgyus 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed do zhes thabs kyi rgyud gsungs pa /
translated: The method tantras are stated in order to cause the accomplishment of the result by the cause of the benefit which is the special method.

original: gsang chen zhes pa la sogs pa ste gsang chen ni seng ge dang 'phrog byed la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa sngags dang dkyil 'khor pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gsang chen zhes pa la sogs pa ste gsang chen ni seng ge dang 'phrog byed la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa sngags dang dkyil 'khor pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The great secret, etc. The great secret is the characteristic of the mantra, mandala, etc. which is not the domain of the conduct of Hari, Hara, etc.

original: man ngag gi bya ba las byung ngo zhes pa man @10b ngag las byung ba ste /
analyzed: man ngag gi bya ba las byung ngo zhes pa man @10b ngag las byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from the activity of the precepts. Thus, it is arisen from the precepts.

original: 'dis ni mchog tu 'byung ngo zhes pas na byung ba zhes pa'i don bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mchog tu 'byung ngo zhes pas na byung ba zhes pa'i don bshad do //
translated: This is the meaning of the word arisen, since it arises in the highest degree.

original: yang na byung ba'i sgra'i don ni sngar bzhin te /
analyzed: yang na byung ba'i sgra'i don ni sngar bzhin te /
translated: Or, the meaning of the word “arising” is as before.

original: de'i yang sngags la sogs pa rnams thabs nyid du don gyi shugs kyis thob pa nyid kyi phyir 'dir byung ba'i sgras gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i yang sngags la sogs pa rnams thabs nyid du don gyi shugs kyis thob pa nyid kyi phyir 'dir byung ba'i sgras gsungs so //
translated: And, since the mantras and so forth are obtained by the power of the meaning as the method, here the word “arising” is used.

original: sogs pa'i sgra las rab 'byam dang dam tshig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra las rab 'byam dang dam tshig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word “and so forth” includes the tantra, the pledge, and so forth.

original: mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i don ni sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i don ni sngar bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the word “definition” is as before.

original: bshad pa 'di la yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba ni yang dag sbyor byung ste /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di la yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba ni yang dag sbyor byung ste /
translated: In this explanation, “arising from correct application” is “arising from correct application.”

original: de yang yin la mtshan nyid kyang ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang yin la mtshan nyid kyang ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: And that is also a definition, so the words are combined.

original: de ltar gyur na rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi yang dag par sbyor ba yang yin la /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi yang dag par sbyor ba yang yin la /
translated: If that is the case, then the introduction to all tantras is correct application,🔽and the definition that arises from the great secret is also that.

original: gsang chen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ngo zhes don gnyis kyi rjes su mthun par bshad pa na don gcig go zhes pa don gsum ni /
analyzed: gsang chen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ngo zhes don gnyis kyi rjes su mthun par bshad pa na don gcig go zhes pa don gsum ni /
translated: When the explanation is in accordance with the two meanings, the single meaning is the three meanings.

original: thams cad ces pa la sogs pa'i ngag lan gnyis bzlas pas gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad ces pa la sogs pa'i ngag lan gnyis bzlas pas gsungs te /
translated: The reply to that is stated by the verse beginning with “all” and so forth.

original: don gsum po 'di de ni shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: don gsum po 'di de ni shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: This triad of topics is the nature of wisdom and method.

original: de kho na rgyud do zhes pas gtso bor bla na med pa'i thabs kyi cha gsal bar byed pa'i phyir rgyud kyi don ni phul du byung ba dang bcas par gsungs te /
analyzed: de kho na rgyud do zhes pas gtso bor bla na med pa'i thabs kyi cha gsal bar byed pa'i phyir rgyud kyi don ni phul du byung ba dang bcas par gsungs te /
translated: Since it is stated that “that is the tantra,” the meaning of tantra is stated along with the most excellent, because it primarily clarifies the aspect of unsurpassed method.

original: 'dir phyag rgya chen po dang yang dag par sbyor ba mchog gi go 'phang gi ngo bo rnams kho na dang sangs rgyas thams cad kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir phyag rgya chen po dang yang dag par sbyor ba mchog gi go 'phang gi ngo bo rnams kho na dang sangs rgyas thams cad kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the nature of the state of supreme union with the great seal and all buddhas are explained.

original: shes rab kyi cha ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul dang thun mong ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi cha ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul dang thun mong ba ste /
translated: The aspect of wisdom is common to the perfection vehicle,

original: ye shes kyi sku ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi khyad par dang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi khyad par dang ngo //
translated: and the jñānakāya is the distinction of yoga tantra.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i bde ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i bde ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: The bliss of the great seal is not common.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi tshig gi don brjod pas ni shes rab kyi de kho na nyid kyang gtso bor 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi tshig gi don brjod pas ni shes rab kyi de kho na nyid kyang gtso bor 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the expression of the meaning of the words of the Yoga Tantra, the reality of wisdom is also explained as the principal [topic].

original: bdag gis te rdo rje sems dpa' bdag nyid kho nas skal pa dang ldan pa'i gdul bya rnams la so sor rtog pa'i bsam pas gzhag pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i 'phen pa las /
analyzed: bdag gis te rdo rje sems dpa' bdag nyid kho nas skal pa dang ldan pa'i gdul bya rnams la so sor rtog pa'i bsam pas gzhag pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i 'phen pa las /
translated: By me, by Vajrasattva himself, for the fortunate disciples, by the intention of discernment, the explanation, which is projected from the fully ripened impetus of the latent tendencies that are placed,

original: bshad pa ste nang gi de kho na nyid dang phyi'i de kho na nyid kyis bshad bzhin pa ni /
analyzed: bshad pa ste nang gi de kho na nyid dang phyi'i de kho na nyid kyis bshad bzhin pa ni /
translated: is the inner reality and the outer reality.

original: mchog tu tshad ma'i skyes bus byas pa nyid kyi phyir mi slu ba nyid kyis na the tshom dang phyin ci log dag mi bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu tshad ma'i skyes bus byas pa nyid kyi phyir mi slu ba nyid kyis na the tshom dang phyin ci log dag mi bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since it is made by the supreme authoritative person, it is non-deceptive. Therefore, one should not have doubt or misconception, is the thought.

original: dgongs pa 'di kho na man ngag las byung ba'i sgra yis rtogs @11a * //
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di kho na man ngag las byung ba'i sgra yis rtogs @11a * //
translated: This very intention is understood by the sound that arises from the esoteric instructions.

original: kyang slar yang 'dir rtogs par byas pa ni /
analyzed: kyang slar yang 'dir rtogs par byas pa ni /
translated: But it is understood again here.

original: ci ltar yang yid ches par dka' ba'i 'jig rten yid ches par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar yang yid ches par dka' ba'i 'jig rten yid ches par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: In whatever way, the world that is difficult to believe will come to believe.

original: gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' mang po rnams kyis zhus mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' mang po rnams kyis zhus mod kyi /
translated: Although many Bodhisattvas have requested,

original: de ltar yang gsol ba 'debs pa po gtso bo nyid kyi phyir nyon zhes gcig gi tshig ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsol ba 'debs pa po gtso bo nyid kyi phyir nyon zhes gcig gi tshig ste /
translated: still, because he is the principal supplicant, he says, “Listen!” with the word “one.”

original: gzhan rnams rnam par gcod pa ni ma yin no //🔽chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bsgom pa kho nas thog ma med pa'i skye ba brgyud par bsags pa'i dri ma rtsad nas phyung bas tha mal pa'i phung por 'dzin pa spong ba sngon du 'gro bar bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag gis
analyzed: gzhan rnams rnam par gcod pa ni ma yin no // chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bsgom pa kho nas thog ma med pa'i skye ba brgyud par bsags pa'i dri ma rtsad nas phyung bas tha mal pa'i phung por 'dzin pa spong ba sngon du 'gro bar bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag gis
translated: It is not that the others are excluded.🔽By the mere meditation on the absence of intrinsic reality of all phenomena, the stains accumulated in the beginningless continuum of births are uprooted, and the ordinary apprehension of the aggregates is abandoned.

original: lha bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: lha bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: One should meditate on the deity by way of the creation and completion stages, which are preceded by the abandonment of the ordinary apprehension of the aggregates.

original: dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is stated in the line:🔽“First, the meditation on emptiness.”

original: stong nyid ni rang bzhin med pa nyid de 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: stong nyid ni rang bzhin med pa nyid de 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Emptiness is the absence of intrinsic reality, which is clear light.

original: dri ma rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams te /
analyzed: dri ma rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams te /
translated: The stains are the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de rnams kyis lus gos pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis lus gos pa'o //
translated: The body is covered by them.

original: de dang ldan pa rnams kyi khams bco brgyad rnams stong nyid du rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa rnams kyi khams bco brgyad rnams stong nyid du rnam par bsams te /
translated: Those who possess that, having contemplated the eighteen elements as emptiness,

original: gos rnams ltar bkrus nas te bsam pa gtso bo nyid las bkrus par byas nas lha bsgom par bya'o zhes lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gos rnams ltar bkrus nas te bsam pa gtso bo nyid las bkrus par byas nas lha bsgom par bya'o zhes lhag ma'o //
translated: having washed the clothes, having washed them due to the primacy of the thought, should meditate on the deity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyas par ston te /
translated: Therefore, it is taught extensively:

original: gzugs khams zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs khams zhes pa'o //
translated: The form element.

original: r'u pa gnod pa la skad kyi byings te gzugs su byed rang la pha rol 'jug pa la gnod par byed do zhes pa gzugs te dkar po dang ser po la sogs pa dang ring po dang thung du la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: r'u pa gnod pa la skad kyi byings te gzugs su byed rang la pha rol 'jug pa la gnod par byed do zhes pa gzugs te dkar po dang ser po la sogs pa dang ring po dang thung du la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verbal root ru means to harm. Form is that which harms itself and engages with others. It is white, yellow, and so on, and long, short, and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed do zhes pa khams so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed do zhes pa khams so //
translated: It is an element because it holds its own characteristics.

original: gzugs kyang de yin la khams kyang zhes pa gzugs khams te des so //
analyzed: gzugs kyang de yin la khams kyang zhes pa gzugs khams te des so //
translated: It is form and it is an element, thus it is the form element.

original: gzugs khams kyi zhes pa gsum pas gzugs te /
analyzed: gzugs khams kyi zhes pa gsum pas gzugs te /
translated: The third case is used for the form element.

original: gtsug lag nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bos don dam par gzugs kyi khams kyis stong pa rnams zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gtsug lag nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bos don dam par gzugs kyi khams kyis stong pa rnams zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Because of the very nature of the scriptures. The meaning is: they are empty of the form realm in the ultimate, by way of their own nature.

original: kun rdzob tu yang gzugs med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang gzugs med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not formless even conventionally.

original: de'i zhes pa de'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa de'o //
translated: The word “its” refers to that.

original: nyid kyi sgra ni bzhin gyi don la ste /
analyzed: nyid kyi sgra ni bzhin gyi don la ste /
translated: The word “itself” has the meaning of “in the same way as.”

original: gzugs kyi khams bzhin du sgra yang stong par bla mas slob ma la byed du gzhug go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams bzhin du sgra yang stong par bla mas slob ma la byed du gzhug go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: just as the form realm, so sound is also empty. The guru should make the disciple practice.

original: 'di gsal bar byed cing sgra'i khams shes pa la sogs pa dkyus ma'i don dang 'brel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di gsal bar byed cing sgra'i khams shes pa la sogs pa dkyus ma'i don dang 'brel bar byed do //
translated: This clarifies it and connects it with the meaning of the text, the knowledge of the sound element, and so on.

original: yid ces pa yid kyi yul chos kyi khams te @11b yul can gyis yul bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ces pa yid kyi yul chos kyi khams te @11b yul can gyis yul bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “mind” refers to the element of mental objects, the object of the mind, because the object is taught by the subject.

original: de bzhin du phyi mar yang ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi mar yang ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the latter in the same way, as is appropriate.

original: mig bdag nyid ces bya zhes pa 'dis rang gi ngo bos stong pa rnams la rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig bdag nyid ces bya zhes pa 'dis rang gi ngo bos stong pa rnams la rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The words “the eye itself” refer to the consciousnesses of those that are empty of their own nature.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul dang dbang po dag stong pa dag gi dbus su rnam shes ci ltar mi stong par 'gyur te stong pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul dang dbang po dag stong pa dag gi dbus su rnam shes ci ltar mi stong par 'gyur te stong pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: How could consciousness be non-empty in the middle of the empty objects and faculties? It is only empty.

original: yid ni dbang po dang phyi rol ni yul chos kyi khams te /
analyzed: yid ni dbang po dang phyi rol ni yul chos kyi khams te /
translated: The mind is the faculty and the external is the object, the element of mental objects.

original: de dag gis stong pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gis stong pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: They are empty of those.

original: nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The summary is “Therefore, etc.”

original: yang yig gis rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang yig gis rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The word “also” refers to consciousness.

original: myong ba po yang shes pa'i yang gis de'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: myong ba po yang shes pa'i yang gis de'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The experiencer is also consciousness. The word “also” refers to its consciousness.

original: sems ni yid kyi dbang po dang de'i spyod yul ni sems las byung ba ste /
analyzed: sems ni yid kyi dbang po dang de'i spyod yul ni sems las byung ba ste /
translated: The mind is the mental faculty and its domain is mental factors.

original: yang gis de'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang gis de'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The word “also” refers to its consciousness.

original: yang na gzugs la sogs pa rnams yul lnga rnams dang / lta ba po la sogs pa rnams ni de'i yul can dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: yang na gzugs la sogs pa rnams yul lnga rnams dang / lta ba po la sogs pa rnams ni de'i yul can dbang po rnams te /
translated: Alternatively, the five objects such as form and so on are the five objects, and the viewers and so on are the faculties that are their subjects.

original: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed kyi phung po sems kyi khyad par rnams ni sems las byung ba chos kyi khams yul drug pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed kyi phung po sems kyi khyad par rnams ni sems las byung ba chos kyi khams yul drug pa'o //
translated: The aggregates of feeling, perception, and formations that are associated with the mind and the specific mental factors are the mental constituents and the six object constituents.

original: sems ni yul drug gi rnam par shes pa rnams te yid kyi dbang po yang ngo //
analyzed: sems ni yul drug gi rnam par shes pa rnams te yid kyi dbang po yang ngo //
translated: The mind is the six consciousnesses of the six sense objects and also the mental faculty.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po bzhin du logs su med kyi /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po bzhin du logs su med kyi /
translated: The mental faculty does not exist separately from the sense faculties such as the eyes, etc.

original: 'das ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa kho na ni rnam par shes pa'i khyad par phyi ma bskyed pa'i bdag po nyid kyi phyir yid kyi dbang por brjod do //
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa kho na ni rnam par shes pa'i khyad par phyi ma bskyed pa'i bdag po nyid kyi phyir yid kyi dbang por brjod do //
translated: However, the immediately past consciousness is called the mental faculty because it is the dominant condition for the subsequent specific consciousness.

original: de ltar khams bco brgyad rnams brjod de /
analyzed: de ltar khams bco brgyad rnams brjod de /
translated: Thus, the eighteen constituents are described.

original: gzugs kyi khams dang mig gi khams dag dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang mig gi khams dag dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas /
translated: The form constituent and the eye constituent and the eye-consciousness constituent,

original: ji srid du chos kyi khams dang yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar ro //
analyzed: ji srid du chos kyi khams dang yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar ro //
translated: up to the phenomena constituent and the mind constituent and the mind-consciousness constituent.

original: rnam par shes pa drug rnams yid kyi skye mched kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug rnams yid kyi skye mched kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis te /
translated: The twelve sense bases are the six sense faculties and the six sense objects.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched dang mig gi skye mched nas ji srid du chos kyi skye mched dang yid kyi skye mched ces pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched dang mig gi skye mched nas ji srid du chos kyi skye mched dang yid kyi skye mched ces pa'i bar ro //
translated: The sense base of form and the sense base of eye, up to the sense base of mental objects and the sense base of mind.

original: dbang po lnga rnams dang yul lnga rnams kyang gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga rnams dang yul lnga rnams kyang gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: The five sense faculties and the five sense objects are the form aggregate.

original: dbang po lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The five consciousnesses of the sense faculties are the consciousness aggregate.

original: de las gzhan pa rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pa'i khyad par rnams ni 'du byed kyi @12a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pa'i khyad par rnams ni 'du byed kyi @12a * //
translated: The other consciousnesses and the specific states of consciousness are the formation aggregate.

original: phung po'o // tshor ba dang 'du shes kyi phung po dag ni sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi phung po kho na'i rab tu dbye ba dag ste /
analyzed: phung po'o // tshor ba dang 'du shes kyi phung po dag ni sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi phung po kho na'i rab tu dbye ba dag ste /
translated: The aggregates of feeling and conceptualization are just the divisions of the aggregate of mental formations that are mental factors.

original: 'khor ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir logs pa brjod pa dag go //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir logs pa brjod pa dag go //
translated: They are separately mentioned because they are the root causes of samsara.

original: de la tshim par byed pa dang yongs su gdung bar byed pa dang de gnyig las grol ba'i rang gi yul gyi rang gi ngo bo mngon du bya bas yul nyams su myong ba rnam par shes pa'i nyams su myong ba'i rig pa ni tshor ba zhes brjod
analyzed: de la tshim par byed pa dang yongs su gdung bar byed pa dang de gnyig las grol ba'i rang gi yul gyi rang gi ngo bo mngon du bya bas yul nyams su myong ba rnam par shes pa'i nyams su myong ba'i rig pa ni tshor ba zhes brjod
translated: The experience of the object by the consciousness is called feeling vedanā, because it satisfies or torments or liberates from both.

original: do // mtshan ma ste lto che ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par sems las byung ba'i chos gang gis 'dzin cing 'dus te shes la ye shes la yongs su gcod par byed pa de ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can 'du shes zhes brjod do //
analyzed: do // mtshan ma ste lto che ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par sems las byung ba'i chos gang gis 'dzin cing 'dus te shes la ye shes la yongs su gcod par byed pa de ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can 'du shes zhes brjod do //
translated: The mental factor that apprehends and cognizes the specific characteristics of the object, such as the pot’s bulbousness, and determines it through wisdom is called discernment saṃjñā.🔽Other mental factors such as intention and so on are the formation aggregate.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba sems pa la sogs rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o zhes pa phung po lnga rnams te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba sems pa la sogs rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o zhes pa phung po lnga rnams te /
translated: This is the five aggregates.

original: thub pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan du rab tu spros zin no //
analyzed: thub pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan du rab tu spros zin no //
translated: This has been extensively explained in the Ornament of the Sage’s Thought.

original: de ltar khams bco brgyad po rnams kho na chos thams cad de /
analyzed: de ltar khams bco brgyad po rnams kho na chos thams cad de /
translated: Thus the eighteen constituents are all phenomena.

original: de rnams de kho na nyid du na rang bzhin med pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: de rnams de kho na nyid du na rang bzhin med pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Those are said to be, in reality, devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is also said:

original: brtag pa gnyis par gsungs pa /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis par gsungs pa /
translated: In the second examination:

original: dbang po dang ni yul nyid dang // dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid //🔽rnal 'byor ma rnams go bya'i ched //
analyzed: dbang po dang ni yul nyid dang // dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid // rnal 'byor ma rnams go bya'i ched //
translated: The faculties, the objects, and the consciousnesses of the faculties,🔽are explained as the eighteen elements

original: khams ni bco brgyad rnams su bshad //
analyzed: khams ni bco brgyad rnams su bshad //
translated: for the sake of understanding the yoginīs.

original: rang bzhin gdod nas ma skyes pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin gdod nas ma skyes pa //
translated: Their nature is primordially unborn.

original: bden min brdzun min de bzhin du //
analyzed: bden min brdzun min de bzhin du //
translated: They are neither true nor false.

original: thams cad chu yi zla ba ltar //
analyzed: thams cad chu yi zla ba ltar //
translated: Like the moon in the water,

original: 'dod pas rnal 'byor mas shes gyis //
analyzed: 'dod pas rnal 'byor mas shes gyis //
translated: all things should be understood by the yoginī through desire.

original: zhes so // 'di ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par ma shes nas gal te chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin na 'on med pa nyid kyi mthar lhung ngo zhes pas stong pa nyid rnam par bsams pas ci'i phyir dri ma med pa'i bdag nyid kyi dag
analyzed: zhes so // 'di ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par ma shes nas gal te chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin na 'on med pa nyid kyi mthar lhung ngo zhes pas stong pa nyid rnam par bsams pas ci'i phyir dri ma med pa'i bdag nyid kyi dag
translated: If one does not understand this as it is, then, thinking that the nature of all phenomena is emptiness, one will fall to the extreme of nonexistence.

original: pa yin zhes rgol ba'i bsam pa ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo la ldem por dgongs pas rdo rje snying po'i lan glan pa'i ched du stong pa nyid kyis de ma thag par lha'i rnal 'byor phyogs tsam ston pa gsungs pa /🔽nyon zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽ji lta bar khyad par gang gis tshol bar byed rnam par sems par byed bsgom par bya ba'o zhes pa lam mo //
analyzed: pa yin zhes rgol ba'i bsam pa ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo la ldem por dgongs pas rdo rje snying po'i lan glan pa'i ched du stong pa nyid kyis de ma thag par lha'i rnal 'byor phyogs tsam ston pa gsungs pa / nyon zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // ji lta bar khyad par gang gis tshol bar byed rnam par sems par byed bsgom par bya ba'o zhes pa lam mo //
translated: The reply to the vajra core is the teaching of a mere portion of the deity yoga immediately after the emptiness, for the sake of the future generation who will have the thought of refuting it is not so.

original: de de ltar nyon zhes phyi ma dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: de de ltar nyon zhes phyi ma dang 'brel lo //
translated: The reply to the vajra core is the teaching of a mere portion of the deity yoga immediately after the emptiness, for the sake of the future generation who will have the thought of refuting it is not so.🔽 The reply to the vajra core is the teaching of a mere portion of the deity yoga immediately after the emptiness, for the sake of the future generation who will have the thought of refuting it is not so.

original: @12b de'i khyad par gsungs pa gnyis med ces pa gnyis yod pa ma yin pa nyid ni gnyis med de /🔽gang gi phyir na gnyis spangs pa ste /
analyzed: @12b de'i khyad par gsungs pa gnyis med ces pa gnyis yod pa ma yin pa nyid ni gnyis med de / gang gi phyir na gnyis spangs pa ste /
translated: The reply to the vajra core is the teaching of a mere portion of the deity yoga immediately after the emptiness, for the sake of the future generation who will have the thought of refuting it is not so.

original: gnyis te yod pa dang med pa la sogs spangs shing por la bkag pa ste /🔽yod pa ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis te yod pa dang med pa la sogs spangs shing por la bkag pa ste /🔽yod pa ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The reply to the vajra core is the teaching of a mere portion of the deity yoga immediately after the emptiness, for the sake of the future generation who will have the thought of refuting it is

original: 'o na gnyis dang bral ba dbu mar gyur pa'i sems tsam yang sna tshogs pa'i mdo sder gsungs pa med dam ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gnyis dang bral ba dbu mar gyur pa'i sems tsam yang sna tshogs pa'i mdo sder gsungs pa med dam ci zhe na /
translated: But, one might ask, are not the sūtras that teach the mind only, which is the middle free from the two extremes, also diverse?

original: med de gang gi phyir kun rdzob tu bcom ldan 'das kyis sems tsam nyid du bstan gyi don dam par yod pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med de gang gi phyir kun rdzob tu bcom ldan 'das kyis sems tsam nyid du bstan gyi don dam par yod pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are not, because the Transcendent Conqueror taught mind only conventionally, not ultimately.

original: mdo gzhan du de yang rang bzhin med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo gzhan du de yang rang bzhin med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, in other sūtras, he also established that even mind only lacks intrinsic existence.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs par gsungs pa /
translated: As the Marvelous Array of Gems says:

original: 'od srungs sems ni yongs su btsal bar bya na mi rnyed do //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni yongs su btsal bar bya na mi rnyed do //
translated: Kāśyapa, if you search for the mind, you will not find it.

original: gang ma rnyed pa de ni nye bar mi dmigs so //🔽gang nye bar ma dmigs pa de ni 'das pa yang ma yin ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: gang ma rnyed pa de ni nye bar mi dmigs so // gang nye bar ma dmigs pa de ni 'das pa yang ma yin ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: What is not found is not observed.

original: da ltar byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ma yin te /
translated: What is not observed does not pass beyond the past, future, and present.

original: de ni dus gsum las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dus gsum las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: It does not transcend the three times.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not existent and is not nonexistent.

original: gang yod pa ma yin med pa ma yin pa ste ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin med pa ma yin pa ste ma skyes pa'o //
translated: That which is neither existent nor nonexistent is unborn.

original: gang ma skyes pa de la rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa de la rang bzhin med do //
translated: That which is unborn has no intrinsic nature.

original: gang la rang bzhin med pa de la skye ba med do //
analyzed: gang la rang bzhin med pa de la skye ba med do //
translated: That which has no intrinsic nature has no arising.

original: gang la skye ba med pa de la 'gag pa med do ;
analyzed: gang la skye ba med pa de la 'gag pa med do ;
translated: That which has no arising has no cessation.

original: / gang la 'gag pa med pa de la bral ba med cing 'bral ba la ni 'gro ba med /
analyzed: / gang la 'gag pa med pa de la bral ba med cing 'bral ba la ni 'gro ba med /
translated: That which has no cessation has no separation. Separation has no going,

original: 'ong ba med /
analyzed: 'ong ba med /
translated: no coming,

original: 'chi 'pho ba med /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba med /
translated: no death,

original: skye ba med do //
analyzed: skye ba med do //
translated: and no birth.

original: gang la 'gro ba med 'ong ba med 'chi 'pho ba med skye ba med pa de la 'du byed 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang la 'gro ba med 'ong ba med 'chi 'pho ba med skye ba med pa de la 'du byed 'ga' yang med do //
translated: That which has no going, no coming, no death, and no birth has no formations at all.

original: gang la 'du byed 'ga' yang med pa de 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang la 'du byed 'ga' yang med pa de 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: That which has no formations at all is unconditioned.

original: gang 'dus ma byas pa de 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs so zhes rgyas par ro //
analyzed: gang 'dus ma byas pa de 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs so zhes rgyas par ro //
translated: That which is unconditioned is the family of the noble ones.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di nyid du gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di nyid du gang gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said in the same text:

original: 'od srungs rtag ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go //
analyzed: 'od srungs rtag ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go //
translated: Kāśyapa, this “permanent” is one extreme.

original: mi rtag go zhes pa 'di ni mtha' gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag go zhes pa 'di ni mtha' gnyis pa'o //
translated: This “impermanent” is the second extreme.

original: 'od srungs de bzhin du yod ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs de bzhin du yod ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, likewise, this is one extreme to say “it exists.”

original: med ces pa mtha' gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: med ces pa mtha' gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second extreme to say “it does not exist.”

original: gang mtha' 'di dag gi dbus ni dpyad du med pa bstan du med pa rab tu mi gnas pa gnang ba med pa rnam par rig pa ma yin pa gnas med pa ste /
analyzed: gang mtha' 'di dag gi dbus ni dpyad du med pa bstan du med pa rab tu mi gnas pa gnang ba med pa rnam par rig pa ma yin pa gnas med pa ste /
translated: The middle way between these two extremes is this: the middle way is not investigated, is not shown, does not abide, is not given, is not cognized, and is not a basis.

original: 'di ni dbu ma'i lam du brjod par bya ste /🔽chos rnams kyi @13a * //
analyzed: 'di ni dbu ma'i lam du brjod par bya ste / chos rnams kyi @13a * //
translated: This is called the middle way.

original: yang dag pa so sor rtog pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa so sor rtog pa'o zhes so //
translated: It is the correct discernment of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings de yang 'di'o zhes rang gis nges bar dpyad par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir dpyad du med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de yang 'di'o zhes rang gis nges bar dpyad par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir dpyad du med pa'o //
translated: The dharmadhātu is not investigated because it cannot be ascertained by oneself as “this is it.”

original: pha rol po rnams la bstan par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol po rnams la bstan par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir bstan du med pa'o //
translated: It is not shown because it cannot be shown to others.

original: nang gi khams dang skye mched kyi ngo bor mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir rab tu mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi khams dang skye mched kyi ngo bor mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir rab tu mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It does not abide because it does not abide in the nature of the inner elements and sense bases.

original: phyi'i khams dang skye mched bzhin du snang nas mi rtogs pa'i phyir snang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i khams dang skye mched bzhin du snang nas mi rtogs pa'i phyir snang ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not manifest because it is not realized as being like the outer elements and sense bases.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang gi ngo bo las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rig pa ma yin pa'o ;
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang gi ngo bo las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rig pa ma yin pa'o ;
translated: Because it is beyond the nature of the eye consciousness element, and so on, it is not consciousness.

original: /'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mtha' dag gi gnas ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gnas med pa'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: /'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mtha' dag gi gnas ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gnas med pa'o zhes brjod do //
translated: Because it is not the abode of all the afflictions, such as attachment, it is said to be without abode.

original: gal te dbus su rang gi sems kyi ngo bo'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po don dam pa cung zad yod par gyur na de'i tshe de yod do de med do zhes pa'am rtag go zhes pa'am mi rtag go zhes mngon par zhen pa mthar ci ltar 'gyur
analyzed: gal te dbus su rang gi sems kyi ngo bo'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po don dam pa cung zad yod par gyur na de'i tshe de yod do de med do zhes pa'am rtag go zhes pa'am mi rtag go zhes mngon par zhen pa mthar ci ltar 'gyur
translated: If there were some ultimate entity that is the nature of one’s mind in the middle, then how could one conceive of it as “it exists,” “it does not exist,” “it is permanent,” or “it is impermanent”?

original: ji srid du dngos po'i don gyi de kho na nyid kyi rjes su song ba na yid la byed pa tshul bzhin pa kho na ni lhung ba'i gnas so zhes rigs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ji srid du dngos po'i don gyi de kho na nyid kyi rjes su song ba na yid la byed pa tshul bzhin pa kho na ni lhung ba'i gnas so zhes rigs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: As long as one does not follow the suchness of the meaning of entities, it is not reasonable to say that the proper mental activity is a place of falling.

original: brtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid las ma gtogs pa dngos po'i rnam pa gzhan gang dngos po'i de kho na nyid du 'gyur ba yang med do //
analyzed: brtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid las ma gtogs pa dngos po'i rnam pa gzhan gang dngos po'i de kho na nyid du 'gyur ba yang med do //
translated: And there is no other aspect of a thing that could be the reality of a thing apart from its being imagined and so on.

original: dbus na dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo med na don med do zhes 'dzin pa yang mtha' ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dbus na dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo med na don med do zhes 'dzin pa yang mtha' ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the intrinsic reality of a thing does not exist in the middle, then the apprehension of it as pointless would be an extreme.

original: de mi rigs te med ces bya bar nges par 'dzin pa ni yod par 'dzin pa med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir te yul med pa'i dgag pa yod pa ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de mi rigs te med ces bya bar nges par 'dzin pa ni yod par 'dzin pa med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir te yul med pa'i dgag pa yod pa ni ma yin pas so //
translated: That is not reasonable, because the apprehension of the ascertainment that it does not exist does not occur without the apprehension that it exists, because a negation without an object does not exist.

original: 'phags pa klu'i rgyal po rgya mtshos zhus par yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu'i rgyal po rgya mtshos zhus par yang gsungs pa /
translated: The noble Multitude of Jewels Sūtra also says,

original: sngon mtha' stong zhing phyi ma'i mtha' stong dang // skye 'jig gnas pa'i dngos po stong pa ste //
analyzed: sngon mtha' stong zhing phyi ma'i mtha' stong dang // skye 'jig gnas pa'i dngos po stong pa ste //
translated: The prior limit is empty, the later limit is empty, and things that arise and disintegrate are empty.

original: 'di la dngos po yod min dngos med min //
analyzed: 'di la dngos po yod min dngos med min //
translated: Here there is no existent thing, nor a non-existent thing.

original: chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are empty by nature.

original: zhes so // 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The noble Nāgārjuna also says,

original: yod ces pa ni rtag par 'dzin //
analyzed: yod ces pa ni rtag par 'dzin //
translated: To say “it exists” is to grasp permanence.

original: med ces pa ni chad par blta //🔽de phyir yod nyid med nyid la //
analyzed: med ces pa ni chad par blta // de phyir yod nyid med nyid la //
translated: To say “it does not exist” is to view nihilism.🔽Therefore, the wise do not abide

original: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: in existence or nonexistence.

original: zhes so // dbu @13b mar 'dzin pa yang 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis /
analyzed: zhes so // dbu @13b mar 'dzin pa yang 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis /
translated: Āryadeva’s feet also refute grasping the middle:

original: yod dang med pa las grol ba //
analyzed: yod dang med pa las grol ba //
translated: Liberated from existence and nonexistence,

original: dbu ma nyid du gang rtog pa //🔽dbu mar mngon par zhen pa 'di //
analyzed: dbu ma nyid du gang rtog pa // dbu mar mngon par zhen pa 'di //
translated: whatever is imagined as the middle🔽is the clinging to the middle.

original: sgyu ma'i rang gi mtshan nyid min //🔽zhes bkag go //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang gi mtshan nyid min // zhes bkag go //
translated: This is not the characteristic of illusion.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni mchog tu zab pa'i de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni mchog tu zab pa'i de kho na nyid de /
translated: Therefore, this is the supreme, profound reality.

original: brtag bya min te spyi med pa'i phyir rtogs pas rtogs bya ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brtag bya min te spyi med pa'i phyir rtogs pas rtogs bya ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not to be investigated because it is not a generality. It is not to be realized by thought.

original: rnam shes bya min te khyad par med pa'i phyir dpyod pa'i yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes bya min te khyad par med pa'i phyir dpyod pa'i yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not to be known by consciousness because it is not a particular. It is not an object of analysis.

original: spyi dang khyad par dag las gzhan pa'i yang rtogs par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo mi srid pa'i phyir rtogs dka' ba'o //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dag las gzhan pa'i yang rtogs par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo mi srid pa'i phyir rtogs dka' ba'o //
translated: Since it is impossible for the essence of the object of knowledge to be other than a generality or a particular, it is difficult to realize.

original: yang na thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir rim pa ji lta bar tshig gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir rim pa ji lta bar tshig gsum mo //
translated: Or else, because it is not the object of knowledge that has the nature of hearing, reflection, and meditation, there are three phrases, respectively.

original: rtog ge ba rnams kyis te spyi la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la dga' ba seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po dang phyi rol gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa so so skye bo rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rtog ge ba rnams kyis te spyi la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la dga' ba seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po dang phyi rol gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa so so skye bo rnams kyis so //
translated: By logicians, i.e., by ordinary beings such as Siṅgha, Hārita, Vasu-garbha, and Bāhyārāma, who delight in the conceptualization of universals, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gsang chen no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gsang chen no //
translated: For that very reason, it is the great secret, because it is not the domain of those.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam ste rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam ste rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa /
translated: It is equal to space, i.e., it is the same as space, by being devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas,

original: de rnams dang de kho nas 'dra ste ro gcig tu gyur pa sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa las sangs rgyas thams cad nyid kyi so so rang gis rig par bya ba'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang de kho nas 'dra ste ro gcig tu gyur pa sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa las sangs rgyas thams cad nyid kyi so so rang gis rig par bya ba'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: they are the same as that, i.e., they are of one taste, in the individual self-realization of all Buddhas, due to the abandonment of all obscurations. This is the intention.

original: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba sangs rgyas spyod yul lo zhes so //
analyzed: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba sangs rgyas spyod yul lo zhes so //
translated: The domain of the Buddha is what will be taught.

original: de yang rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad snang ba med pa so so rang gis ma dmigs pa las rig gi dmigs pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad snang ba med pa so so rang gis ma dmigs pa las rig gi dmigs pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is from the non-perception of all things, from the non-apprehension of each and every one of them, by supramundane knowledge free from the entire net of conceptualization, and not from the perception of an object, that it is known.

original: ji skad du bden pa gnyis nges par bstan pa'i mdor gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bden pa gnyis nges par bstan pa'i mdor gsungs pa /
translated: As is said in the Sūtra of the Demonstration of the Two Truths:

original: lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa ni ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa'i mchog thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar gyi yul las 'das pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa ni ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa'i mchog thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar gyi yul las 'das pa'o zhes so //
translated: “Divine son, the ultimate truth is the object of the knowledge of all aspects, endowed with the highest of all aspects, up to the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: 'dis ni yul gyi dngos po las yang dag par 'das pa nye bar blangs pa'i phyir nye bar dmigs pa las de mthong ba 'gegs par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni yul gyi dngos po las yang dag par 'das pa nye bar blangs pa'i phyir nye bar dmigs pa las de mthong ba 'gegs par byed do //
translated: This refutes the perception of that truth as the perception of an object, because it is taken up as the transcendence of the nature of an object.

original: mi shes pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: Ignorance is the obscuration of the knowable.

original: de kho na ni de kho na nyid mthong ba la 'gebs pa'i phyir mun @14a * //
analyzed: de kho na ni de kho na nyid mthong ba la 'gebs pa'i phyir mun @14a * //
translated: Because it obscures seeing reality, it is darkness.🔽

original: pa dang 'dra bas mun pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang 'dra bas mun pa'o //
translated: It is darkness because it is like darkness, since it covers the seeing of reality.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis sprul te sgom pas bskyed pa'i ye shes ni shes bya'i sgrib pa phyogs gcig spangs na yang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis sprul te sgom pas bskyed pa'i ye shes ni shes bya'i sgrib pa phyogs gcig spangs na yang /
translated: The knowledge that is generated by the self-enlightened ones through meditation on emanation is the abandonment of one part of the obstacle to the knowable.

original: gal te gang gi phyir bag chags kyi rjes su son ba de'i phyir de rnams kyis kyang mi shes so //
analyzed: gal te gang gi phyir bag chags kyi rjes su son ba de'i phyir de rnams kyis kyang mi shes so //
translated: But, because it is still accompanied by the instinct for that, they do not know it.

original: 'dis ni 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kho na lha'i rnal 'byor gyi bdag nyid can ni byang chub kyi lam mo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kho na lha'i rnal 'byor gyi bdag nyid can ni byang chub kyi lam mo zhes pa'o //
translated: The path to enlightenment is the very nondual knowledge itself, which has the nature of the yoga of the deity.

original: su rnams kyi zhen gsungs pa /
analyzed: su rnams kyi zhen gsungs pa /
translated: To whom? He says:

original: 'khor ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The world, etc.

original: 'khor ba ni khams gsum du nyon mongs pa dang las kyis 'phangs pa'i skye ba'i rgyun no ;
analyzed: 'khor ba ni khams gsum du nyon mongs pa dang las kyis 'phangs pa'i skye ba'i rgyun no ;
