translated: The world is the continuity of birth projected by passion and action in the three realms.

original: / de kho na mdza' ba dang bral ba dang mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa la sogs pa nye bar 'tshe ba mang po'i rgyu nyon mongs pa'i chu srin la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba nyid kyis dang rgya che ba nyid kyis rgal dka' ba nyid kyi
analyzed: / de kho na mdza' ba dang bral ba dang mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa la sogs pa nye bar 'tshe ba mang po'i rgyu nyon mongs pa'i chu srin la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba nyid kyis dang rgya che ba nyid kyis rgal dka' ba nyid kyi
translated: It is an ocean because it is difficult to cross due to the multitude of troubles such as being separated from the dear and encountering the not dear, etc.,

original: phyir rgya mtsho ste /
analyzed: phyir rgya mtsho ste /
translated: and because it is vast.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni 'jigs pa ste gang rnams kyi 'jigs pa chen po thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni 'jigs pa ste gang rnams kyi 'jigs pa chen po thob par byed pa'o //
translated: It is fearful because it causes the attainment of great fear.

original: sgrol ba ni rgal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrol ba ni rgal bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is a savior because it causes one to cross.

original: der son pa'i sems te mngon par 'dod pa gang rnams kyi yin pa rigs mchog rab tu sad pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: der son pa'i sems te mngon par 'dod pa gang rnams kyi yin pa rigs mchog rab tu sad pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is the mind of those who have arrived there, who have the desire, who are of the highest caste, and who are awakened.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i dbus su 'jug bzhin pa'i lus can rnams bsgral bar ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar mtshon bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i dbus su 'jug bzhin pa'i lus can rnams bsgral bar ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar mtshon bya ste /
translated: It is to be known as it is, in the sense of how it is to be crossed, for embodied beings who are engaged in the middle of the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: mtshon par bya ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor /
analyzed: mtshon par bya ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor /
translated: The deity yoga, which is the nondual wisdom to be known,🔽is the means of crossing.

original: brjod pa po ste thub pa'i dbang po rnams kyis 'khor ba'i bar du gsungs so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: brjod pa po ste thub pa'i dbang po rnams kyis 'khor ba'i bar du gsungs so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the Lord of Sages, the speaker, has taught them until the end of saṃsāra.

original: mtshon byed ces klog pa na /
analyzed: mtshon byed ces klog pa na /
translated: If read as “indicating,”

original: mtshon byed ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshon byed ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: indicating is a characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid de gsungs pa ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gsungs pa ;
translated: That characteristic is taught.

original: mtshon pa rnams kyi ste mtshon par bya ba rnams kyi mtshon byed de rang gi ngo bo mtshon par bya ste nges par brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshon pa rnams kyi ste mtshon par bya ba rnams kyi mtshon byed de rang gi ngo bo mtshon par bya ste nges par brtan par bya'o //
translated: The indicating of the indicated, that is, the own nature of the indicated, should be indicated, that is, ascertained.

original: rnam par shes par bya'o zhes pa rnam shes te yul rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya'o zhes pa rnam shes te yul rnams so //
translated: “Conscious” means objects.

original: 'di rnams kyis shes par bya ba'o zhes pa shes pa ste dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis shes par bya ba'o zhes pa shes pa ste dbang po rnams so //
translated: “To be known by these” means consciousness, that is, the faculties.

original: de'i sems rnams ni drug go //
analyzed: de'i sems rnams ni drug go //
translated: His mind is sixfold.

original: shes bya rnams kyi ste khams bco brgyad po de rnams kyi shes bya ste shes par bya ba mtshan nyid /
analyzed: shes bya rnams kyi ste khams bco brgyad po de rnams kyi shes bya ste shes par bya ba mtshan nyid /
translated: The knowable of those, that is, of those eighteen constituents, is the characteristic to be known, that is, to be understood.

original: shes pas te stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis blta bya ste de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang gi ngo bor mtshon par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: shes pas te stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis blta bya ste de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang gi ngo bor mtshon par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: One should see with wisdom, with the wisdom of emptiness, the object of seeing, which is the nature of the wisdom of nonduality.

original: gang las 'di @14b rnams blta ba ste /
analyzed: gang las 'di @14b rnams blta ba ste /
translated: From which is this seen?

original: nges par dpyad pas rtogs pa ste gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid chub par 'gyur ba de las rtogs pa blta ba'i bsam ldan pa'i ste de kho na nyid kyi ye shes nges par rtogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
analyzed: nges par dpyad pas rtogs pa ste gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid chub par 'gyur ba de las rtogs pa blta ba'i bsam ldan pa'i ste de kho na nyid kyi ye shes nges par rtogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
translated: From the realization of the nondual reality by means of critical investigation, from that is the seeing of the realization of the yogi who has the thought of the wisdom of reality, who has the mind of the realization of the wisdom of reality.

original: lam zhes pa lam ste gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor gyi lam mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lam zhes pa lam ste gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor gyi lam mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The path is the path, the path of the deity yoga, which is the nature of the nondual wisdom, which is directed toward the goal.

original: 'dis kyang rang 'dod bzhin du rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtogs 'gyur ro //🔽rnal 'byor pa 'di'i rjes su bsngags pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dis kyang rang 'dod bzhin du rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtogs 'gyur ro // rnal 'byor pa 'di'i rjes su bsngags pa gsungs pa /
translated: By this, one will realize perfect enlightenment, as one wishes.

original: stong phrag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: stong phrag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The praise of this yogi is stated by “thousandfold,” etc.

original: stong phrag rnams rnam pa du mar skye ba snga ma rnams su 'gro bar te mi khom pa la sogs pa'i 'gro ba thob cing /
analyzed: stong phrag rnams rnam pa du mar skye ba snga ma rnams su 'gro bar te mi khom pa la sogs pa'i 'gro ba thob cing /
translated: The thousands of beings are born in many ways, having obtained the state of beings in the lower realms, and so on.

original: da ni snga ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa las /
analyzed: da ni snga ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa las /
translated: Now, having described the characteristics of the former,

original: mnyam nyid de ro gcig pa nyid kyis stong par sna tshogs pa sgom par byed pa ni dngos grub med na yang bde 'gro brgyud pa kho na thob ste /
analyzed: mnyam nyid de ro gcig pa nyid kyis stong par sna tshogs pa sgom par byed pa ni dngos grub med na yang bde 'gro brgyud pa kho na thob ste /
translated: the meditation on the diversity of emptiness by means of the single taste of equality is the attainment of the state of higher rebirth alone, even if there is no power.

original: de'i phyir 'dis rang 'dod bzhin rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis rang 'dod bzhin rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is said that “one will realize according to one’s wish.”

original: stong pa nyid bsgoms nas ci'i don du lha bsgom par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgoms nas ci'i don du lha bsgom par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If one meditates on emptiness, for what purpose should one meditate on the deity?🔽It is said:

original: stong pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The field of emptiness🔽is the first pure field.

original: stong pa yang de yin la /
analyzed: stong pa yang de yin la /
translated: It is emptiness and

original: 'di las yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir zhing yin zhing dang po ste tha mal pa'i lus kyang yin te /
analyzed: 'di las yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir zhing yin zhing dang po ste tha mal pa'i lus kyang yin te /
translated: since it is completely pure, it is a field. It is the first, or ordinary, body.

original: de la sa bon 'debs pa rab tu bsngags shing de'i phyir de bya ste /
analyzed: de la sa bon 'debs pa rab tu bsngags shing de'i phyir de bya ste /
translated: Since it is praised as the place to plant the seed, therefore, one should do that.

original: blo chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste de dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: blo chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste de dang ldan pas so //
translated: The mind is the discernment of phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i lus la sa bon bskrun pa ni blo dang ldan pa'i byang chub kun nas thob par byed pa'o zhes pa bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis yongs su dag pa'i lus la sa bon bskrun pa ni blo dang ldan pa'i byang chub kun nas thob par byed pa'o zhes pa bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The intelligent one, having planted the seed in the body purified by emptiness, causes the attainment of enlightenment.

original: de ltar gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag gis goms par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag gis goms par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the yoga of the deity, which is the nature of nondual wisdom, should be cultivated by means of the creation and completion stages.

original: don 'di kho na /🔽bskyed pa'i rim pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: don 'di kho na / bskyed pa'i rim pa nyid dang ni //
translated: This very point is taught in the following:🔽The creation stage itself

original: rdzogs pa yi yang rim pa nyid //
analyzed: rdzogs pa yi yang rim pa nyid //
translated: and the completion stage itself,

original: rim gnyis mnyam par gnas nas ni //
analyzed: rim gnyis mnyam par gnas nas ni //
translated: the yogins and yoginīs who abide in the equality of the two stages

original: rdo rje can rnams chos 'chad do //
analyzed: rdo rje can rnams chos 'chad do //
translated: teach the Dharma.

original: zhes so // de la rdzogs pa'i rim pa nges pa'i don du ston pa /
analyzed: zhes so // de la rdzogs pa'i rim pa nges pa'i don du ston pa /
translated: The completion stage is taught in terms of the definitive meaning in the following:

original: rtsa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Channel” and so on.

original: rtsa ni aa ba dh'u t'i'i ste gtsug tor nas nor bu'i mtha' dang rkang mthil gyis mtha' ji srid par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ni aa ba dh'u t'i'i ste gtsug tor nas nor bu'i mtha' dang rkang mthil gyis mtha' ji srid par gnas pa'o //
translated: The channel is the avadhūtī, which extends from the crown to the tip of the jewel and from the crown to the soles of the feet.

original: 'on kyang gtsug tor dang spyi bo dang mgrin pa dang snying ga dang / lte ba dang gsang ba dang nor @15a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang gtsug tor dang spyi bo dang mgrin pa dang snying ga dang / lte ba dang gsang ba dang nor @15a * //
translated: However, the crown, head, throat, heart, navel, secret place, and wealth wheel are the five places.🔽

original: bu'i dbus su chud pa'i rim pa ji lta bar bzhi dang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang bcu drug dang brgyad dang drug cu rtsa bzhi dang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang brgyad kyi grangs can padma nyid dang bha ga nyid dang 'khor lo nyid du bstan par bya ba
analyzed: bu'i dbus su chud pa'i rim pa ji lta bar bzhi dang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang bcu drug dang brgyad dang drug cu rtsa bzhi dang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang brgyad kyi grangs can padma nyid dang bha ga nyid dang 'khor lo nyid du bstan par bya ba
translated: However, the four, thirty-two, sixteen, eight, sixty-four, thirty-two, and eight that are located in the center of the uṣṇīṣa, crown of the head, throat, heart, navel, secret place, and jewel are the lotuses, vaginas, and cakras that are to be shown.

original: rnams kyi dbus su mdud pa'i gzugs so ;🔽/ de'i spyi bor gnas pa'i mdud pa'i bu gnas las kyi gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyis sam /
analyzed: rnams kyi dbus su mdud pa'i gzugs so ;🔽/ de'i spyi bor gnas pa'i mdud pa'i bu gnas las kyi gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyis sam /
translated: The knots are in the center of those.🔽The knot located in the crown of the head is the opening of the channel of the karma-jñānā.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa dpyid kyi thig le zhes bya ba rnal 'byor gyi gtum ma'o rnal 'byor gyis sam lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyis nor bu'i mdud pa'i dbus su 'am gsang ba'i mdud par nges par byung ba'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ngo
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa dpyid kyi thig le zhes bya ba rnal 'byor gyi gtum ma'o rnal 'byor gyis sam lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyis nor bu'i mdud pa'i dbus su 'am gsang ba'i mdud par nges par byung ba'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ngo
translated: The “Spring Drop of the Perfection Stage” is the yoga of inner heat.

original: bo'i byang chub kyi sems bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma'i rang gi ngo bo sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon ni rnal 'byor gsum rnams las gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor gyis bskyed par bya'o ;
analyzed: bo'i byang chub kyi sems bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma'i rang gi ngo bo sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon ni rnal 'byor gsum rnams las gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor gyis bskyed par bya'o ;
translated: The bodhicitta of the nature of the relative and the ultimate, which definitely arises in the center of the knot of the jewel or in the secret knot through the yoga of the connate state of the yoga of inner heat, is the nature of the Bhagavat and the Bhagavatī, the seed of all the qualities of a buddha, which should be generated by any of the three yogas.

original: / de kye'o rdo rje'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
analyzed: / de kye'o rdo rje'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated in the Hevajra Tantra:

original: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i thabs dang pos //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i thabs dang pos //
translated: First, with the method of the maṇḍalacakra,

original: rang byin brlab pa'i rim pas kyang //🔽kun rdzob don dam ngo bo can //
analyzed: rang byin brlab pa'i rim pas kyang // kun rdzob don dam ngo bo can //
translated: and also with the stage of self-consecration,🔽the bodhicitta, which has the nature of the relative and the ultimate,

original: byang chub sems ni bskyed par bya //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni bskyed par bya //
translated: should be generated.

original: kun rdzob kun da lta bu la //
analyzed: kun rdzob kun da lta bu la //
translated: The relative is like a jasmine flower,

original: don dam bde ba'i ngo bo can //
analyzed: don dam bde ba'i ngo bo can //
translated: and the ultimate has the nature of bliss.

original: zhes so // slar yang /
analyzed: zhes so // slar yang /
translated: Again:

original: chos 'byung las skyes ye shes ni //
analyzed: chos 'byung las skyes ye shes ni //
translated: The wisdom born from the source of phenomena

original: mkha' mnyam thabs dang bcas ldan pa //
analyzed: mkha' mnyam thabs dang bcas ldan pa //
translated: Is endowed with the method equal to space.

original: 'jig rten gsum po de las skyes //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po de las skyes //
translated: The three worlds are born from that.

original: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin las //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature of wisdom and method,

original: khu ba'i rnam pa bcom ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: khu ba'i rnam pa bcom ldan 'gyur //
translated: The Bhagavān becomes the form of semen.

original: de yi bde ba 'dod mar bshad //
analyzed: de yi bde ba 'dod mar bshad //
translated: That bliss is explained as Rūpavajrā.

original: ces dang / slar yang /
analyzed: ces dang / slar yang /
translated: And again:

original: rang byin brlab pa'i rim 'di ni //
analyzed: rang byin brlab pa'i rim 'di ni //
translated: This stage of self-consecration

original: kun mkhyen ye shes de rang bzhin //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes de rang bzhin //
translated: Is the nature of omniscient wisdom.

original: zhes dang / slar yang /
analyzed: zhes dang / slar yang /
translated: And again:

original: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i thabs dang pos //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i thabs dang pos //
translated: Through the method of the maṇḍalacakra,

original: rtag par nges par 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag par nges par 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: One will definitely go to the highest.

original: zhes so // 'dir thabs dang bcas ldan pa zhes pa ni thabs dang bcas pa thams cad du ldan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // 'dir thabs dang bcas ldan pa zhes pa ni thabs dang bcas pa thams cad du ldan pa ste /
translated: Here, “endowed with the method” means endowed with all methods.

original: ldan pa nyid kho nar 'jig rten gsum zhes pa la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: ldan pa nyid kho nar 'jig rten gsum zhes pa la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: “Endowed” itself is taught by “the three worlds” and so on.

original: gsum rnams kun rdzob tu skad cig so sor 'jig cing rnam par 'jig go zhes pa 'jig rten lus dang ngag dang rtog pa rnams 'di'i yin pa zhes pa 'jig @15b rten gsum ste sems can no //
analyzed: gsum rnams kun rdzob tu skad cig so sor 'jig cing rnam par 'jig go zhes pa 'jig rten lus dang ngag dang rtog pa rnams 'di'i yin pa zhes pa 'jig @15b rten gsum ste sems can no //
translated: The three worlds are the body, speech, and thought of the world, which is sentient beings.

original: de kho na 'jig rten gsum nyid de rang gi don la ya na'o //
analyzed: de kho na 'jig rten gsum nyid de rang gi don la ya na'o //
translated: The three worlds are just that, and they are the self-interest of the world.

original: mtshungs pa kho na mtshungs pa nyid ces pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa kho na mtshungs pa nyid ces pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Sameness is just sameness, just as it is.

original: khu ba dang bde ba dag gi bar ni shes rab dang thabs kyi rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: khu ba dang bde ba dag gi bar ni shes rab dang thabs kyi rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: The interval between semen and bliss is the division of wisdom and method.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa'i lha dag gi ltar yin gyi /
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa'i lha dag gi ltar yin gyi /
translated: It is the way of the gods who are in union.

original: 'di don dam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di don dam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not the ultimate.

original: don dam pa'i shes rab dang thabs ni nyid ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dag kho na'i'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i shes rab dang thabs ni nyid ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dag kho na'i'o //
translated: The ultimate wisdom and method are just emptiness and compassion.

original: rang byin brlab pa ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa la rang nyid byin gyis rlob par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rang byin brlab pa ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa la rang nyid byin gyis rlob par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Self-consecration is the consecration of oneself in the empowerment, and so on.

original: kun mkhyen ye shes kyang de'i rang bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes kyang de'i rang bzhin kho na'o //
translated: The gnosis of omniscience is also just that nature.

original: 'od gsal ba zhes pa spros pa thams cad kyi mun pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir phul du byung bar gsal ba'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes pa spros pa thams cad kyi mun pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir phul du byung bar gsal ba'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: It is luminous because it is the nature of clear light, free from the darkness of all conceptual elaborations.

original: shel dag pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: shel dag pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a pure crystal.

original: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The five and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid ni drug pa rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid ni drug pa rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The reality that is the nature of the five gnoses, such as the mirror-like gnosis, which is the nature of the five Tathagatas, is the essence of the sixth, Vajrasattva.

original: de'i dbus na de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa rol par byed pas na lha byang chub kyi sems lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus na de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa rol par byed pas na lha byang chub kyi sems lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: Since he abides in the center of that as its nature, he is the god who sports, the bodhicitta of innate bliss.

original: de brtag pa gnyis par yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de brtag pa gnyis par yang gsungs pa /
translated: That is also stated in the second chapter:

original: byang chub sems ni lha nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni lha nyid do //
translated: Bodhicitta is the very god.

original: zhes so // klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: zhes so // klu sgrub zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: And the venerable Nagarjuna also says:

original: sems kyi rdo rje rnam grol las //
analyzed: sems kyi rdo rje rnam grol las //
translated: In the Vajra of Mind, Liberation,

original: lha gzhan mngon par brjod du med //
analyzed: lha gzhan mngon par brjod du med //
translated: The other gods are not expressed.

original: ces so // mi gsal ba ni don dam par te /
analyzed: ces so // mi gsal ba ni don dam par te /
translated: Unmanifest means ultimately,

original: stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of emptiness.

original: gsal ba'i gzugs can zhes pa kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i gzugs can zhes pa kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: Manifest form means conventionally.

original: 'phel ba zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'phel ba zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: With respect to “increase,” etc.,

original: ri d'u 'phel ba la'o //
analyzed: ri d'u 'phel ba la'o //
translated: increase is for the sake of growth.

original: 'phel bar byed pa 'phel ba dang / de'i tsam ste mtha' dag nyid mchog ste phul du byung ba gang gi yin pa de de skad do /
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa 'phel ba dang / de'i tsam ste mtha' dag nyid mchog ste phul du byung ba gang gi yin pa de de skad do /
translated: The supreme limit is the totality, the best, the most excellent.

original: mchog gi rdzu 'phrul ma lus pa dang ldan pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mchog gi rdzu 'phrul ma lus pa dang ldan pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he possesses all of the supreme magical emanations.

original: phra ba ste don dam par zab pa nyid kyi phyir ku sha'i rtse mo lta bu'i blo can gyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: phra ba ste don dam par zab pa nyid kyi phyir ku sha'i rtse mo lta bu'i blo can gyi spyod yul lo //
translated: Subtle means the domain of the mind that is like the tip of a kuśa blade, because of ultimate profundity.

original: kun rdzob tu ni thig le'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni thig le'i gzugs can no //
translated: Conventionally, he has the form of a drop.🔽The mind that measures is the mental organ.

original: gang gis nye bar 'jal ba yid yin pa de ni yid dpe can zhes pa gtsug lag ste yid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis nye bar 'jal ba yid yin pa de ni yid dpe can zhes pa gtsug lag ste yid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is of the nature of the mind.

original: snying gi dbus na zhes lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo'i rnal 'byor goms par gyur pa rnams kyi snying po nyid kyi phyir snying zhes bya ba @16a * //
analyzed: snying gi dbus na zhes lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo'i rnal 'byor goms par gyur pa rnams kyi snying po nyid kyi phyir snying zhes bya ba @16a * //
translated: In the center of the heart means that because it is the essence of those who have become familiar with the yoga of connate caṇḍālī, it is called the “heart.”🔽

original: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i mdud pa'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i mdud pa'i dbus su'o //
translated: In the middle of the heart means in the middle of the knot of the great-bliss wheel.

original: rtag tu zhes pa thams cad kyi tshe ste /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa thams cad kyi tshe ste /
translated: Always means at all times.

original: 'khor lo gzhan du res 'ga' gnas kyi dus thams cad du ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo gzhan du res 'ga' gnas kyi dus thams cad du ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it abides in the other wheels sometimes, not at all times.

original: 'od dang ldan pa zhes pa ni 'od zer dang ldan pa ste sgrib pa'i mun pa thams cad 'joms pa'i ye shes ni 'od zer ro //
analyzed: 'od dang ldan pa zhes pa ni 'od zer dang ldan pa ste sgrib pa'i mun pa thams cad 'joms pa'i ye shes ni 'od zer ro //
translated: Endowed with light means endowed with rays. The gnosis that destroys all the darkness of obscurations is the rays.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gegs med pa'i snang ba rab 'byam pa nyid kyi phyir 'od chen te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gegs med pa'i snang ba rab 'byam pa nyid kyi phyir 'od chen te /
translated: Therefore, it is the great light because it is the unobstructed, infinite appearance.

original: lung nyid kyi phyir skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: lung nyid kyi phyir skyes pa nyid do //
translated: It is born because it is the scripture.

original: bcu gnyis mtha' zhes pa bcu gnyis dang mtha' ste /
analyzed: bcu gnyis mtha' zhes pa bcu gnyis dang mtha' ste /
translated: The end of the twelfth means the end of the twelfth.

original: nye ba las de rnams kho na'i 'o zhes pa kun du sdud pa las bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: nye ba las de rnams kho na'i 'o zhes pa kun du sdud pa las bcu gsum mo //
translated: The meaning is that it is the thirteenth because it is included among those.

original: dgu mtha' zhes pa de ltar bcu'o //
analyzed: dgu mtha' zhes pa de ltar bcu'o //
translated: The “end of the ninth” is thus the tenth.

original: skud pa zhes pa skud pa la ste /
analyzed: skud pa zhes pa skud pa la ste /
translated: The “thread” is on the thread.

original: thams cad skud pa'i rang bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad skud pa'i rang bzhin kho na'o //
translated: Everything is just the nature of the thread.

original: gcig ces pa gnas so //
analyzed: gcig ces pa gnas so //
translated: The “one” is the place.

original: 'di rnams ni ji ltar rigs par /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni ji ltar rigs par /
translated: These are as appropriate.

original: rkang mthil nas ni mgo bo'i bar la gnas pa rnams ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bu yig la sogs pa gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams te rnam 'byung nas te 'phros pas khyab par byas nas so //
analyzed: rkang mthil nas ni mgo bo'i bar la gnas pa rnams ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bu yig la sogs pa gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams te rnam 'byung nas te 'phros pas khyab par byas nas so //
translated: Those that exist from the soles of the feet up to the head are the twenty-four places, such as the anus, and so on, which will be explained.

original: lte ba'i dbus su zhes pa gsang ba yang lte bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lte ba'i dbus su zhes pa gsang ba yang lte bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: The “center of the navel” is also called the navel.

original: de'i phyir 'dir gsang ba'i mdud pa'i dbus su rnal 'byor gyi gtum mo bsgom pa las khyad par can gyi bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid kyis spros pa bcom nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir gsang ba'i mdud pa'i dbus su rnal 'byor gyi gtum mo bsgom pa las khyad par can gyi bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid kyis spros pa bcom nas gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, here, in the center of the secret knot, the yoginī is meditated on as Caṇḍālī, and through the special nature of great bliss, the elaborations are destroyed and she abides.

original: lnga pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: lnga pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: The “fifth” and so on.

original: gtsug gi 'khor lo'i rtsa bzhi po rnams kyi dbus su aa wa dh'u t'i lnga pa'i cha kho na cha tsam ste /
analyzed: gtsug gi 'khor lo'i rtsa bzhi po rnams kyi dbus su aa wa dh'u t'i lnga pa'i cha kho na cha tsam ste /
translated: In the center of the four channel petals of the crown cakra, the fifth part of the avadhūtī alone is just a part.

original: gang klu'i dbang po'i ltar 'khyil pa'i rnam pas mdud pa'i rang gi ngo bos 'khor lo so sor rnam par rgyas shing khyab par byed ces pas rnam rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: gang klu'i dbang po'i ltar 'khyil pa'i rnam pas mdud pa'i rang gi ngo bos 'khor lo so sor rnam par rgyas shing khyab par byed ces pas rnam rgyas pa'o //
translated: Since it pervades and expands into each cakra with the nature of a knot that is coiled in the manner of the lord of the nāgas, it is “expanding.”🔽“

original: cha bcas kyang zhes lung ste /
analyzed: cha bcas kyang zhes lung ste /
translated: With parts” is the scripture.

original: cha rnams te rtsa rnams dang lhan cig 'jug go zhes pa cha bcas kyang ste /
analyzed: cha rnams te rtsa rnams dang lhan cig 'jug go zhes pa cha bcas kyang ste /
translated: Since it moves together with the parts, the channels, it is “with parts.”

original: de 'byed cing ngo //
analyzed: de 'byed cing ngo //
translated: It is “divided” by that.🔽“

original: ni ni khyad par can gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i bdag nyid du rdo rje nor bu'i dbus su mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig nyid kyis spros pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bor byung zhing rtogs pa ste las kyi gtum mo bsgom pa rnams kyi'o
analyzed: ni ni khyad par can gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i bdag nyid du rdo rje nor bu'i dbus su mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig nyid kyis spros pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bor byung zhing rtogs pa ste las kyi gtum mo bsgom pa rnams kyi'o
translated: In the center of the vajra gem, the nature of the special connate bliss, it arises and is realized as the nature of nonconceptuality by the instant that is free from characteristics” is the meditation of the action caṇḍālī.

original: // de ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: // de ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is that?

original: skye gnas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skye gnas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, “The birthplace,” and so on.

original: skye gnas kyi ste shes rab ma'i padma'i dbus su 'dug pa'i rdo rje nor bur gnas pa zhes pa ma 'phos pa'o //
analyzed: skye gnas kyi ste shes rab ma'i padma'i dbus su 'dug pa'i rdo rje nor bur gnas pa zhes pa ma 'phos pa'o //
translated: The vajra jewel is located in the middle of the lotus of the wisdom mother, the place of birth, and is not transferred.🔽How is this?

original: 'di yang ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /🔽chos zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa / chos zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said:

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis te sems rnal 'byor sgrub pa las @16b brtan par gyur pas zhu bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis te sems rnal 'byor sgrub pa las @16b brtan par gyur pas zhu bar byas pa'o //
translated: The vajra jewel is located in the middle of the lotus of the wisdom mother, the place of birth, and is not transferred.

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor gzhan la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor gzhan la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in other yogas as well.

original: khyad par 'di rnams kyis 'di sa bon nyid do zhes bstan bar bya ba'i ched du gsungs zin yang dran par byed pa sa bon zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par 'di rnams kyis 'di sa bon nyid do zhes bstan bar bya ba'i ched du gsungs zin yang dran par byed pa sa bon zhes pa'o //
translated: In order to teach that this is the seed by these distinctions, it is said, “seed,” although it has already been said.

original: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs la nges pa'i don du rnam par bshad pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs la nges pa'i don du rnam par bshad pa'o ;
translated: This is explained in the definitive meaning in the context of the completion stage.

original: / bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs la drang ba'i don du dpyid kyi thig le'i rnal 'byor bskyar te ston pa ni rtsa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs la drang ba'i don du dpyid kyi thig le'i rnal 'byor bskyar te ston pa ni rtsa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In the context of the generation stage, the meaning is provisional, and the yoga of the Spring Essence is repeated and taught:

original: rtsa'i mdud pa'i bu ga la brten pa'i sa bon te h'um yig nag po bcom ldan 'das kyi rang gi ngo bo dpyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa'i mdud pa'i bu ga la brten pa'i sa bon te h'um yig nag po bcom ldan 'das kyi rang gi ngo bo dpyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The seed, i.e., the syllable hum, which is based on the channel-knots, is the essence of the Bhagavat, called Vasanta.

original: phyed ces bya ba las la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyed ces bya ba las la sogs pa'o //
translated: The half is the consonants, etc.

original: phyi mo phyed pa yang de ste gsal byed ni /
analyzed: phyi mo phyed pa yang de ste gsal byed ni /
translated: The half-vowel is also that, i.e., the consonant.

original: phyi mo phyed pa can no zhes pa'i rigs pa las /
analyzed: phyi mo phyed pa can no zhes pa'i rigs pa las /
translated: By the rule the half-vowel has the consonant,

original: ha yig mi 'gyur ba gzhom du med pa yin zhing mchog kyang ste /
analyzed: ha yig mi 'gyur ba gzhom du med pa yin zhing mchog kyang ste /
translated: the syllable ha is unchanging and invincible, and is the best.

original: aa yig la gnas pa nyid kyis phul du byung ba ste /
analyzed: aa yig la gnas pa nyid kyis phul du byung ba ste /
translated: It is excellent by being based on the syllable a,

original: aa yig ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid rjod par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: aa yig ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid rjod par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the syllable a expresses the non-arising of all dharmas.

original: thig le spyi bor gnas pa yis //
analyzed: thig le spyi bor gnas pa yis //
translated: The drop is located at the crown of the head,

original: gzugs su byas shing mtshan mar byas //
analyzed: gzugs su byas shing mtshan mar byas //
translated: and is made into a form and made into a sign.

original: zhes pa thig le'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: zhes pa thig le'i gzugs can no //
translated: This is the form of the drop.

original: man ngag las zla tshes dang n'a da dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: man ngag las zla tshes dang n'a da dang bcas pa'o //
translated: According to the esoteric instructions, it has the crescent moon and nada.

original: gnas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnas gsungs pa /
translated: The location is stated:

original: snying gi dbus su gnas zhes pa dpyid do //
analyzed: snying gi dbus su gnas zhes pa dpyid do //
translated: The located in the middle of the heart is Vasanta.

original: man ngag las bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i dbus su ham yig go //
analyzed: man ngag las bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i dbus su ham yig go //
translated: According to the esoteric instructions, the letter haṃ is in the center of the wheel of great bliss.

original: bcu gnyis mtha' can ni aam yig mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bcu gnyis mtha' can ni aam yig mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The one ending in the twelfth is the unchanging aṃ.

original: ri r'i li l'i ma ning bzhi spangs nas dbyangs rnams kyi bcu gnyis pa mtha' ma can 'di'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri r'i li l'i ma ning bzhi spangs nas dbyangs rnams kyi bcu gnyis pa mtha' ma can 'di'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The twelve vowels are the last of the four neutral letters, ra, ri, la, and li.

original: man ngag las zla tshes dang n'a da dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: man ngag las zla tshes dang n'a da dang bcas pa'o //
translated: According to the esoteric instructions, it is together with the crescent moon and nāda.

original: dgu mtha' zhes pa dgu pa mtha' la yod pa mtha' can te ao yig mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dgu mtha' zhes pa dgu pa mtha' la yod pa mtha' can te ao yig mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The one ending in the ninth is the unchanging oṃ, which is the last of the nine.

original: man ngag las zla tshes dang thig le dang n'a da dang bcas pa'o //🔽gnas gsungs pa lte ba'i dbus su rnam par gnas te aom ngo //
analyzed: man ngag las zla tshes dang thig le dang n'a da dang bcas pa'o // gnas gsungs pa lte ba'i dbus su rnam par gnas te aom ngo //
translated: According to the esoteric instructions, it is together with the crescent moon, drop, and nāda.🔽The place is said to be the center of the navel.

original: man ngag las mgrin pa'i dbus su aom mo //
analyzed: man ngag las mgrin pa'i dbus su aom mo //
translated: According to the esoteric instructions, it is the oṃ in the center of the throat.

original: sa bon bzhi po 'di yang rkang mthil nas ni spyi gtsug par mngon par khyab par byas nas gnas pa'i skud pa gcig ste aa wa dh'u t'i zhes bya ba /
analyzed: sa bon bzhi po 'di yang rkang mthil nas ni spyi gtsug par mngon par khyab par byas nas gnas pa'i skud pa gcig ste aa wa dh'u t'i zhes bya ba /
translated: These four seed syllables are the single thread that pervades from the soles of the feet to the crown of the head, the so-called avadhūti.

original: cha bcas rnams kyang ste 'khor lo'i skud pa rnams 'byed pa rdo rje'i dbus su son pa la nges par byung zhing brten nas /
analyzed: cha bcas rnams kyang ste 'khor lo'i skud pa rnams 'byed pa rdo rje'i dbus su son pa la nges par byung zhing brten nas /
translated: The parts, too, that is, the threads of the wheel, are definitely located in the middle of the vajra, and are supported.

original: skye gnas bha ga padma bzhi po rnams kyi lte ba'i dbus su gnas pa chos kyi dbyings byang chub kyi sems zla ba zhu bar byas pa dag brtan par gyur pa gang @17a * //
analyzed: skye gnas bha ga padma bzhi po rnams kyi lte ba'i dbus su gnas pa chos kyi dbyings byang chub kyi sems zla ba zhu bar byas pa dag brtan par gyur pa gang @17a * //
translated: The seed is that by which the melted moon of the bodhicitta, the dharmadhātu, is stabilized in the middle of the center of the four-petaled lotus of the bhaga.

original: gis yin pa de ni sa bon no zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gis yin pa de ni sa bon no zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As before, this is the seed.

original: rdzogs pa dang bskyed pa'i rim pa 'di dag gi yang sgom pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: rdzogs pa dang bskyed pa'i rim pa 'di dag gi yang sgom pa ston par byed de /
translated: He teaches the meditation of these completion and creation stages.

original: rim pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rim pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The stage, etc.

original: byang chub kyi sems de'i rim pas 'pho ba ste 'gro ba bzung ngo zhes phyi ma dang 'bral lo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de'i rim pas 'pho ba ste 'gro ba bzung ngo zhes phyi ma dang 'bral lo //
translated: The movement, the going, of that bodhicitta is held by the stage of that, i.e., by the completion stage.

original: rlung gi bzhon pa can gyi sems 'gog par bya zhing /
analyzed: rlung gi bzhon pa can gyi sems 'gog par bya zhing /
translated: The mind, which has the wind as its mount, is stopped.

original: rnal 'byor goms pas mi g-yo bar byed par gyur pa na rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor goms pas mi g-yo bar byed par gyur pa na rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: When, by the practice of yoga, it becomes unmoving, one abides in the completion stage.

original: sgo dgu rnams ni 'dir mig dang spyi bo dang sna dang rna ba dang lce dang mgrin pa dang / dpung pa dang snying ga dang lte ba'i rtsa rnams te /
analyzed: sgo dgu rnams ni 'dir mig dang spyi bo dang sna dang rna ba dang lce dang mgrin pa dang / dpung pa dang snying ga dang lte ba'i rtsa rnams te /
translated: The nine doors are here the eyes, the head, the nose, the ears, the tongue, the throat, the arms, the heart, and the navel.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pas ni sa bon dgod pas gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /🔽sa yi sa bon gnyis po ni //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pas ni sa bon dgod pas gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa / sa yi sa bon gnyis po ni //
translated: One who is engaged in the stage of generation should hold the seed syllables by the placement of the seed syllables.🔽The two seed syllables of earth

original: zhes pa / sa'i sa bon gnyis ni h'um yig gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa / sa'i sa bon gnyis ni h'um yig gnyis so //
translated: are the two hūṃ syllables.🔽In its eyes,

original: de'i mig tu zhes pa mig gnyis su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mig tu zhes pa mig gnyis su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: that is, in the two eyes, one should meditate on the two aṃ syllables.🔽The blazing,

original: 'bar ba zhes pa me'i sa bon kshum rkan la'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba zhes pa me'i sa bon kshum rkan la'o //
translated: that is, the fire seed syllable raṃ, is on the palate.

original: rlung gi stong pa sogs sa bon //
analyzed: rlung gi stong pa sogs sa bon //
translated: The wind, the emptiness, and so on, are the seed syllables.

original: zhes pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: zhes pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par dag pa /
translated: The emptiness and so on are the purities.

original: rlung gi sa bon ni yam yig go //
analyzed: rlung gi sa bon ni yam yig go //
translated: The wind seed syllable is the syllable yaṃ.🔽The nose, the ears, and so on,

original: sna dang rna ba sogs zhes pa sna'i khung bu gnyis dang rna ba'i khung bu gnyis su'o //
analyzed: sna dang rna ba sogs zhes pa sna'i khung bu gnyis dang rna ba'i khung bu gnyis su'o //
translated: are the two nostrils and the two ear holes.🔽The first mind

original: dang po'i sems zhes pa gtso bo'i sems kyi ngo bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang po'i sems zhes pa gtso bo'i sems kyi ngo bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: is the nature of the principal mind.

original: bdud rtsi chu yi sa bon ni //
analyzed: bdud rtsi chu yi sa bon ni //
translated: The seed syllable of the water of nectar🔽is the syllable vaṃ.

original: zhes pa bdud rtsi'i sa bon sum yig ste /
analyzed: zhes pa bdud rtsi'i sa bon sum yig ste /
translated: The seed of nectar is the syllable sum.

original: de yang chu rnam par dag cing de'i sa bon lce'i dbang po la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang chu rnam par dag cing de'i sa bon lce'i dbang po la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, water is pure, and its seed is to be applied to the organ of taste.

original: gang las de der gtso bo nyid yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang las de der gtso bo nyid yin pa ste /
translated: From which it is the principal one.

original: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa dbang phyug ces pa'o //🔽mgrin par gti mug sa bon te //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa dbang phyug ces pa'o // mgrin par gti mug sa bon te //
translated: Its extensive explanation is “Īśvara.”🔽The seed of delusion is at the throat.

original: zhes pa mgrin pa la gti mug rnam par dag pa'i sa bon smr+yum'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mgrin pa la gti mug rnam par dag pa'i sa bon smr+yum'o //
translated: The seed of the purification of delusion is sum at the throat.

original: dpung par zhes pa dpung pa'i rtsa ba gnyis su'o //
analyzed: dpung par zhes pa dpung pa'i rtsa ba gnyis su'o //
translated: The seed of passion is at the two roots of the arms.

original: nyon mongs de bzhin no zhes pa nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i sa bon smr+yum'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs de bzhin no zhes pa nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i sa bon smr+yum'o //
translated: The seed of the purification of the afflictions is sum.

original: g-yo ba zhes pa rlung ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes pa rlung ste /
translated: Motion is wind.

original: de'i sa bon ym+r+yum snying gar ro //
analyzed: de'i sa bon ym+r+yum snying gar ro //
translated: Its seed is yom at the heart.

original: phyugs zhes pa phyugs kyi sgras 'ug pa ma ste /
analyzed: phyugs zhes pa phyugs kyi sgras 'ug pa ma ste /
translated: Cattle is a female owl.

original: de'i sa bon kshmr+yum lte ba'i rtsa bar zhes pa lte ba'i rtsa ba dag la'o //
analyzed: de'i sa bon kshmr+yum lte ba'i rtsa bar zhes pa lte ba'i rtsa ba dag la'o //
translated: Its seed is kṣam at the root of the navel.

original: yan lag brgyad kyi sa bon rnams //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad kyi sa bon rnams //
translated: The seeds of the eight limbs🔽are at the eight places.

original: zhes pa khyad par du gyur pa'i yan lag brgyad kyi sa bon rnams kyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa khyad par du gyur pa'i yan lag brgyad kyi sa bon rnams kyis so //
translated: The seeds of the eight special members.

original: brgyad kyi yan lag gis zhes klog pa la yang de ltar ro //
analyzed: brgyad kyi yan lag gis zhes klog pa la yang de ltar ro //
translated: If one reads “by the members of the eight,” it is the same.

original: cha brgyad ces pa gang gi yan lag brgyad rnams yin pa de rim gyis 'pho ba gzung bar bya go char byad gag par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: cha brgyad ces pa gang gi yan lag brgyad rnams yin pa de rim gyis 'pho ba gzung bar bya go char byad gag par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The eight parts are the eight members of the one who is gradually passing on.

translated: The verse from where refers to

original: ji lta ba bzhin du de'i thabs dang ldan pa'i rdo rje theg pa la brten pas mngon du bya ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du de'i thabs dang ldan pa'i rdo rje theg pa la brten pas mngon du bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should actualize it by relying on the Vajrayāna, which possesses the method of that reality.

original: de ston pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ston pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach that, it is said:

original: ma dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The mother” and so on.

original: de la ma ni dbang sbyin pa mo'o //
analyzed: de la ma ni dbang sbyin pa mo'o //
translated: Mother is the one who bestows power.

original: sring mo ni rdo rje theg pa la yang dag bar zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: sring mo ni rdo rje theg pa la yang dag bar zhugs pa ste /
translated: Sister is one who has entered the Vajra Vehicle.

original: ma la sogs pa'i sgras ma la sogs pa dang 'dra ba rnams so zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: ma la sogs pa'i sgras ma la sogs pa dang 'dra ba rnams so zhes kha cig go //
translated: By the words mother and so on, those similar to mother and so on are meant, some say.

original: rab kyi rnal 'byor pa la sgra ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bla ma rnams so //
analyzed: rab kyi rnal 'byor pa la sgra ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bla ma rnams so //
translated: The gurus say that for the best yogin, it is just as the words state.

original: nges pa'i don ni rang nyid kyis gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni rang nyid kyis gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The definitive meaning will be stated by oneself.

original: shes rab ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i rnal 'byor ma rnams so //
analyzed: shes rab ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i rnal 'byor ma rnams so //
translated: Wisdom is the yoginis whose nature is emptiness.

original: thabs ni dpal rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni dpal rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Means is glorious Vajradhara.

original: de dag gi cho ga ste phyag rgya dang ; bdag nyid la lhag par mos pa las so //
analyzed: de dag gi cho ga ste phyag rgya dang ; bdag nyid la lhag par mos pa las so //
translated: Their ritual is the mudra and the deity yoga.

original: mchod par bya zhes pa ni 'dod can ma dgyes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya zhes pa ni 'dod can ma dgyes par bya ba'o //
translated: Worship means to please the desirous one.

original: gang gsungs pa /🔽nan gyis rnal 'byor mar sbyor las //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa / nan gyis rnal 'byor mar sbyor las //
translated: As it is said:🔽From the forceful union with the yogini,

original: rnal 'byor sbom po'i ltung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor sbom po'i ltung bar 'gyur //
translated: there is a serious downfall for the yogin.

original: zhes so // gang gi phyir yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // gang gi phyir yang gsungs pa /
translated: And also, it is said:

original: ji srid khu ba ldan gyur pa //
analyzed: ji srid khu ba ldan gyur pa //
translated: As long as one is endowed with semen,

original: de srid shes rab sten par bya //
analyzed: de srid shes rab sten par bya //
translated: One should rely on wisdom as long as that is so.

original: zhes so // de kho na nyid ni 'dir thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes so // de kho na nyid ni 'dir thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Here, reality is the nature of means and wisdom.

original: de la dga' ba ni de mgu bar gyur pa yin gyi chags pa can nyid la sogs pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni de mgu bar gyur pa yin gyi chags pa can nyid la sogs pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Delight in that is delight in that, not in those who are attached and so forth.

original: rab tu 'bad pa ni gsang ba la 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad pa ni gsang ba la 'bad pa'o //
translated: Exertion is effort in the secret.

original: bye ba zhes pa ni mchog tu bye ba ste rang nyid kho nas rigs pa bshad pa'i stobs las brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bye ba zhes pa ni mchog tu bye ba ste rang nyid kho nas rigs pa bshad pa'i stobs las brtag par bya'o //
translated: The word koti means supreme. It should be understood by the power of explaining the reasoning by oneself alone.

original: sngags bye ba yang bye ba ste /
analyzed: sngags bye ba yang bye ba ste /
translated: The word koti also means ten million.

original: rgyags pa dang rgod pa dang khro ba la sogs pa rnams kyis rang nyid dam de dang lhan cig pas gzhan la smra ba sngags bye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa dang rgod pa dang khro ba la sogs pa rnams kyis rang nyid dam de dang lhan cig pas gzhan la smra ba sngags bye ba'o //
translated: The word koti also means ten million. One who speaks to oneself or another with intoxication, excitement, anger, and so forth is a koti-speaker.

original: ma gsang na dmyal bar ltung ba la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i skyon ni rab tu grags pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ma gsang na dmyal bar ltung ba la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i skyon ni rab tu grags pa kho na ste /
translated: The fault of not seeing the downfall to hell and so on from not keeping it secret is well known.

original: mthong ba'i skyon yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: mthong ba'i skyon yang gsungs pa /
translated: The fault of seeing is also stated:

original: ma gsang na ste ma sbas na'o //
analyzed: ma gsang na ste ma sbas na'o //
translated: If not kept secret, not concealed.

original: sbrul ni sprul dang stag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbrul ni sprul dang stag la sogs pa'o //
translated: The snake is the snake, tiger, and so on.

original: sa spyod ni mi dang sha za la sogs pa gnod par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: sa spyod ni mi dang sha za la sogs pa gnod par byed pa rnams so //
translated: The earth-wanderers are the human and piśāca, and so on, that cause harm.

original: de kho na nyid shes par 'dod pa po la 'di rnams kyis ci bya zhe na gsungs @19b pa ;
analyzed: de kho na nyid shes par 'dod pa po la 'di rnams kyis ci bya zhe na gsungs @19b pa ;
translated: What do these do to one who desires to know reality? It is said:

original: phyag rgya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The seal, and so on.”

original: 'dir bram ze mo dang rgyal rigs mo dang rje'u rigs mo dang dmangs rigs mo rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs can ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir bram ze mo dang rgyal rigs mo dang rje'u rigs mo dang dmangs rigs mo rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs can ma rnams so //
translated: Here, the brahmin, kṣatriya, vaiśya, and śūdra women are the women of the family of Vairocana.

original: bdud rtsi rdo rje mo ni rgyal rigs mo kho na ste /
analyzed: bdud rtsi rdo rje mo ni rgyal rigs mo kho na ste /
translated: The nectar-vajra woman is only of the kṣatriya caste,

original: bdud rtsi bzhin du nyams pa'i sdug bsngal rnams las skyob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud rtsi bzhin du nyams pa'i sdug bsngal rnams las skyob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because she protects from the suffering of decline, like nectar.

original: las kyi rigs las skyes zhes pa ni tshong pa la sogs pa las gtso bo'i rigs kyi rje rigs te de las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi rigs las skyes zhes pa ni tshong pa la sogs pa las gtso bo'i rigs kyi rje rigs te de las skyes pa'o //
translated: “Born from the karma family” means the kṣatriya caste, the chief caste among merchants and so on, born from that.

original: ba lang rdzi mo yang dmangs rigs mo'o //
analyzed: ba lang rdzi mo yang dmangs rigs mo'o //
translated: The cowherd woman is also of the śūdra caste.

original: rnam par snang mdzad chen po ni 'dir rnam pa snang mdzad kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chen po ni 'dir rnam pa snang mdzad kho na'o //
translated: Here, the great Vairocana is only Vairocana.

original: de bzhin nyid du zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: Thusness and so on.

original: de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin pa nyid de /
translated: Thusness is just thusness.

original: chos kyi khyad par ma bstan pa'i phyir 'di ni chos thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khyad par ma bstan pa'i phyir 'di ni chos thams cad kyi'o //
translated: Since it does not teach a specific phenomenon, it is the thusness of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba'i de kho na nyid ni de bzhin nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba'i de kho na nyid ni de bzhin nyid du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the suchness of all phenomena just as they are is called thusness.

original: de yang stong pa nyid tsam du pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg par rtogs par byas shing //
analyzed: de yang stong pa nyid tsam du pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg par rtogs par byas shing //
translated: Moreover, in the Perfection Vehicle, it is realized as just emptiness.

original: 'dir ni nye bar ston par 'gyur bzhin ba'i thabs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid du zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni nye bar ston par 'gyur bzhin ba'i thabs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid du zhes pa'o //
translated: Here, emptiness endowed with the special method that will be taught is called thusness.

original: der gshegs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: der gshegs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: One who goes there is a thus-gone.

original: ta yig phyis pa las so //
analyzed: ta yig phyis pa las so //
translated: The suffix -ta is added to the root.

original: dpal ldan te tshogs gnyis dang ldan par gyur pa zhes snga ma dang sbrel lo //
analyzed: dpal ldan te tshogs gnyis dang ldan par gyur pa zhes snga ma dang sbrel lo //
translated: Glorious means endowed with the two accumulations.

original: de bzhin kho nar byon pa'o zhes pa ji ltar gshegs pa de bzhin kho nar byon pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar byon pa'o zhes pa ji ltar gshegs pa de bzhin kho nar byon pa ste /
translated: Gone just thus means gone just as he went.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin kho na 'gro ba'i don du rigs lnga la sogs pa'i dngos por spro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin kho na 'gro ba'i don du rigs lnga la sogs pa'i dngos por spro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the emanation of the five clans, etc., for the sake of the world, in the nature of means and insight.

original: de bzhin nyid 'dis dang phul du byung ba'i ye shes dang dbyer med pa'i shes rab kyis dang sbyor bas te de'i bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'dis dang phul du byung ba'i ye shes dang dbyer med pa'i shes rab kyis dang sbyor bas te de'i bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyis so //
translated: By this reality, by insight inseparable from the most excellent pristine awareness, and by the yoga of union with it, i.e., by the yoga of identity with it.

original: 'dir thams cad ni sems gtso bo ste /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad ni sems gtso bo ste /
translated: Here, mind is foremost in everything.

original: sems kyi rgyun gyi mtshan nyid can gyi sems can rnams kyang rang bzhin med pa'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can rnams so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gyi mtshan nyid can gyi sems can rnams kyang rang bzhin med pa'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can rnams so //
translated: Sentient beings, characterized by the continuity of mind, are also endowed with the reality of the Tathagata, which is the nature of realitylessness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yang chos kyi bdog pa thams cad pa ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yang chos kyi bdog pa thams cad pa ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga rnams te /
translated: And the Tathagatas are endowed with all the wealth of Dharma, the five pristine awarenesses, mirror-like, etc.

original: de rnams kyang chos nyid kyis lus kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag pa kho na yin zhing /
analyzed: de rnams kyang chos nyid kyis lus kyi rang bzhin yongs su dag pa kho na yin zhing /
translated: And these are of the nature of the body of reality, completely pure.

original: glo bur gyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa na rang gi rang bzhin la gnas bzhin pa rnams ni ye shes lngar bshad @20a * //
analyzed: glo bur gyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa na rang gi rang bzhin la gnas bzhin pa rnams ni ye shes lngar bshad @20a * //
translated: When the adventitious obscurations are totally purified, those who abide in their own nature are explained to be the five pristine consciousnesses.🔽

original: pa dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpar bshad pa 'thob pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: pa dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpar bshad pa 'thob pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: When the adventitious obscurations are completely purified, those who abide in their own nature obtain only the five exalted wisdoms and the state of a buddha and bodhisattva.

original: snga ma ni sa bon du bshad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni sa bon du bshad pa kho na'o //
translated: The former are explained as seeds alone.

original: de'i phyir yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bon nyid yin pa'i phyir skye rigs rnams dang sde rigs rnams su brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bon nyid yin pa'i phyir skye rigs rnams dang sde rigs rnams su brjod do //
translated: Therefore, they are also called the families and clans because they are the seeds of bodhisattvas.

original: 'o na de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga can rnams te /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga can rnams te /
translated: If that is so, then all tathāgatas possess the five exalted wisdoms such as mirror-like exalted wisdom,

original: so sor de rnams me long lta bu la sogs pa'i rigs lnga rnams yin na /
analyzed: so sor de rnams me long lta bu la sogs pa'i rigs lnga rnams yin na /
translated: and each of them is a member of the five families such as the mirror-like family.

original: de ci ltar sde rigs tha dad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar sde rigs tha dad pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they different clans?

original: skye rigs tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye rigs tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are different clans because they are different families.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi me long lta bu la sogs pa rnams kyi re re'i mthun pa'i skye rigs thog ma med pa nas grub cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi me long lta bu la sogs pa rnams kyi re re'i mthun pa'i skye rigs thog ma med pa nas grub cing /
translated: The mirror-like and so forth of the bodhisattvas are each a type of concordant generation that has existed since beginningless time.

original: du ma'i mthun pa'i skye rigs ni drug pa ste du ma'i mthun pa drug pa'i yang re re'i mthun pa cher stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyis na de dang de'i sde rigs kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir na de dang der bsdu'o zhes pas /
analyzed: du ma'i mthun pa'i skye rigs ni drug pa ste du ma'i mthun pa drug pa'i yang re re'i mthun pa cher stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyis na de dang de'i sde rigs kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir na de dang der bsdu'o zhes pas /
translated: The concordant generation of the many is the sixth. Since each of the concordant generations of the many is more powerful, they are included in the individual types.

original: lnga nyid do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: lnga nyid do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, it is said that there are five.

original: sde rigs rnam pa lnga ru bshad //
analyzed: sde rigs rnam pa lnga ru bshad //
translated: The types are explained as five.

original: ces so // yang na 'di ltar 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: ces so // yang na 'di ltar 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Or else, it should be engaged in this way.

original: 'o na rigs lngas ma bsdus pa gzhan rnams lam khyab pa'i phyir nyi tshe ba'i spro bar byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na rigs lngas ma bsdus pa gzhan rnams lam khyab pa'i phyir nyi tshe ba'i spro bar byed par 'gyur ro zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: If it is asked, “Since the others are not included in the five types, are they partial emanations?”

original: de rnams sems can gyi rigs nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams sems can gyi rigs nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not, because they are included in the types of sentient beings.

original: 'o na de lta na sems can gyi sde rigs mchog nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na sems can gyi sde rigs mchog nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, the types of sentient beings would be supreme.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' thams cad kyi bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' thams cad kyi bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because he is the lord of all vajra beings.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: gzhan rnams kyang de las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyang de las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the others also arise from him.

original: phul du byung ba'i khyad par las ni de rnams rigs gzhan nyid du nye bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i khyad par las ni de rnams rigs gzhan nyid du nye bar bstan pa ste /
translated: They are taught to be separate lineages due to their distinctive excellence.

original: gang la de 'dra ba'i phul du byung ba med pa de la rigs gzhan du rnam par bstan pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir sems can gyi rigs kho nar tha snyad gdags te /🔽sems can gyi rigs de dang de'i rigs kyi rjes su byed pa ni de dang der bsdus pa'i phyir lnga nyid do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang la de 'dra ba'i phul du byung ba med pa de la rigs gzhan du rnam par bstan pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir sems can gyi rigs kho nar tha snyad gdags te / sems can gyi rigs de dang de'i rigs kyi rjes su byed pa ni de dang der bsdus pa'i phyir lnga nyid do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Those who do not have such excellence are not taught to be separate lineages, because there is no reason for it. Sentient beings are designated as just one lineage,🔽because they are included in that lineage of sentient beings.

original: rigs ni rnam pa lnga zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rigs ni rnam pa lnga zhes pa ste /
translated: The five lineages are taught to be the five lineages of sentient beings.

original: de yang spros pa las phung po lnga dang khams bzhi rnams dang dbang po lnga rnams dang yul lnga rnams so sor de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyis sam zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang du bya ba dang drag po dang sna tshogs kyi ngo bo'i
analyzed: de yang spros pa las phung po lnga dang khams bzhi rnams dang dbang po lnga rnams dang yul lnga rnams so sor de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyis sam zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang du bya ba dang drag po dang sna tshogs kyi ngo bo'i
translated: Furthermore, the five aggregates, the four elements, the five sense organs, and the five objects are individually the nature of the five tathagatas, or the nature of pacifying, increasing, controlling, wrath, and various activities.🔽

original: dbye @20b bas dang / me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga rnams dang lhan cig rnam pa brgya'o //
analyzed: dbye @20b bas dang / me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga rnams dang lhan cig rnam pa brgya'o //
translated: Moreover, from the elaboration of those, there are one hundred aspects, by the individual natures of the five aggregates, four elements, five sense powers, and five objects, as the natures of the five transcendent lords, or by the divisions of pacifying, increasing, controlling, destroying, and various.

original: de yang dbye ba byas na mtha' yas te mur thug pa med cing grangs med pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang dbye ba byas na mtha' yas te mur thug pa med cing grangs med pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: And those are also divided into an infinitude, without limit, and innumerable.

original: rnam gsum zhes pa rnam pa gsum nyid ni de dang de'i rjes su byed pa rnams de dang der bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam gsum zhes pa rnam pa gsum nyid ni de dang de'i rjes su byed pa rnams de dang der bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three aspects are the three natures, because those that are subsequent to that are included in that.

original: de ltar ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni me longs ye shes su bsdu zhing /
analyzed: de ltar ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni me longs ye shes su bsdu zhing /
translated: Thus, the gnosis of uniformity is included in the mirror-like gnosis.

original: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su'o zhes 'thad pa dang bcas pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su'o zhes 'thad pa dang bcas pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The wisdom of successful activities is the wisdom of discernment.

original: yang na nga rgyal dang phrag dog shes rab kyi rang bzhin can dag 'dod chags kyi nad  du 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na nga rgyal dang phrag dog shes rab kyi rang bzhin can dag 'dod chags kyi nad  du 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Alternatively, pride and envy, which have the nature of wisdom, are included in the disease of desire.

original: yang na nga rgyal ni sku'i rigs su ste /
analyzed: yang na nga rgyal ni sku'i rigs su ste /
translated: Alternatively, pride is in the family of the body,

original: gti mug gi rten can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug gi rten can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of delusion.

original: zhe sdang gi rigs su phra ma dang phrag dog dag yang na ste zhe sdang las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rigs su phra ma dang phrag dog dag yang na ste zhe sdang las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Slander and envy are in the family of anger, or alternatively, because they arise from anger.

original: de thams cad kyang rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs gcig pur shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de thams cad kyang rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs gcig pur shes par bya ste /
translated: All of these should be understood as being in the single family of Vajrasattva.

original: gang gsungs par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gsungs par 'gyur ba /
translated: As will be stated:

original: rigs ni rnam pa lngar gsungs shing /
analyzed: rigs ni rnam pa lngar gsungs shing /
translated: The families are said to be five,

original: stong nyid rdo rje'i gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: stong nyid rdo rje'i gcig kho na'o //
translated: but emptiness is the vajra alone.

original: zhes so // 'dus par yang rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag ste khyod rnams kyis sems lus kyi rnam par bskyed cig ces pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes so // 'dus par yang rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag ste khyod rnams kyis sems lus kyi rnam par bskyed cig ces pa la sogs pas so //
translated: And in the Guhyasamaja, the three vajras are established as having the nature of non-division, as it is said, “You all should generate mind in the form of body,” and so forth.

original: gang las rigs gzhan rnams su 'gyur ba dang dang po'i 'byung ba'i rigs de rnams ci zhig yin cing ji ltar na de rnams rigs zhes brjod par bya zhe na gsungs pa rigs rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang las rigs gzhan rnams su 'gyur ba dang dang po'i 'byung ba'i rigs de rnams ci zhig yin cing ji ltar na de rnams rigs zhes brjod par bya zhe na gsungs pa rigs rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: From what are the other families and the first-originated family? What are those families, and how should they be called families? It is said, “The families are the five elements,” and so forth.

original: 'byung ba lnga rnams sam phung po rnams ni rigs rnams te de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo sangs rgyas rnams yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga rnams sam phung po rnams ni rigs rnams te de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo sangs rgyas rnams yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The five elements or the aggregates are the families, because they are the nature of the purification of those.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid du dang por rdo rje 'dzin pas spro ba'i phyir dang po nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid du dang por rdo rje 'dzin pas spro ba'i phyir dang po nyid do //
translated: They are the first, because the first Vajradhara emanated from their nature.

original: de rnams kyang de ma thag tu dpag tu med pa'i ngo bos gang 'di rnams kyi rigs so zhes brjod par bya ba de dang de'i ngo bos de las byung ba rnams rigs su byed pa'i phyir bgrang bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyang de ma thag tu dpag tu med pa'i ngo bos gang 'di rnams kyi rigs so zhes brjod par bya ba de dang de'i ngo bos de las byung ba rnams rigs su byed pa'i phyir bgrang bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Also, those are immediately filled with an immeasurable essence.  That which is to be called “this is the type of those,” by the essence of that and that, those that arise from that are made into a type, because they are counted.

original: de la 'byung ba lnga rnams ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang rnam par shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'byung ba lnga rnams ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang rnam par shes pa rnams te /
translated: The five elements are earth, water, fire, wind, and consciousness.

original: phung po lnga rnams ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: phung po lnga rnams ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The five aggregates are form, feeling, discernment, formation, and consciousness.

original: rab skyes rigs rnams zhes pa de rnams las rab tu skyes pa'i rigs gzhan rnams zhes pa'i @21a * //
analyzed: rab skyes rigs rnams zhes pa de rnams las rab tu skyes pa'i rigs gzhan rnams zhes pa'i @21a * //
translated: The “types that arise from those” are the other types that arise from those.

original: don to // 'o na de ltar na stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid dang phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor las shes par bya ba'i don gyi thabs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: don to // 'o na de ltar na stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid dang phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor las shes par bya ba'i don gyi thabs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Thus, the method of understanding the reality of emptiness and the method of understanding the meaning of the yoga of the seal are endowed with that.

original: de gnyis gsal bar byas kyi //
analyzed: de gnyis gsal bar byas kyi //
translated: Those two are clarified.

original: 'dir bsgom par bya ba cung zad nye bar bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsgom par bya ba cung zad nye bar bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not that something to be cultivated is taught in the least,

original: rdzogs pa'i ngo bo'i rigs lnga'i rnal 'byor ma rnams nges par bstan pa'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang de'i sgo kho nas de ltar gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /🔽bden te / de kho na nyid du na bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po dang / bsgoms pa rnams skye ba med pas gdod ma nas zhi ba nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad der ston pa ni /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i ngo bo'i rigs lnga'i rnal 'byor ma rnams nges par bstan pa'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang de'i sgo kho nas de ltar gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na / bden te / de kho na nyid du na bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po dang / bsgoms pa rnams skye ba med pas gdod ma nas zhi ba nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad der ston pa ni /
translated: because the yogic adeptness of the five families, which is the nature of perfection, is definitely taught, and because the yogic adepts also make that clear just through that door.🔽That is true, but in reality, since what is to be cultivated, the cultivator, and the cultivation are non-arisen, they are primordially peace itself.

original: sgom pa po med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa po med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of all phenomena as that is “no cultivator,” and so on.

original: de ci sngags dang lha dag chad pa kho na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'am zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ci sngags dang lha dag chad pa kho na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'am zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If it is asked, “Is the mantra and deity just the termination of the stage of perfection?”

original: gnas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes pa'o //
translated: it is said, “the place.”

original: spros pa med pa ni stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa med pa ni stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is free of proliferation because it is of one taste with emptiness.

original: rang bzhin ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo ste de'i ngo bos sngags dang lha dag gnas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo ste de'i ngo bos sngags dang lha dag gnas so //
translated: The nature is the essence of innate great bliss, and by that essence the mantras and deities abide.

original: de nyid rgyas par ston pa rnam snang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par ston pa rnam snang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That itself is taught extensively in the words “Vairochana,” and so on.

original: a'a ro li ka ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: a'a ro li ka ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Arokika is Amitābha.

original: snying stobs can ni lus dang ldan pa ste rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: snying stobs can ni lus dang ldan pa ste rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The sattva is the one endowed with a body, which is Vajrasattva.

original: zhi ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The peaceful one is Amitābha.

original: thams cad ni don yod do //🔽rnam sangs rgyas ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: thams cad ni don yod do // rnam sangs rgyas ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: All is Amoghasiddhi.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bos spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin ni de kho na nyid du brjod do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bos spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin ni de kho na nyid du brjod do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Vairochana and so on are said to be reality, which is the nature free from proliferation.

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams rang gi gzhung lugs su ma grags pa nyid kyi phyir don gsungs pa //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams rang gi gzhung lugs su ma grags pa nyid kyi phyir don gsungs pa //
translated: The words “Brahmā,” and so on, are not well known in our own textual system, so the meaning is stated.

original: tshangs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Brahmā,” and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvāṇa is nirvāṇa.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kho na dngos por na tshangs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kho na dngos por na tshangs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, only the Buddha is Brahman, not others,

original: de ni rang gi ngo bos mya ngan las ma 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bos mya ngan las ma 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are not by nature in nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar phyi ma rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar phyi ma rnams la yang ngo //
translated: This is also the case for the latter.

original: 'jug phyir zhes pa khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug phyir zhes pa khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of engagement, because of pervasion.

original: dge phyir zhes pa shin tu dge ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dge phyir zhes pa shin tu dge ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of virtue, because of being extremely virtuous.

original: thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni gnyug ma'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni gnyug ma'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature of all is the innate nature.

original: gang gi phyir de la rgyun gyis gnas pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la rgyun gyis gnas pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Because it abides continuously, it is all.

original: 'di thams cad gang gi bdag nyid yin pa de kho na nyid de ni da dung yang mi shes so zhe na @21b gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di thams cad gang gi bdag nyid yin pa de kho na nyid de ni da dung yang mi shes so zhe na @21b gsungs pa /
translated: If you do not know that nature of all, it is said:

original: bde pa dam pas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bde pa dam pas zhes pa ste /
translated: By the highest bliss.

original: bde ba dam pa ni spros pa med pa'i bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: bde ba dam pa ni spros pa med pa'i bde ba chen po'o //
translated: The highest bliss is the unelaborated great bliss.

original: dga' ba rtogs phyir rnams sangs rgyas //
analyzed: dga' ba rtogs phyir rnams sangs rgyas //
translated: Because of the realization of joy, they are buddhas.

original: zhes pa bde ba chen po de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir rnam sangs rgyas te sangs rgyas kho na'o //
analyzed: zhes pa bde ba chen po de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir rnam sangs rgyas te sangs rgyas kho na'o //
translated: Since he is the realization of that very great bliss, he is the Buddha, the Awakened One.

original: 'o na lha'i khyad par rnams bsgrubs zin mod ;
analyzed: 'o na lha'i khyad par rnams bsgrubs zin mod ;
translated: Well then, the distinctions of the deities have already been accomplished.

original: ci lha nyid ni ma bsgrubs so zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci lha nyid ni ma bsgrubs so zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: But is the deity itself not accomplished?🔽It is said:

original: lus la zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lus la zhes pa'o //
translated: In the body.

original: lus la 'byung zhes pa lha ste yi ge bsnan pa dang phyis pa dag gis so //
analyzed: lus la 'byung zhes pa lha ste yi ge bsnan pa dang phyis pa dag gis so //
translated: The deity arises in the body, by the addition and subtraction of syllables.
