original: de ltar gyur pa de kho na bcom ldan 'das su brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de kho na bcom ldan 'das su brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: That which is so is to be called the Blessed One.🔽It is said:

original: skal pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skal pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Fortunate one.

original: de ltar yongs su dag pa'i yid la bde ba chen po'i ros rjes su dran pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams gnyug ma'i sa bon las skye ba'o zhes pas de rnams 'di la yod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su dag pa'i yid la bde ba chen po'i ros rjes su dran pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams gnyug ma'i sa bon las skye ba'o zhes pas de rnams 'di la yod pa'o //
translated: Thus, the lord of the qualities of Maheśvara, etc., who is mindful of the taste of great bliss in the completely pure mind, arises from the innate seed.

original: phyag rgya rnams kyi nges pa'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya rnams kyi nges pa'i don gsungs pa /
translated: The definitive meaning of the mudras is stated:

original: skyed byed ma zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyed byed ma zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The one who generates, etc.

original: 'gro ba'i skye bo zhes pa 'gro bar 'jug pa 'phags pa'i 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i skye bo zhes pa 'gro bar 'jug pa 'phags pa'i 'jig rten no //
translated: The beings of the world are the noble ones who enter the world.

original: rnam dbye zhes pa spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam dbye zhes pa spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: The analysis is the analysis of what is to be abandoned and what is to be adopted.

original: tshos ma zhes pa la sogs pas mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: tshos ma zhes pa la sogs pas mdor bstan nas /
translated: Having summarized with “the weaver,” etc.,

original: chags byed phyir zhes pa la sogs pas rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: chags byed phyir zhes pa la sogs pas rgyas par bshad do //
translated: he explains in detail with “because of attachment,” etc.

original: chags byed phyir zhes pa rjes su chags par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags byed phyir zhes pa rjes su chags par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of attachment is because of subsequent attachment.

original: shes rab kyis ni bsam pa dang bag la nyal rnam par mkhyen nas ji ltar rigs par rjes su gnas par byed pa'i phyir sems can thams cad rjes su chags pa can nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pas shes rab kho na de skad brjod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bsam pa dang bag la nyal rnam par mkhyen nas ji ltar rigs par rjes su gnas par byed pa'i phyir sems can thams cad rjes su chags pa can nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pas shes rab kho na de skad brjod do //
translated: Having understood the thoughts and propensities by means of wisdom, he subsequently abides in whatever way is appropriate. Therefore, wisdom alone is said to be subsequently attached to all beings.

original: yon tan te stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nam mkha'i 'dod 'jo las 'jo phyir te skyed par byed pa'i phyir shes rab kho na de skad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan te stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nam mkha'i 'dod 'jo las 'jo phyir te skyed par byed pa'i phyir shes rab kho na de skad brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because of the nature of the qualities such as the powers and fearlessnesses, which are like wish-fulfilling jewels in the sky, wisdom alone is said to be the producer, the creator.

original: g-yo ba'i phyir zhes pa srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i phyir zhes pa srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of its movement, it does not abide in either existence or nirvana.

original: reg min zhes pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: reg min zhes pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not touched, because it is of one taste with emptiness.

original: phyi rol gyi phyag rgya rnams kyang shes rab kyi yon tan de rnams nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir shes rab nyid du rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi phyag rgya rnams kyang shes rab kyi yon tan de rnams nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir shes rab nyid du rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The external seals are also to be understood as wisdom, because they conform to those very qualities of wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ltar gyur pa'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin phyi rol gyi phyag rgya rnams kho na lhag par mos pas kyang @22a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ltar gyur pa'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin phyi rol gyi phyag rgya rnams kho na lhag par mos pas kyang @22a * //
translated: Therefore, by devotion to the external seals, which are of the nature of that wisdom,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po'i de kho na nyid shes rab 'dod pa pos bsten pa'o zhes pas brten par bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po'i de kho na nyid shes rab 'dod pa pos bsten pa'o zhes pas brten par bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: the Blessed One has said that the reality of great bliss, which is of one taste with emptiness, of the Tathagata lineage, should be relied upon by one who desires wisdom.

original: rdzogs pa'i ngo bo'i lha bsgrubs nas sngags sgrub pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i ngo bo'i lha bsgrubs nas sngags sgrub pa gsungs pa /
translated: Having accomplished the deity of the perfected nature, he teaches the accomplishment of the mantra.

original: bzlas pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bzlas pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The mantra is recitation, etc.

original: a'a li dang k'a li shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bo dag sngags mchog nyid kyi phyir na thams cad de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir brjod pa bzlas pa zhes pa 'di ni spros pa med pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: a'a li dang k'a li shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bo dag sngags mchog nyid kyi phyir na thams cad de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir brjod pa bzlas pa zhes pa 'di ni spros pa med pa'i sngags so //
translated: Since the vowels and consonants, which are the nature of wisdom and means, are the supreme mantra, everything is of their nature, and the expression is called recitation. This is the unelaborate mantra.

original: dkyil 'khor dang phyag rgya dag kyang rdzogs pa la rtogs par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang phyag rgya dag kyang rdzogs pa la rtogs par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The maṇḍala and the mudrā are also taught to be realized in the perfection.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes pa'o //
translated: The maṇḍala is drawn

original: 'bri ba ni ri mo ste rdul dang 'dam la sogs pa rnams la rkang pa'i gzugs brnyan ni rkang pa'i ri mo'o //🔽nyed phyir zhes pa nyed par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bri ba ni ri mo ste rdul dang 'dam la sogs pa rnams la rkang pa'i gzugs brnyan ni rkang pa'i ri mo'o // nyed phyir zhes pa nyed par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Drawing is painting. The footprint on dust, mud, and so on is the footprint.🔽 Because of stepping,

original: kun du bskyod pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: kun du bskyod pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: stepping is moving everywhere.

original: 'di ni mngon par dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par dgongs pa ste /
translated: This is the intention.

original: dkyil 'khor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas gshegs par byed pa kho na'i phyir te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas gshegs par byed pa kho na'i phyir te /
translated: The maṇḍala is also the tathāgatas coming from everywhere, because it causes them to come.

original: de ltar 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bor rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas kun nas bskyed pa'i phyir de mthong ba rnams kyi yang bsod nams du ma nye bar sog pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dkyil 'khor du brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bor rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas kun nas bskyed pa'i phyir de mthong ba rnams kyi yang bsod nams du ma nye bar sog pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dkyil 'khor du brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, since this is also generated by the yogin who is perfected in the nature of the Tathāgata, it should be called a maṇḍala because it is the cause of the accumulation of much merit for those who see it.

original: lag pa bskyod pa phyag rgyar 'gyur //
analyzed: lag pa bskyod pa phyag rgyar 'gyur //
translated: A hand gesture is a mudrā,

original: sor mo nyed pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sor mo nyed pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: and so is a finger gesture.

original: zhes pa 'dir ni rgyu rjes su ma bkod par 'di ltar ston par byed de /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir ni rgyu rjes su ma bkod par 'di ltar ston par byed de /
translated: Here, without setting forth a cause, it is taught like this:

original: bya ba dpag tu med pa can gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi /
analyzed: bya ba dpag tu med pa can gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi /
translated: For yogins who have immeasurable activities,

original: thams cad la rgyu bkod na rgya ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad la rgyu bkod na rgya ches par 'gyur te /
translated: if a cause is set forth for everything, it would be excessive.

original: 'di thams cad ni shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dang phyag rgya'i ngo bor rtogs par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dang phyag rgya'i ngo bor rtogs par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: All of this should be understood as the nature of the maṇḍala and mudrā, which is the nature of wisdom and method.

original: 'o na de ltar bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang bsgoms pa mi 'thad na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang bsgoms pa mi 'thad na /
translated: Well then, if the object of meditation, the meditator, and the meditation are not tenable,

original: rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor nges par bstan pa'i bsam par bya ba dang bsam pa la ci rnam par thams cad du rdzogs pa kho na ma yin no zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor nges par bstan pa'i bsam par bya ba dang bsam pa la ci rnam par thams cad du rdzogs pa kho na ma yin no zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If one thinks, “Is it not the case that the perfect maṇḍala is not completely perfect in every way?”

original: de ni bsam bya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bsam bya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, “That is to be contemplated,” and so on.

original: 'o na de ltar sems kyi rgyu ba dpag tu med pa mi 'gag na rnam par g-yeng ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar sems kyi rgyu ba dpag tu med pa mi 'gag na rnam par g-yeng ba kho na ste /
translated: “Well, if the immeasurable movement of the mind is not blocked in that way, it is just distraction;

original: bsam gtan ma yin no zhes pas de bsam byar yang mi 'gyur ro @22b zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan ma yin no zhes pas de bsam byar yang mi 'gyur ro @22b zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: it is not meditative concentration.” Thus, it is not even to be contemplated.

original: phal zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phal zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, “The ordinary,” and so on.

original: bde de rang gis longs spyad bya //🔽zhes pa man ngag ji lta ba bzhin rgyun mi 'chad par goms pa las sam /
analyzed: bde de rang gis longs spyad bya // zhes pa man ngag ji lta ba bzhin rgyun mi 'chad par goms pa las sam /
translated: That bliss is to be enjoyed by oneself.🔽As such, one should experience that bliss without obstruction at the beginning, in the middle, and at the end, from the constant practice of the intimate instruction just as it is, or from the consecration of a youthful woman.

original: lang tsho can dbang bskur bdag gis de ltar thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma rnams su gang bde ba de 'gog pa med par nyams su myong ba ni bsam gtan du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lang tsho can dbang bskur bdag gis de ltar thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma rnams su gang bde ba de 'gog pa med par nyams su myong ba ni bsam gtan du brjod par bya'o //
translated: That is to be called “meditative concentration.”

original: de bzhin du bsam pa gzhan rnams la yang 'gog pa med par rab tu 'byung ba'i bde ba chen po rjes su dran pa las gang la bsam bya dang bsam gtan dag tu mi 'gyur ba g-yeng ba ci las yin zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam pa gzhan rnams la yang 'gog pa med par rab tu 'byung ba'i bde ba chen po rjes su dran pa las gang la bsam bya dang bsam gtan dag tu mi 'gyur ba g-yeng ba ci las yin zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, there is no obstruction to the other thoughts, and the great bliss of going forth is recalled. What is the distraction from which there is no object of thought and no meditation? This is the intention.

original: yang na phal zhes pa bla ma la dbang bskur ba'i dus su gang thob ste nyams su myong ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po de longs spyad bya ste rang nyid kun nas spyad par bya zhing gzhan gyi tshe na yang ngo //
analyzed: yang na phal zhes pa bla ma la dbang bskur ba'i dus su gang thob ste nyams su myong ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po de longs spyad bya ste rang nyid kun nas spyad par bya zhing gzhan gyi tshe na yang ngo //
translated: Or else, the “common” is that great innate bliss which is obtained and experienced at the time of the consecration of the guru, which is to be enjoyed, to be fully experienced by oneself and at the time of others.

original: yang na phyag rgya'i sbyor ba las de lta kho nar spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na phyag rgya'i sbyor ba las de lta kho nar spyad par bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is to be enjoyed in that very way from the union with the consort.

original: nye bar spyad pa'i bde ba gang gis 'chi ste dbang po rnams 'gog par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nye bar spyad pa'i bde ba gang gis 'chi ste dbang po rnams 'gog par 'gyur zhing /
translated: By what enjoyment does one die, that is, by which the senses are stopped?

original: 'dir zhes pa mthong ba'i skye ba kho na la ste /
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa mthong ba'i skye ba kho na la ste /
translated: “Here” means in this very life.

original: bde ba de bsam gtan du brjod do //
analyzed: bde ba de bsam gtan du brjod do //
translated: That bliss is called meditation.

original: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i de ltar gyur pa'i bsam gtan ni lhun gyis grub pa las de ltar rjes su dran pa tsam gyis bshad ma thag pa'i man ngag la yang rjes su shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i de ltar gyur pa'i bsam gtan ni lhun gyis grub pa las de ltar rjes su dran pa tsam gyis bshad ma thag pa'i man ngag la yang rjes su shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The meditative concentration of the perfect yogi is spontaneous, and one should understand that it is just a recollection by means of the aforementioned instructions.

original: ces pa zhes pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa zhes pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Thus is the conclusion.

original: sogs pa'i sgra yis go cha la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra yis go cha la sogs pa ste /
translated: The word etc. refers to armoring, etc.

original: rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang go cha la sogs pa sgom pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid de phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid 'dis skabs su byed cing skabs su bab par byed pas na
analyzed: rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang go cha la sogs pa sgom pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid de phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid 'dis skabs su byed cing skabs su bab par byed pas na
translated: The reality of those who generate the thought of enlightenment and cultivate armoring, etc., which are the means of expression and the object of expression, is this nonerroneous reality.

original: skabs te yongs su bcad pa dang / le'u zhes pa don tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: skabs te yongs su bcad pa dang / le'u zhes pa don tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Since it is the occasion, the context, it is the occasion, and it is the chapter in the sense of a section and a topic.

original: dang po ni thog mar bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni thog mar bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The first is so called because it is taught first.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Yogācārabhūmi

original: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma dang po'o /
analyzed: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma dang po'o /
translated: This is the first cluster in the Cluster of Instructions.

original: // / de ltar yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi sems kho na bsgom byar mdor bstan to //
analyzed: // / de ltar yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi sems kho na bsgom byar mdor bstan to //
translated: Thus, the correct thought of awakening alone is the object of meditation, as briefly indicated.

original: de kho na yang 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang / thabs kyi rab tu dbye bas rgyud gsum gyi bdag nyid can no zhes pa 'di tsam ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'o //🔽ji skad du @23a * //
analyzed: de kho na yang 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang / thabs kyi rab tu dbye bas rgyud gsum gyi bdag nyid can no zhes pa 'di tsam ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'o // ji skad du @23a * //
translated: That very [thought of awakening] has the nature of a continuum with three parts, due to the distinctions of result, cause, and method. This much was taught by the Blessed One.

original: mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du gsungs pa /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Vajra Tent of the Ḍākinī:

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
translated: Emptiness and compassion are inseparable,

original: gang du sems ni rab bsgom pa //
analyzed: gang du sems ni rab bsgom pa //
translated: where the mind is well cultivated.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas chos dang ni //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas chos dang ni //
translated: That very [thought of awakening] is taught to be the Buddha, the Dharma,

original: dge 'dun gyi yang bstan pa'o //🔽zhes so // bsgom par bya ba de kho na la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nang du 'dus kyi /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi yang bstan pa'o // zhes so // bsgom par bya ba de kho na la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nang du 'dus kyi /
translated: and the Saṅgha.

original: log par bsgom par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: log par bsgom par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The factors of awakening are included within that very object of meditation, but not within a mistaken object of meditation.

original: yang na yongs su 'dris pa'i don du byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'i bsgom bya byang chub sems de goms par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na yongs su 'dris pa'i don du byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'i bsgom bya byang chub sems de goms par bya ste /
translated: Or else, in order to become thoroughly familiar with it, one should cultivate that enlightenment mind which is to be cultivated, surrounded by the aspects of the factors of enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir de rnams skabs su mdzad pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams skabs su mdzad pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to explain those, he says, “Then, the Bhagavat, etc.”

original: de nas zhes pa lam bstan pa'i de ma thag par ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa lam bstan pa'i de ma thag par ro //
translated: “Then” means immediately after the teaching of the path.

original: byang chub ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: “Enlightenment” is omniscience.

original: de'i phyogs ni rjes su mthun pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i phyogs ni rjes su mthun pa rnams so //
translated: “Its factors” are the concordances with it.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kho na ni byang chub kyi phyogs nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kho na ni byang chub kyi phyogs nyid do //
translated: The factors of enlightenment themselves are the factors of enlightenment.

original: de la rjes su lta ba gang rnams kyis lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la gcig nyid dang du ma nyid la sogs pa mi rung bas na /
analyzed: de la rjes su lta ba gang rnams kyis lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la gcig nyid dang du ma nyid la sogs pa mi rung bas na /
translated: Among them, those who are watching, since it is not possible for body, feeling, thought, and dharmas to be either one or many, etc.,

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi shes pa rnams kyis dran pa nye bar 'jog pa de rnams ni dran pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi rang bzhin rnams te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yin zhing /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi shes pa rnams kyis dran pa nye bar 'jog pa de rnams ni dran pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi rang bzhin rnams te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yin zhing /
translated: The mindfulnesses that are established by the cognitions of the absence of intrinsic reality are the mindfulnesses that are the nature of wisdom, the cause of mindfulness.

original: dmigs pa'i bye brag las bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i bye brag las bzhi rnams te /
translated: They are four due to the distinction of their objects.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The mindfulness of the body, the mindfulness of feeling, the mindfulness of thought, and the mindfulness of dharmas.

original: de la nang gi lus ni mig la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi lus ni mig la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: Therein, the internal body is the five beginning with the eye.

original: phyi'i lus ni rang gi lus las phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: phyi'i lus ni rang gi lus las phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The external body is the five beginning with form that are external to one's own body.

original: nang dang phyi'i lus ni rang gi lus la sogs par gtogs pa'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus ni rang gi lus la sogs par gtogs pa'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The internal and external body is the remainder of the elements and the derivative of the elements belonging to one's own body, etc.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi gsum nyid ni lus rnam pa gsum rnams la dmigs pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi gsum nyid ni lus rnam pa gsum rnams la dmigs pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The threefoldness of feeling, etc. is due to the distinction of their objects, which are the three kinds of bodies.

original: tshor ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Feeling is pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: sems ni dbang po lnga'i shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems ni dbang po lnga'i shes pa rnams so //
translated: Mind refers to the five sense consciousnesses.

original: chos rnams ni sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos rnams ni sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
translated: Mental objects are the virtuous, nonvirtuous, and ethically neutral mental factors.

original: lus la sogs pa'i rjes su lta ba zhes pa /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i rjes su lta ba zhes pa /
translated: The phrase “observing the body, etc.”

original: lus la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyi rjes su lta ba ste /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyi rjes su lta ba ste /
translated: means observing the reality of the body, etc.

original: 'di @23b ni lus so bdag gi lus so rtag pa'o mi rtag pa'i bde ba'o sdug bsngal ba'o zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di @23b ni lus so bdag gi lus so rtag pa'o mi rtag pa'i bde ba'o sdug bsngal ba'o zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because it is free from the conceptualization that thinks, “This is the body,” “This is my body,” “This is permanent,” “This is impermanent,” “This is pleasant,” or “This is painful.”

original: rjes su lta ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: rjes su lta ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: Moreover, this observation and this nonconceptualization are due to the application of nonapprehending.

original: 'o na gal te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis chos thams cad shes na byang chub kyi phyogs phyi ma rnams kyis ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis chos thams cad shes na byang chub kyi phyogs phyi ma rnams kyis ci bya zhe na /
translated: If all phenomena are known by means of the applications of mindfulness, what is the point of the remaining factors of awakening?

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case.

original: gang gi phyir de rnams kyis chos nyid du yongs su shes na yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis chos kyi khyad par yongs su shes pa'i ched du sum cu rtsa bdun du yang goms par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams kyis chos nyid du yongs su shes na yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis chos kyi khyad par yongs su shes pa'i ched du sum cu rtsa bdun du yang goms par byed do //
translated: Because, although they fully understand reality, they cultivate the thirty-seven for the sake of fully understanding the particularities of phenomena in the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du dmigs par byed la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du dmigs par byed la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Therefore, the vehicles of the sravakas are objectified in the aspects of impermanence, etc., but the bodhisattvas are not, since they are in the mode of nonapprehension.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang stong pa nyid kyang 'di rnams kyi yul du 'gyur ro zhes pas nyan thos kyi lam yang chos nyid kyi sgo nas goms par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang stong pa nyid kyang 'di rnams kyi yul du 'gyur ro zhes pas nyan thos kyi lam yang chos nyid kyi sgo nas goms par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the aspects of impermanence, etc., and emptiness are also their objects, so the path of the sravakas is cultivated in terms of reality.

original: yang gis gdung ba med pa nyid sdud par byed do //
analyzed: yang gis gdung ba med pa nyid sdud par byed do //
translated: The word “also” includes the absence of distress.

original: de'i phyir gus par byas te rgyun du sbyor ba'i phyir gdung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gus par byas te rgyun du sbyor ba'i phyir gdung ba med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the absence of distress is due to the absence of distress in the continuous practice of respect.

original: rjes su blta bas dang shes bzhin du yang sbyor ba'i phyir shes bzhin can no //
analyzed: rjes su blta bas dang shes bzhin du yang sbyor ba'i phyir shes bzhin can no //
translated: He is “attentive” because he is engaged in the practice of insight and introspection.

original: mi brjed pa'i bdag nyid dang srung ba med pa nyid kyis dang / g-yeng ba med par 'byung bas dran pas sbyor ba'i phyir dran pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi brjed pa'i bdag nyid dang srung ba med pa nyid kyis dang / g-yeng ba med par 'byung bas dran pas sbyor ba'i phyir dran pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is “mindful” because he is engaged in the practice of mindfulness, which is characterized by non-forgetfulness and non-negligence, and which arises without distraction.

original: brtson 'grus dang shes rab dang dran pa 'di rnams kho na'i rjes su bsngags pa gsungs pa /🔽rnam par bsal te zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang shes rab dang dran pa 'di rnams kho na'i rjes su bsngags pa gsungs pa / rnam par bsal te zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The praise of these very same virtues of effort, wisdom, and mindfulness is stated in the following verse:🔽“Having completely abandoned the worldly attitudes of desire and aversion toward acquisition and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and disparagement, and pleasure and pain, the bodhisattva is said to be mindful.”

original: rnam par bsal te zhes pa ni rab tu spangs nas so //
analyzed: rnam par bsal te zhes pa ni rab tu spangs nas so //
translated: “Having completely abandoned” means having thoroughly rejected.

original: 'jig rten la zhes pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnyed pa dang grags pa dang bde ba dang bstod pa rnams la brnab sems te chags pa dang ma rnyed pa dang ma grags pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang smad pa rnams la yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la zhes pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnyed pa dang grags pa dang bde ba dang bstod pa rnams la brnab sems te chags pa dang ma rnyed pa dang ma grags pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang smad pa rnams la yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: “The worldly attitudes” are the covetousness and ill will toward acquisition and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and disparagement, and pleasure and pain, which are worldly dharmas.

original: 'di rnams kyis sems sam lus dang ngag dang yid rnams yang dag par 'jog ste yang dag par 'dzin pa'am rab tu 'jug pa'o zhes pa yang dag par 'jog pa rnams dang / 'di rnams kyis bag la nyal rnams rab tu spong ba'o zhes byas nas yang dag par spong ba rnams su brjod do //🔽de @24a * //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis sems sam lus dang ngag dang yid rnams yang dag par 'jog ste yang dag par 'dzin pa'am rab tu 'jug pa'o zhes pa yang dag par 'jog pa rnams dang / 'di rnams kyis bag la nyal rnams rab tu spong ba'o zhes byas nas yang dag par spong ba rnams su brjod do // de @24a * //
translated: They are called right endeavors because they completely eliminate latent states.

original: rnams ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las gong du brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: rnams ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las gong du brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo bzhi rnams te /
translated: These are the four that have the nature of effort, which are higher than the application of mindfulness of phenomena.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽The four that have the nature of effort are the four right endeavors.🔽They are the four right endeavors because they cause the abandonment of nonvirtue and the generation of virtue.🔽They are the four right endeavors because they prevent the arising of nonvirtue and virtue that have not yet arisen,🔽cause the abandonment of nonvirtue and virtue that have arisen,

original: ma skyes pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: cause the arising of nonvirtue and virtue that have not yet arisen,

original: ngan 'gro rnams su ltung bar byed cing /🔽rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis gnod pa byed la /
analyzed: ngan 'gro rnams su ltung bar byed cing / rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis gnod pa byed la /
translated: and cause the nonloss of nonvirtue and virtue that have arisen.🔽They are called right endeavors because they cause the abandonment of latent states.

original: las rigs mthun pa'am las kyi bag chags byed do zhes pa sdig pa rnams te /🔽nges pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid kyis sa //
analyzed: las rigs mthun pa'am las kyi bag chags byed do zhes pa sdig pa rnams te /🔽nges pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid kyis sa //
translated: They are called right endeavors because they cause the abandonment of nonvirtue and the generation of virtue.

original: mi dge ba rnams ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa la sogs pa phyin ci log gi ngo bo kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa la sogs pa phyin ci log gi ngo bo kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: The nonvirtuous are the addictive natures, such as the misdeeds of body, etc., which are the essence of error.

original: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba nyid na yang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos rnams so //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba nyid na yang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos rnams so //
translated: They are also dharmas, because they hold their own characteristics, even though they are to be abandoned by those who seek liberation.

original: 'dun pa bskyed de /
analyzed: 'dun pa bskyed de /
translated: One should generate aspiration.

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus 'di ltar bya'o zhes par ro //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus 'di ltar bya'o zhes par ro //
translated: One should don the armor of effort, thinking, “I will do it this way.”

original: 'bad do ste sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis so //🔽brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: 'bad do ste sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis so // brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: One should strive, with the effort of application.

original: skyo ba med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis so //🔽sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par 'jog ste thabs kyi brtson 'grus kyis so //🔽de la sems zhum pa na rab tu 'dzin cing gzengs stod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyo ba med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis so // sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par 'jog ste thabs kyi brtson 'grus kyis so // de la sems zhum pa na rab tu 'dzin cing gzengs stod par byed pa'o //
translated: One should begin effort, with the effort of non-discouragement.🔽One should hold the mind and settle it, with the effort of means.🔽There, when the mind is depressed, one should hold it and uplift it.

original: rgod pa'i sems ni yang dag par 'jog ste mngon par sdud par byed do //
analyzed: rgod pa'i sems ni yang dag par 'jog ste mngon par sdud par byed do //
translated: When the mind is excited, one should settle it and subdue it.

original: dge ba rnams ni byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa rnams te /
analyzed: dge ba rnams ni byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa rnams te /
translated: The virtues are the thought of awakening, the perfection of generosity, and so on, together with their retinue.

original: rang dang gzhan la phan pa 'dod pa rnams kyis blang bar bya ba nyid kyis na gzung bar bya bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir chos rnams so //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la phan pa 'dod pa rnams kyis blang bar bya ba nyid kyis na gzung bar bya bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir chos rnams so //
translated: They are the Dharmas because they are to be taken up, like something to be grasped, by those who desire benefit for themselves and others.

original: de skyes pa rnams rgyun gyis gnas pa'i ched du ste tshogs kyi lam du'o //
analyzed: de skyes pa rnams rgyun gyis gnas pa'i ched du ste tshogs kyi lam du'o //
translated: They are to be cultivated for the sake of the persistence of those that have arisen, on the path of accumulation.

original: dpag tu med pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa'i thabs rnams kyis bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa'i thabs rnams kyis bsgom pa ste /
translated: They are to be cultivated by means of the immeasurable concentrations, formless states, immeasurables, and so on, which are the methods.

original: sbyor ba'i lam du ji ltar slar yang 'byung bar 'gyur bltar ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam du ji ltar slar yang 'byung bar 'gyur bltar ro //
translated: They are to be cultivated on the path of preparation, in order that they may arise again, as they did before.

original: mthong ba'i lam du yongs su rdzogs pa ste ji ltar rigs par 'phel bar ji ltar 'gyur ba ltar ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam du yongs su rdzogs pa ste ji ltar rigs par 'phel bar ji ltar 'gyur ba ltar ro //
translated: They are to be cultivated on the path of seeing, in order that they may be perfected, in accordance with their increase.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni dri ma med pa la sogs par bsgom pa'i lam la ste ji ltar rigs par yangs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur ba ltar ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni dri ma med pa la sogs par bsgom pa'i lam la ste ji ltar rigs par yangs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur ba ltar ro //
translated: The perfection of what is incomplete is on the path of meditation, on the stainless, etc., as is appropriate, in the form of expansion.

original: yang 'byung ba dang 'phel ba dang yangs pa nyid ces pa kun sdud pa ste 'dun pa bskyed pa la sogs pa bya ba'i khyad par rnams so //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba dang 'phel ba dang yangs pa nyid ces pa kun sdud pa ste 'dun pa bskyed pa la sogs pa bya ba'i khyad par rnams so //
translated: Again, the terms arising, increasing, and expanding include all the special activities such as generating aspiration, etc.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni phun sum tshogs pa @24b ste mngon par shes pa dang dbang po dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa nyid la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni phun sum tshogs pa @24b ste mngon par shes pa dang dbang po dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa nyid la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: Miraculous powers are the perfection of the supramundane dharmas such as the higher knowledges, the faculties, the powers, and the fearlessnesses.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi bzhi ste rgyu rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi bzhi ste rgyu rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
translated: The causes of miraculous powers are the bases of miraculous power.

original: de rnams kyang bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang bzhi rnams te /
translated: They are also four.

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa'o //
translated: They are the samadhi of aspiration, the samadhi of perseverance, the samadhi of mind, and the samadhi of investigation.

original: de ltar na kha cig 'dun pa drag po nyid kho nas yang dag par spong ba rnams kyis sems nang du 'jog pa la sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin gus par bya ste sbyor ba'o stobs las skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar na kha cig 'dun pa drag po nyid kho nas yang dag par spong ba rnams kyis sems nang du 'jog pa la sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin gus par bya ste sbyor ba'o stobs las skye'o //
translated: Thus, some, through intense aspiration alone, generate concentration, which has the characteristic of one-pointedness of mind, in the placement of mind internally.

original: kha cig yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus rnams kyis mi dge ba spong ba dang dge ba bskyed pa la shin tu rab tu sbyor ba la'o //
analyzed: kha cig yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus rnams kyis mi dge ba spong ba dang dge ba bskyed pa la shin tu rab tu sbyor ba la'o //
translated: Some, through the effort of the correct abandonings, apply themselves to the abandonment of nonvirtue and the generation of virtue.

original: kha cig zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan sems rnams kyis yongs su sbyong ba la'o //🔽kha cig ni ci bdag mi dge ba phra mo rnams kun du spyod dam //
analyzed: kha cig zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan sems rnams kyis yongs su sbyong ba la'o // kha cig ni ci bdag mi dge ba phra mo rnams kun du spyod dam //
translated: Some, through the signs of mental stability, mental flexibility, and equanimity, purify their minds.

original: gang bdag yongs su dpyad par bya'o zhes yang dag par nye bar 'jog pa la'o //
analyzed: gang bdag yongs su dpyad par bya'o zhes yang dag par nye bar 'jog pa la'o //
translated: Some, through the correct placements of mind, thoroughly establish the thought “I will investigate whether I engage in subtle nonvirtue or not.”

original: der de rnams ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams te /
analyzed: der de rnams ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams te /
translated: In this context, those are the concentrations of aspiration and so on.

original: 'di rnams skyes pa na rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang phrag dog dang ser sna dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dang khro ba dang sdig pa sbed pa'i ngo bo 'chab pa zhes pa kun nas dkris pa bcu po thub
analyzed: 'di rnams skyes pa na rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang phrag dog dang ser sna dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dang khro ba dang sdig pa sbed pa'i ngo bo 'chab pa zhes pa kun nas dkris pa bcu po thub
translated: When these are produced, the ten entanglements arise: lethargy, sleep, excitation, regret, envy, stinginess, shamelessness, lack of embarrassment, anger and concealment, which is the essence of hiding evil.

original: pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan du rnam par phye ba rnams ring du gyur pa na /
analyzed: pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan du rnam par phye ba rnams ring du gyur pa na /
translated: When these are far away, they are the ornaments of the intention of the Sage.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang the tshom dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes pa bag la nyal bcu bo thub pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan du rnam par phye ba rnams spang ba'i ched du yang dag par spong ba rnams kyis brtson 'grus rtsom pa kho na'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi skyon
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang the tshom dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes pa bag la nyal bcu bo thub pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan du rnam par phye ba rnams spang ba'i ched du yang dag par spong ba rnams kyis brtson 'grus rtsom pa kho na'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi skyon
translated: The ten latent tendencies are attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, doubt, the afflicted view of the self, extreme views, wrong views, holding a view as paramount, and holding ethics and modes of conduct as paramount.🔽In order to abandon these, one practices the four genuine restraints.🔽The six faults of samādhi are laziness, forgetting the instructions, dullness and agitation, lack of application, and application.

original: le lo dang dmigs pa brjed pa dang / bying pa dang rgod pa dang / 'du mi byed pa dang 'du byed pa zhes pa drug gi gnyen po'i phyogs spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad rnams bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: le lo dang dmigs pa brjed pa dang / bying pa dang rgod pa dang / 'du mi byed pa dang 'du byed pa zhes pa drug gi gnyen po'i phyogs spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad rnams bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The eight applications that abandon the factors that are discordant with the antidotes to those are cultivated.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dad pa dang 'dun pa @25a * //
analyzed: dad pa dang 'dun pa @25a * //
translated: faith, aspiration,

original: dang rtsol ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang sems pa dang btang snyoms shes pa'o //
analyzed: dang rtsol ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang sems pa dang btang snyoms shes pa'o //
translated: Faith, striving, suppleness, mindfulness, vigilance, intention, and equanimity.

original: de la dang po bzhi rnams le lo'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de la dang po bzhi rnams le lo'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The first four are antidotes to laziness.

original: de ltar ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan rnams la yod pa nyid dang yon tan can nyid dang nus pa nyid du mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dad pas de la rnal 'byor pa rnams mngon par 'dod pa skye zhing /
analyzed: de ltar ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan rnams la yod pa nyid dang yon tan can nyid dang nus pa nyid du mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dad pas de la rnal 'byor pa rnams mngon par 'dod pa skye zhing /
translated: Thus, faith, which has the nature of clear, distinct, and firm belief in the virtues of samadhi, in its possessor, and in one's ability to achieve it, gives rise to the desire to practice.

original: de las brtson 'grus dang / de las lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid de de las le lo ldog go //
analyzed: de las brtson 'grus dang / de las lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid de de las le lo ldog go //
translated: From that comes striving, from that comes suppleness, and from that comes the cessation of laziness.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs so //
translated: Mindfulness is the antidote to forgetting the instructions.

original: shes bzhin ni bying ba dang rgod pa dag gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni bying ba dang rgod pa dag gi gnyen po ste /
translated: Vigilance is the antidote to laxity and excitement.

original: des de dag nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: des de dag nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro /
translated: It is so called because it recognizes them.

original: de la sems bying ba'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sems bying ba'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two causes of mental laxity:

original: lus dang yid dag lji ba nyid du gyur pas sems dmigs pa rtogs pa la /
analyzed: lus dang yid dag lji ba nyid du gyur pas sems dmigs pa rtogs pa la /
translated: Since the body and mind are heavy, the mind is unserviceable, that is, it is characterized by unfitness for realizing its object.

original: las su mi rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid can rmugs pa dang / rnam par shes pa lnga 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i chos yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang blun par 'gyur ba'i rgyu shes pa 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gnyid can zhes pa'o //
analyzed: las su mi rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid can rmugs pa dang / rnam par shes pa lnga 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i chos yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang blun par 'gyur ba'i rgyu shes pa 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gnyid can zhes pa'o //
translated: Drowsiness is a state of consciousness that is a cause of dullness, and it is characterized by a quality that is incompatible with the engagement of the five sense consciousnesses.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dag gi zas ni rmya ba dang mi dga' ba dang glal ba dang zas la snyoms ma shes pa dang sems zhum pa nyid ces pa lnga rnams so //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dag gi zas ni rmya ba dang mi dga' ba dang glal ba dang zas la snyoms ma shes pa dang sems zhum pa nyid ces pa lnga rnams so //
translated: The food of drowsiness and sleep is fivefold: exhaustion, unhappiness, yawning, overeating, and mental depression.

original: rgod pas ni 'gyod pa nye bar mtshon par byed de /
analyzed: rgod pas ni 'gyod pa nye bar mtshon par byed de /
translated: Restlessness is the cause of regret.

original: de dag gi zas ni nye du'i rtog pa dang ljongs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / brgyad pa dang brtses pa la yongs su spyad pa dran pa zhes pa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gi zas ni nye du'i rtog pa dang ljongs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / brgyad pa dang brtses pa la yongs su spyad pa dran pa zhes pa bzhi rnams so //
translated: The food of restlessness is fourfold: thinking about relatives, thinking about one’s homeland, thinking about the deceased, and remembering one’s past enjoyments.

original: de dag gi bya ba ni sems rnam par ma zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bya ba ni sems rnam par ma zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: Their function is to disturb the mind.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa dang rab tu ma zhi ba'i dus na ni rtsol ba med pa skyon te de'i gnyen por sems pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa dang rab tu ma zhi ba'i dus na ni rtsol ba med pa skyon te de'i gnyen por sems pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When there is laxity, excitation, or lack of full attention, the fault is lack of effort. The antidote to that is to cultivate thought.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba na /
translated: When laxity and excitation are pacified,

original: gang gi tshe sems rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba de'i tshe rtsol ba'i skyon te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba de'i tshe rtsol ba'i skyon te /
translated: if the mind proceeds of its own accord, then the fault is effort.

original: de'i tshe de'i gnyen por btang snyoms sgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i gnyen por btang snyoms sgom par bya'o //
translated: The antidote to that is to cultivate equanimity.

original: spong ba'i rgyu brgyad po 'di rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin las su rung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: spong ba'i rgyu brgyad po 'di rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin las su rung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: By means of these eight causes of elimination, concentration becomes serviceable.

original: de yis rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de yis rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams rdzogs par byed do //
translated: And that causes the perfection of the qualities of supernormal power, and so on.

original: 'di yang 'dir zhi gnas kyi rim pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang 'dir zhi gnas kyi rim pa ste /
translated: This is the process of serenity.

original: thog mar byang chub sems dpa' nang du @25b ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa la sems 'jog go //
analyzed: thog mar byang chub sems dpa' nang du @25b ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa la sems 'jog go //
translated: To begin with, the bodhisattva places the mind on the object of meditation within.

original: de nas gzhan du 'gro ba bkag pa las rgyun gyis rab tu 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de nas gzhan du 'gro ba bkag pa las rgyun gyis rab tu 'jug par byed do //
translated: Then, by preventing the mind from going elsewhere, he causes it to enter into a state of flow.

original: sems rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba nyid kyi phyir ci zhig ltar gzhan du 'gro ba na de rtogs nas myur du sdud par byed do //
analyzed: sems rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba nyid kyi phyir ci zhig ltar gzhan du 'gro ba na de rtogs nas myur du sdud par byed do //
translated: Because the mind is naturally restless, it goes elsewhere. Having understood that, he quickly gathers it back.

original: gong nas gong du phra bar byed pas sems de kho na la 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: gong nas gong du phra bar byed pas sems de kho na la 'jog par byed do //
translated: He places the mind on that object by making it progressively more subtle.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dga' bar byed do //
translated: He delights the mind in concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan mthong ba la ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan mthong ba la ste /
translated: He sees the virtues of concentration.

original: de yang ji srid du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar gyi yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de yang ji srid du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar gyi yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad do //
translated: And those are all the special virtues of the Tathagata.

original: mi dga' ba zhi bar byed de //
analyzed: mi dga' ba zhi bar byed de //
translated: He pacifies the mind that is not delighted.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon rnams mthong ba las te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon rnams mthong ba las te /
translated: He sees the faults of distraction.

original: de rnams kyang mnar med pa ji srid pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyang mnar med pa ji srid pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad do //
translated: And those are all the sufferings up to Avici Hell.

original: brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa rnams nye bar zhi bar byed de /
analyzed: brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa rnams nye bar zhi bar byed de /
translated: He pacifies covetousness, mental dissatisfaction, and so on.

original: mi dga' ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba bzhin du'o //
translated: As with the mind that is not delighted.

original: de ltar rnam pa bdun rnams kyis skyon dang bral ba'i sems rtsol ba las rang gi ngang gis 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bdun rnams kyis skyon dang bral ba'i sems rtsol ba las rang gi ngang gis 'byung bar byed do //
translated: Thus, by these seven aspects, the mind is free from faults and occurs naturally, not through effort.

original: rang gi ngang gis zhugs nas rang nyid las rtsol ba med par rang gi dang gis 'byung ba nyid kyis yang dag par dmigs pa la sems 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis zhugs nas rang nyid las rtsol ba med par rang gi dang gis 'byung ba nyid kyis yang dag par dmigs pa la sems 'dzin par byed do //
translated: When it occurs naturally, it is focused on the object of meditation through the mind's own stability, not through effort.

original: de ltar gang gi tshe dmigs pa de la mngon par 'du bya ba mang bar 'byung ba nyid kyis ji srid 'dod par sems rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe zhi gnas rdzogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi tshe dmigs pa de la mngon par 'du bya ba mang bar 'byung ba nyid kyis ji srid 'dod par sems rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe zhi gnas rdzogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: When the mind enters that object of meditation through the abundance of its own stability and remains there as long as you wish, you should understand that you have achieved serenity.🔽This is the only way to cultivate serenity.

original: sgom pa'i rim pa 'di kho na gsungs pa 'dun pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa'i rim pa 'di kho na gsungs pa 'dun pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sutra states:

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang spong ba'i 'du byed rnams dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang spong ba'i 'du byed rnams dang ldan pa /
translated: Endowed with the concentration of aspiration and the motivating factors of elimination,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams las dben pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams las dben pa /
translated: free from afflictions,

original: srid pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: srid pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: free from attachment to cyclic existence,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa ste de rnams la brten pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa ste de rnams la brten pa'o //
translated: The cessation of suffering is based on those.

original: rnam par spong ba ni rdzas thams cad mchog tu 'dor ba ste de'i ched du yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par spong ba ni rdzas thams cad mchog tu 'dor ba ste de'i ched du yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
translated: Abandonment is the supreme relinquishment of all substances; it is the transformation for that purpose.

original: shin tu rab tu bzung ba ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rab tu bzung ba ni rgod pa'o //
translated: Extreme agitation is restlessness.

original: dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po ste /
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po ste /
translated: Because they control, they are faculties.

original: dad pa la sogs pa lnga rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bskyed pa'i ched du bdag po nyid thob pa ni dbang po rnams su 'gyur te /🔽dad pa'i dbang po dang brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang dran pa'i dbang po dang ting nge 'dzin @26a * //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa lnga rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bskyed pa'i ched du bdag po nyid thob pa ni dbang po rnams su 'gyur te / dad pa'i dbang po dang brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang dran pa'i dbang po dang ting nge 'dzin @26a * //
translated: The five beginning with faith are faculties in the sense that they obtain mastery for the generation of transcendent dharmas.

original: gyi dbang po dang shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gyi dbang po dang shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: They are the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: de la bden pa dang dkon mchog gsum dang las kyi 'bras bu rnams la mngon par yid ches pa ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: de la bden pa dang dkon mchog gsum dang las kyi 'bras bu rnams la mngon par yid ches pa ni dad pa ste /
translated: Faith is the clear faith in the truths, the Three Jewels, and the results of actions.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la shin tu rab tu sbyor ba po la rtags mthong ba las gong ma'i khyad par skye ba la nges pa skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la shin tu rab tu sbyor ba po la rtags mthong ba las gong ma'i khyad par skye ba la nges pa skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Since one who is very much engaged in the bases of psychic power generates certainty in the arising of the special qualities that are higher than the signs that are seen,

original: ston pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rtogs pa la mngon par yid ches pa skye ste /
analyzed: ston pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rtogs pa la mngon par yid ches pa skye ste /
translated: one generates manifest confidence in the realizations of the teachers and bodhisattvas.

original: de 'di'i dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: de 'di'i dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: That is the faculty of faith.

original: dad pa lhag pa las brtson 'grus la sogs pa rnams lhag pa nyid de /
analyzed: dad pa lhag pa las brtson 'grus la sogs pa rnams lhag pa nyid de /
translated: Since faith is predominant, so too are effort and so forth.

original: de'i phyir dbang po lnga rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po lnga rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they become the five faculties.

original: de rnams de zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: de rnams de zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: He states that they are those, etc.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'o //
translated: The desire realm is the level of the non-equipoise.

original: 'jig rten pa ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: The mundane is the non-realization of reality.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid du mos pa'i mtshan nyid can dang 'jig rten pha rol nges pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid du mos pa'i mtshan nyid can dang 'jig rten pha rol nges pa'o //
translated: Right view is the characteristic of conviction in the selflessness of all phenomena and the ascertainment of the next world.

original: dad par byed de yod pa nyid la sogs par yid ches par byed do //
analyzed: dad par byed de yod pa nyid la sogs par yid ches par byed do //
translated: One has faith in it, one has confidence in its existence, etc.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: dbang po rnams kho na bsgom pa bzhin pa ni de ltar 'phel te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kho na bsgom pa bzhin pa ni de ltar 'phel te /
translated: The faculties are just like the powers in their increase.

original: ji ltar bdud la sogs pa rnams dang ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun phyogs rnams kyis thub par dka' ba nyid las gzhom du med pa nyid kyi phyir stobs zhes bya ba 'thob po zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bdud la sogs pa rnams dang ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun phyogs rnams kyis thub par dka' ba nyid las gzhom du med pa nyid kyi phyir stobs zhes bya ba 'thob po zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Just as they are difficult to overcome by such things as demons and by such counteragents as lack of faith, they are called powers because they are invincible.

original: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five are faith, etc.

original: de la zhes pa la sogs pa la mthong ba'i lam la ji lta ba'i yang dag par rtogs pa ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs pa la mthong ba'i lam la ji lta ba'i yang dag par rtogs pa ni byang chub ste /
translated: Therein, etc. The enlightenment that is the realization of the way things really are on the path of seeing is perfect enlightenment.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang ngo //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang ngo //
translated: It is also perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i yan lag rnams ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams so //
analyzed: de'i yan lag rnams ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams so //
translated: Its branches are the seven branches of enlightenment.

original: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa dang brtson 'grus dang dga' ba zhes pa gsum rnams ni lhag mthong gi phyogs dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms rnams ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs te /
analyzed: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa dang brtson 'grus dang dga' ba zhes pa gsum rnams ni lhag mthong gi phyogs dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms rnams ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs te /
translated: The three factors of full knowing of phenomena, effort, and joy are on the side of insight, while pliancy, samadhi, and equanimity are on the side of shamatha.

original: dran pa ni gnyi ga'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni gnyi ga'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Mindfulness is the essence of both.

original: dga' ba ni gang dmigs pa de kho na la yid dga' ba nyid do //
analyzed: dga' ba ni gang dmigs pa de kho na la yid dga' ba nyid do //
translated: Joy is the delight in the mind with regard to the very object that is being focused on.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni brtag par bya ba'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni brtag par bya ba'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Samadhi is the one-pointedness of mind on the object that is being investigated.

original: de la dran pa ni gnas kyi yan lag ste thams cad rnams de la brten pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni gnas kyi yan lag ste thams cad rnams de la brten pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among these, mindfulness is the branch of the basis, because all the others operate in dependence on it.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni rang bzhin @26b gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni rang bzhin @26b gyi yan lag ste /
translated: Full knowing of phenomena is the branch of the nature,

original: byang chub ni de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub ni de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because enlightenment is its very nature.

original: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Effort is the branch of definite emergence,

original: des thob bya mthar thug pa lhag par gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des thob bya mthar thug pa lhag par gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the attainment of the ultimate to be reached.

original: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste sems bde ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste sems bde ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Joy is the branch of benefit, because it is mental bliss.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms gsum rnams ni gang gis gang la brten nas gang zhig nyon mongs pa med pa zhes pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms gsum rnams ni gang gis gang la brten nas gang zhig nyon mongs pa med pa zhes pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: The three, pliancy, concentration, and equanimity, are the branch of non-affliction, because of the statement, “By which, based on which, and what is non-affliction?”

original: gang phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni shin tu sbyangs pa ste de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni shin tu sbyangs pa ste de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of affliction is the fault of taking up bad states, and the antidote to that is pliancy, and therefore it is the cause of non-affliction.

original: gnas ni ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: gnas ni ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The basis is concentration.

original: rang bzhin ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni btang snyoms so //
translated: The nature is equanimity.

original: de ltar byang chub kyi yan lag 'di rnams thob pa las bdag nyid kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs par mthong nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams spang ba'i ched du phung po gsum po 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa🔽bsgom mo zhes mdor ston pa /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi yan lag 'di rnams thob pa las bdag nyid kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs par mthong nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams spang ba'i ched du phung po gsum po 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom mo zhes mdor ston pa /
translated: Thus, having seen that one abandons the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing through obtaining these branches of enlightenment, one cultivates the eightfold noble path,🔽the three aggregates, for the sake of abandoning those to be abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The eightfold noble path

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces pa ste /
translated: is the path of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni slob pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni slob pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams te /
translated: The noble ones are yogis who are learners.

original: de rnams kyis lam 'di nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba mngon du bya ba'i ched du bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis lam 'di nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba mngon du bya ba'i ched du bskyed par bya'o //
translated: They generate this path for the sake of manifesting liberation from affliction.🔽Therefore it is the eightfold noble path.

original: de'i phyir 'di 'phags pa rnams kyi yan lag brgyad do zhes pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //🔽yan lag 'di rnams la nges pa kho na'i ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di 'phags pa rnams kyi yan lag brgyad do zhes pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //🔽yan lag 'di rnams la nges pa kho na'i ste /
translated: These are definitely the eight branches.

original: lam la mnyam par gzhag pa la ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang dag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba dang dran pa rnams mi srid do //
analyzed: lam la mnyam par gzhag pa la ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang dag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba dang dran pa rnams mi srid do //
translated: But it is impossible for one who is equipoised in the path to have right investigation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, and right mindfulness.

original: 'o na lam la snyoms par zhugs pa la yan lag brgyad sgrub pa'i chos ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na lam la snyoms par zhugs pa la yan lag brgyad sgrub pa'i chos ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How then could one who is engaged in the path possess the eight qualities of the path?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thob pa las de'i ngo bo'i zag pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa thob ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thob pa las de'i ngo bo'i zag pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa thob ste /
translated: One who obtains the supramundane path obtains the uncontaminated nature that is the basis of those qualities.

original: gang thob pa las langs kyang log pa'i ngag la sogs pa rnams la mi 'jug cing yang dag pa'i ngag la sogs pa rnams la yang 'jug go //
analyzed: gang thob pa las langs kyang log pa'i ngag la sogs pa rnams la mi 'jug cing yang dag pa'i ngag la sogs pa rnams la yang 'jug go //
translated: Even when one rises from that attainment, one does not engage in wrong speech and so on, and one engages in right speech and so on.

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan can la rgyu mtshan can btags pa las yan lag brgyad nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan can la rgyu mtshan can btags pa las yan lag brgyad nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the eight qualities of the path are imputed to the basis of those qualities.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na lam la snyoms par zhugs pa las 'gal lo //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na lam la snyoms par zhugs pa las 'gal lo //
translated: Otherwise, one who is engaged in the path would contradict the path.

original: @27a * // 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di yang tshangs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la phan par spyod pas tshangs par spyod par mdor gsungs so //
analyzed: @27a * // 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di yang tshangs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la phan par spyod pas tshangs par spyod par mdor gsungs so //
translated: This eightfold noble path is also called the pure life, because it is practiced for the purpose of attaining the nirvana of the noble ones.

original: 'di'i yang yang dag pa'i lta ba lus te lhag ma 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'di'i yang yang dag pa'i lta ba lus te lhag ma 'khor ro //
translated: Here, right view is the head, and the remaining members are the body.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang / rtsol ba rnams shes rab kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang / rtsol ba rnams shes rab kyi phung po'o //
translated: Among them, right view, right thought, and right effort are the wisdom aggregate.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
translated: Right speech, right action, and right livelihood are the morality aggregate.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dag ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dag ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o //
translated: Right mindfulness and right concentration are the concentration aggregate.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni byang chub kyi yan lag gi dus las gong du chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yang dag pa ji lta ba rtogs pa rjes su 'jug pa dang / brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba las ldog pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni byang chub kyi yan lag gi dus las gong du chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yang dag pa ji lta ba rtogs pa rjes su 'jug pa dang / brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba las ldog pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Right view is the realization of the reality of all things, which is characterized by selflessness, and the subsequent engagement in that. It is the essence of turning away from covetousness, harmful intent, and wrong views.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni rtogs pa de kho na'i rnam par 'jog pa las spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba spong ba dang mngon du bya bar yid la byed pa dang dge ba 'ba' zhig sems pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni rtogs pa de kho na'i rnam par 'jog pa las spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba spong ba dang mngon du bya bar yid la byed pa dang dge ba 'ba' zhig sems pa'o //
translated: Right thought is the mental attention to what is to be abandoned and what is to be adopted in the context of the determination of that very reality. It is the exclusive intention to cultivate virtue.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi don rtogs par byed pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang phra ma dang tshig rtsub po dang dag 'khyal pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yang ngo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi don rtogs par byed pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang phra ma dang tshig rtsub po dang dag 'khyal pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yang ngo //
translated: Right speech is the essence of the speech that causes the realization of the reality that is just as it is. It is also the nature of turning away from lying, slander, harsh words, and idle talk.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni /
translated: Right action is the essence of the body’s turning away from killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct.

original: gang las gong na med pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang las gong na med pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi bya ba ste /
translated: It is the highest activity of body, speech, and mind.

original: srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang 'dod pas log par spyod pa zhes bya ba lus kyi nyes par spyod pa la byed pa dang byed du 'jug pa dang rjes su yi rang ba las ldog pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang 'dod pas log par spyod pa zhes bya ba lus kyi nyes par spyod pa la byed pa dang byed du 'jug pa dang rjes su yi rang ba las ldog pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the very essence of turning away from the three kinds of physical misdeeds: killing, taking what has not been given, and committing sexual misconduct, as well as from the three kinds of verbal misdeeds: lying, divisive speech, harsh speech, and idle speech.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni rigs pas bsags pa'i nor gyis 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni rigs pas bsags pa'i nor gyis 'tsho ba ste /
translated: Right livelihood is the living of one who makes a living through wealth that has been righteously acquired.

original: tshul 'chos dang kha gsag la sogs pa log pa'i 'tsho ba las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul 'chos dang kha gsag la sogs pa log pa'i 'tsho ba las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the avoidance of wrong livelihood, such as hypocrisy, flattery, and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus te rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i mngon par spro ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus te rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i mngon par spro ba'o //
translated: Right effort is the effort that is associated with the perfection of one’s own and others’ goals and is the enthusiasm for them.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos mi brjed pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos mi brjed pa nyid de /
translated: Right mindfulness is the non-forgetting of the Dharma as it has been understood.

original: yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi dmigs pa dang rnam pa mngon du byed pa yang ngo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi dmigs pa dang rnam pa mngon du byed pa yang ngo //
translated: It is also the actualization of the object and the aspects of right enlightenment.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bsgom par bya ba la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bsgom par bya ba la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Right concentration is one-pointedness of mind on the object of meditation.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam yongs su gcod pa yang dag pa'i @27b lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam yongs su gcod pa yang dag pa'i @27b lta ba'o //
translated: Among these, right view is the discernment of the path of seeing.

original: gzhan go bar byed pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i ngag ste /
analyzed: gzhan go bar byed pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i ngag ste /
translated: Right thought and right speech are the limbs of causing others to understand.

original: yang dag pas kun nas bslang ba'i ngag gis de go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pas kun nas bslang ba'i ngag gis de go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one causes others to understand by means of speech that is motivated by right thought.

original: gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ni rnam pa gsum po yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ni rnam pa gsum po yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams so //
translated: The three limbs of causing others to have faith are right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

original: de rnams kyis ni rim pa ji lta bar gsum rnams la yid ches par 'gyur te gtam dang 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pas shes rab la'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ni rim pa ji lta bar gsum rnams la yid ches par 'gyur te gtam dang 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pas shes rab la'o //
translated: Because by means of these, one causes others to have faith in one's morality, in one's view, and in one's livelihood, respectively.

original: bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa las tshul khrims la'o //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa las tshul khrims la'o //
translated: One causes them to have faith in one's morality because one does not commit any misdeeds.🔽One causes them to have faith in one's view because one has the wisdom that is certain about the topics that are discussed.

original: chos tsam gyis 'tsho ba'i yo byad tshol ba las yo byad bsnyungs pa la'o //
analyzed: chos tsam gyis 'tsho ba'i yo byad tshol ba las yo byad bsnyungs pa la'o //
translated: One causes them to have faith in one's livelihood because one seeks the requisites of life with only Dharma.

original: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'i yan lag rnam pa gsum ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'i yan lag rnam pa gsum ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
translated: The three branches of antidotes to the adverse side are right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs de rnams ni rim pa ji lta bar nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba dang rgod pa'i dbang nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs yon tan khyad par can sgrub pa'i gegs kyi gnyen po'o zhes pa bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs de rnams ni rim pa ji lta bar nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba dang rgod pa'i dbang nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs yon tan khyad par can sgrub pa'i gegs kyi gnyen po'o zhes pa bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: Those antidotes are, in order, the antidotes to the afflictions that are to be abandoned by cultivation, and to the secondary afflictions of sinking and excitedness, which are the hindrances to the accomplishment of the special qualities that are adverse.

original: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: The detailed explanation of this is stated:

original: de la ci zhig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la ci zhig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therein, what? and so on.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam du bskyed par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam du bskyed par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is supramundane because it is to be generated in the supramundane path of cultivation.

original: lta ba ni sgro btags pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba ni sgro btags pa ste /
translated: View is reification.

original: bdag ni rtag pa khyab bdag ste 'khor bar byed grol bar byed ces pa la sogs pa pha rol po rnams kyis sgro btags pa'o //
