analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa khyab bdag ste 'khor bar byed grol bar byed ces pa la sogs pa pha rol po rnams kyis sgro btags pa'o //
translated: The self is permanent, the all-pervading lord, the one who binds and liberates and so on are the superimpositions of others.

original: bdag kho na lta ba so so la btags pa'i khyad par rnams kyis sems can la sogs pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag kho na lta ba so so la btags pa'i khyad par rnams kyis sems can la sogs pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The self alone is the referent of the terms sentient being and so on, which are designated to the self in accordance with its individual views.

original: de ltar gang zag gi bdag med pa rtogs pa bsgrubs nas chos kyi bdag med pa rig pa brjod pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gang zag gi bdag med pa rtogs pa bsgrubs nas chos kyi bdag med pa rig pa brjod pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: Having thus established the realization of the selflessness of persons, in order to express the knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena, it is said:

original: chad pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chad pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is not nihilism and so on.

original: rtag pa ni gang gi 'dod pa la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skad cig gcig tu yang rang bzhin yod pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa ni gang gi 'dod pa la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skad cig gcig tu yang rang bzhin yod pa ste /
translated: Permanence is the assertion that consciousness and so on exist by nature even for a single moment.

original: de med pa'i phyir skad cig gnyis pa la chad pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir skad cig gnyis pa la chad pa'o //
translated: Because that does not exist, it is nihilism in the second moment.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa bar gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa bar gang gsungs pa //
translated: What is said in the root text of the Middle Way is:

original: yod ces pa ni rtag par lta //
analyzed: yod ces pa ni rtag par lta //
translated: Existence is the view of permanence.

original: med ces pa ni chad par lta //
analyzed: med ces pa ni chad par lta //
translated: Nonexistence is the view of nihilism.

original: gang phyir ngo bo nyid kyis yod //
analyzed: gang phyir ngo bo nyid kyis yod //
translated: Because of existing by its own nature,

original: de med min pas rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de med min pas rtag pa'o //
translated: it is not nonexistent, so it is not permanent.

original: sngon byung da lta med ces pa //
analyzed: sngon byung da lta med ces pa //
translated: The statement, “What existed previously does not exist now,”

original: chad pa nyid la rab tu 'jug / ces so //🔽'byung zhing skye bas @28a * //
analyzed: chad pa nyid la rab tu 'jug / ces so // 'byung zhing skye bas @28a * //
translated: leads to the extreme of nihilism.

original: na srid pa ste rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: na srid pa ste rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Becoming” is the consciousness, etc., that arise and are born.

original: 'gag pa ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: “ Cessation” is destruction.

original: 'di'i skye ba dang 'jig pa de dag kyang dbu ma'i snye mar nges par dpyad zin pa'i rigs pas don dam pa med pa dag go zhes pas sgro btags pa bdag go //
analyzed: 'di'i skye ba dang 'jig pa de dag kyang dbu ma'i snye mar nges par dpyad zin pa'i rigs pas don dam pa med pa dag go zhes pas sgro btags pa bdag go //
translated: The arising and cessation of these are not ultimately existent, as has been ascertained by the arguments presented in the Madhyamaka-avatara.

original: ngan snyil ni dge ba ste ;
analyzed: ngan snyil ni dge ba ste ;
translated: “ Virtue” is wholesome.

original: rnam par grol ba ni nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rnam grangs med par dge ba ste nad med pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rnam grangs med par dge ba ste nad med pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: “ Liberation” is wholesome in the ultimate sense, because it is the cessation of all harm, just like health.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni de thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni de thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The truth of the path is the cause of attaining that.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag ste /
translated: The truths of suffering and of the origin are contaminated.

original: 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa can nyid kyis na ngo bo mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa can nyid kyis na ngo bo mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the results of the desire realm, they are the causes of the manifestation of images that are similar to their own natures.

original: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa rnams ni rang nyid dge zhing dge ba gzhan rnams kyi rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa rnams ni rang nyid dge zhing dge ba gzhan rnams kyi rtsa ba ste /
translated: Nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion are themselves virtuous and are the roots of other virtues.

original: shing gi rtsa ba bzhin du skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shing gi rtsa ba bzhin du skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are the causes of the birth, continuance, and growth of the other virtues, just as roots are for trees.

original: de la ma chags pa ni srid pa dang 'gal ba'i chos dngos po la mngon par ma zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de la ma chags pa ni srid pa dang 'gal ba'i chos dngos po la mngon par ma zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Nonattachment is the opposite of existence. Its characteristic is the nonadherence to things.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni khong khro ba dang 'gal ba sems can rnams la mi rtsub pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni khong khro ba dang 'gal ba sems can rnams la mi rtsub pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Nonhatred is the opposite of anger. Its characteristic is the noncruelty to sentient beings.

original: gti mug med pa ni ma rig pa dang 'gal ba shes rab kyi rang bzhin yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni ma rig pa dang 'gal ba shes rab kyi rang bzhin yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Nondelusion is the opposite of ignorance. Its nature is wisdom, which is right view.

original: lus dang ngag gi las rnams ni ma chags pa la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba nyid kyi phyir dge ba dag go //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las rnams ni ma chags pa la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba nyid kyi phyir dge ba dag go //
translated: The actions of body and speech are virtuous because they are motivated by nonattachment and so on.

original: 'di las bzlog pas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams ni mi dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi rtsa ba rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams ni mi dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi rtsa ba rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Attachment, aversion and delusion are nonvirtuous because they are the opposites of those and are the roots of nonvirtue.

original: des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las thams cad kyang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las thams cad kyang mi dge ba'o //
translated: All actions of body, speech and mind motivated by them are nonvirtuous.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi dge ba ste /
translated: All afflictions and branch afflictions are nonvirtue.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i gti mug ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i gti mug ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: All afflictions and branch afflictions of the form and formless realms and the afflicted view of the self and extreme views and the delusion concomitant with them in the desire realm are neutral.

original: ji srid du zhes pa 'dis ni lta ba gzhan gang ci yin pa bsal bar byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du zhes pa 'dis ni lta ba gzhan gang ci yin pa bsal bar byas so //
translated: This word “as well” excludes any other views.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgro 'dogs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta @28b ba'o ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgro 'dogs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta @28b ba'o ;
translated: Therefore, it is right view because it realizes reality free from all superimpositions.

original: / kun du rtog pa rnams kyis zhes pa mdza' ba dang cig shos su sgro 'dogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: / kun du rtog pa rnams kyis zhes pa mdza' ba dang cig shos su sgro 'dogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “By all conceptual thoughts” refers to superimpositions of friend and foe.

original: kun du mi rtog ces pa mi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: kun du mi rtog ces pa mi bskyed pa'o //
translated: “Not conceptualizing” means not producing.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: The aggregate of morality is the training in superior morality.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: The aggregate of meditative stabilization is the training in superior mind.

original: shes rab kyi phung po ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung po ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: The aggregate of wisdom is the training in superior wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung po ni mi slob pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po ni mi slob pa'i lam mo //
translated: The aggregate of liberation is the path of no learning.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The aggregate of seeing the wisdom of liberation is right view of no learning.

original: ngag gis te slu bar byed pas bdag nyid gdung ba ste /
analyzed: ngag gis te slu bar byed pas bdag nyid gdung ba ste /
translated: One torments oneself with speech, that is, with deception.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems nyid kyi phyir de'i tshe 'di nyid du dang phyi mar ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems nyid kyi phyir de'i tshe 'di nyid du dang phyi mar ro //
translated: Because of the afflicted thought itself, at that time or later.

original: bdag nyid nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: One is afflicted oneself.

original: gang las nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis so //
analyzed: gang las nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis so //
translated: From which, by means of an afflicted thought.

original: gzhan rnams dbye ba'i don dang mi 'dum pa'i don du smra ba'am mtshang 'dru ba dang skyon sgrogs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams dbye ba'i don dang mi 'dum pa'i don du smra ba'am mtshang 'dru ba dang skyon sgrogs pas so //
translated: One speaks for the sake of dividing others, for the sake of disunity, for the sake of exposing faults and proclaiming virtues.

original: bdag nyid la ngag 'khyal pa smra ba las bzhad gad de ;
analyzed: bdag nyid la ngag 'khyal pa smra ba las bzhad gad de ;
translated: One laughs at oneself for speaking frivolously.

original: de ltar ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis 'dod pa dang chos ma yin pa dang don med pa dang grong pa'i nyams dang ldan pa dang byis pa'i brjod pa dang 'du 'dzi dang smre sngags dang glu dang yang dag par chags par bya ba dang gar
analyzed: de ltar ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis 'dod pa dang chos ma yin pa dang don med pa dang grong pa'i nyams dang ldan pa dang byis pa'i brjod pa dang 'du 'dzi dang smre sngags dang glu dang yang dag par chags par bya ba dang gar
translated: Thus, with an afflicted thought, one speaks of desire, of what is contrary to the Dharma, of what is meaningless, of what is in the style of the village, of what is childish, of what is frivolous, of what is mournful, of what is in the style of songs, of what is in the style of love-making, of what is in the style of the streets, of what is in the style of the marketplace, of what is in the style of the prison, of what is in the style of women, of what is in the style of eunuchs, of what is in the style of the low-born, of what is in the style of the vulgar, of what is in the style of the foolish, of what is in the style of the ignorant, of what is in the style of the unlearned, of what is in the style of the uncultured, of what is in the style of the unrefined, of what is in the style of the uncivilized, of what is in the style of the unmannerly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the unseemly, of what is in the style of the un

original: la sogs pa'i gtam rnams dang bstan bcos ngan pa rnams smra pa 'di ni rang nyid kyis mngon par mi shes pa nyid kyis bdag nyid la'ang bzhad gad byed do zhes dam pa rnams kyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i gtam rnams dang bstan bcos ngan pa rnams smra pa 'di ni rang nyid kyis mngon par mi shes pa nyid kyis bdag nyid la'ang bzhad gad byed do zhes dam pa rnams kyis brjod par bya'o //
translated: The wise should say that this person who speaks such things and bad treatises is laughing at himself because of his own ignorance.

original: des te ngag gi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa bzhi dang bral bas /
analyzed: des te ngag gi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa bzhi dang bral bas /
translated: By that, that is, by being free from the four faults of speech,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ste yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas ma snyogs pa gnyis su med pa'i shes rab ste de dang rjes su 'brel pa'i ngag go //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ste yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas ma snyogs pa gnyis su med pa'i shes rab ste de dang rjes su 'brel pa'i ngag go //
translated: one's speech is in equipoise, that is, it is not pursued by false imagination, and it is the wisdom of non-duality, that is, it is connected with that.

original: de ni 'di'i yang dag par kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di'i yang dag par kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: That is its correct motivation.

original: 'jug par byed de gzhan dang rang nyid do /
analyzed: 'jug par byed de gzhan dang rang nyid do /
translated: One engages others and oneself.

original: ngag 'ga' zhig brjod pas de'i brjod par bya ba go bar byed do //
analyzed: ngag 'ga' zhig brjod pas de'i brjod par bya ba go bar byed do //
translated: By speaking some words, one makes others understand what is to be expressed by those words.

original: nag po ni mi dge ba ste srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa can 'dod pa'i khams kho na ste /
analyzed: nag po ni mi dge ba ste srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa can 'dod pa'i khams kho na ste /
translated: Black means non-virtuous, with the ripening of suffering, only in the desire realm, such as killing.

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other action that would produce the experience of suffering.

original: dkar ba ni dge ba sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dkar ba ni dge ba sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The white is the wholesome, such as generosity.

original: de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o //🔽zag pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i khams @29a * //
analyzed: de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o // zag pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i khams @29a * //
translated: Moreover, it is both with-outflows and without-outflows.

original: su dang bsam gtan gsum pa ji srid par bde ba'i rnam par smin pa can no //
analyzed: su dang bsam gtan gsum pa ji srid par bde ba'i rnam par smin pa can no //
translated: That with-outflows is the cause of the experience of pleasure in the desire realm and up to the third meditative absorption.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i rnam par smin pa can te gang gi phyir dge ba ni 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa can du brjod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i rnam par smin pa can te gang gi phyir dge ba ni 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa can du brjod do //
translated: In the fourth meditative absorption and up to the peak of cyclic existence, it is the cause of the experience of neither pleasure nor suffering, because wholesome is said to have a pleasant experience in the desire realm.

original: zag pa med pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa can no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa can no //
translated: That without-outflows is the cause of the experience of the supramundane realization.

original: dkar po zhes pa ni dkar por snang ba ste /
analyzed: dkar po zhes pa ni dkar por snang ba ste /
translated: The white is that which appears as white.

original: ji lta bar sdig pa rmongs pa rnams bsod nams kyi blos pha dang ma dang rgas pa gsong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji lta bar sdig pa rmongs pa rnams bsod nams kyi blos pha dang ma dang rgas pa gsong ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the foolish say that sin is merit, like the care of father and mother.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang kla klo la sogs pa rnams kyi gti mug las dge ba 'dod pa'i bsam pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las ni dkar po bzhin du snang ngo zhes pas dgongs pa can gyi dkar po zhes gsungs kyi dngos por ni nag po
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang kla klo la sogs pa rnams kyi gti mug las dge ba 'dod pa'i bsam pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las ni dkar po bzhin du snang ngo zhes pas dgongs pa can gyi dkar po zhes gsungs kyi dngos por ni nag po
translated: Likewise, for barbarians and so on, the karma of killing and so on, due to the intention to obtain virtue from delusion, appears to be white.

original: kho na'o // de'i phyir 'di'i rnam par smin pa nag po ste sdug bsngal yin pa'o //
analyzed: kho na'o // de'i phyir 'di'i rnam par smin pa nag po ste sdug bsngal yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, its karmic maturation is white, that is, happiness.

original: nag po zhes pa ni mngon spyod la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nag po zhes pa ni mngon spyod la sogs pa ste /
translated: Black is killing and so on,🔽and that appears to be black for those whose minds are untrained.

original: de ni blo ma sbyangs pa rnams la nag po bzhin du snang ngo zhes pas 'di mngon par rloms pa'i nag po nyid de /
analyzed: de ni blo ma sbyangs pa rnams la nag po bzhin du snang ngo zhes pas 'di mngon par rloms pa'i nag po nyid de /
translated: Therefore, it is black in the sense of being presumptuous,

original: snying rje dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas kun du spyod pa'i phyir de ni dkar po kho na'o //
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas kun du spyod pa'i phyir de ni dkar po kho na'o //
translated: but it is white for bodhisattvas who possess compassion because they engage in it.

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa dkar po 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa dkar po 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not only the karmic maturation that is white.

original: sdig pa zad pa'i ched du yang rab tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa zad pa'i ched du yang rab tu 'gyur ro //
translated: It also becomes the means of eliminating sin.

original: de ltar yang rnam pa 'di lta bur 'byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang rnam pa 'di lta bur 'byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is divided into these aspects.

original: de ltar dam pa'i las rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar dam pa'i las rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: Thus, it is the practice of the holy,

original: bzlog pa'i tshul khrims dang dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims rnams rjes su sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i tshul khrims dang dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims rnams rjes su sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it accomplishes the morality of following the Dharma, the morality of gathering virtue, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: yang dag pa ni slu ba med pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni slu ba med pa ste /
translated: Correct is non-deceptive.

original: las rnams kyi mtha' ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: las rnams kyi mtha' ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: It is the end of actions, their culmination.

original: gang zhes pa gang zhig 'phags pa'i rigs kyi skyon sbyang ba'i ched du yon tan du bya zhing goms par bya'o zhes pa yon tan rnams te /
analyzed: gang zhes pa gang zhig 'phags pa'i rigs kyi skyon sbyang ba'i ched du yon tan du bya zhing goms par bya'o zhes pa yon tan rnams te /
translated: The qualities are those that should be taken as qualities and cultivated in order to purify the faults of the ārya’s lineage.

original: bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / chos gos gsum pa nyid dang stan gcig pa nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid dang / cog bu pa nyid dang blag pa med pa nyid dang shing drung pa nyid dang dur khrod pa nyid dang phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang phying ba pa nyid dang dgon par gnas pa nyid @29b ces pa bcu gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / chos gos gsum pa nyid dang stan gcig pa nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid dang / cog bu pa nyid dang blag pa med pa nyid dang shing drung pa nyid dang dur khrod pa nyid dang phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang phying ba pa nyid dang dgon par gnas pa nyid @29b ces pa bcu gnyis rnams so //
translated: 1) being a beggar, 2) having only three robes, 3) having only one sitting mat, 4) not accepting food after begging, 5) living in a place according to the time of the day, 6) being a tree-root dweller, 7) being a charnel-ground dweller, 8) being a refuse-rag dweller, 9) being a grass-bundle dweller, and 10) living in a solitary place.

original: de rnams la rjes su bsgrub par nges pa mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams la rjes su bsgrub par nges pa mi gtong ba'o //
translated: One does not give up the certainty of practicing these.

original: tshul 'chos ni rnyed pa dang 'dod pas zol gyis chos gos la sogs pa'i ched du spyod lam sdom pa'o //
analyzed: tshul 'chos ni rnyed pa dang 'dod pas zol gyis chos gos la sogs pa'i ched du spyod lam sdom pa'o //
translated: Pretense is to restrain one's behavior for the sake of robes and so on, out of deceit for the sake of gain and honor.

original: kha gsag ni rnyed pa'i don du rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i bsam pas ngo bstod kyi dag go //
analyzed: kha gsag ni rnyed pa'i don du rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i bsam pas ngo bstod kyi dag go //
translated: Flattery is to praise others with words of flattery, with the intention of desiring gain and honor for the sake of gain.

original: gtam kho na dri zhim pa ste /
analyzed: gtam kho na dri zhim pa ste /
translated: It is just talk that is pleasing.

original: pha rol dga' ba dang snying la 'bab pa gang gi yin pa ni de nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol dga' ba dang snying la 'bab pa gang gi yin pa ni de nyid do //
translated: It is that which is pleasing and agreeable to others.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: This is an illustration.

original: thob kyis 'jal ba nyid dang gzhogs slong nyid kyang //
analyzed: thob kyis 'jal ba nyid dang gzhogs slong nyid kyang //
translated: Also, flattery and hinting.

original: de la rnyed pa 'dod pas gzhan gyi mdun du 'di ltar 'di ni ser sna can no zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan la smod pa ni thob kyis 'jal ba nyid de /
analyzed: de la rnyed pa 'dod pas gzhan gyi mdun du 'di ltar 'di ni ser sna can no zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan la smod pa ni thob kyis 'jal ba nyid de /
translated: In this regard, disparaging others in the presence of others who desire gain, saying, for example, “This one is stingy,” is flattery.

original: thob kyis 'jal ba kho na gzhan las rnyed pa sgrub par sred pa'o //
analyzed: thob kyis 'jal ba kho na gzhan las rnyed pa sgrub par sred pa'o //
translated: It is the desire to obtain gain from others by flattery alone.

original: nyung du byin nas mang po tshol ba dang 'dod pas dngos po la bsngags pa ni gzhogs slong nyid de /
analyzed: nyung du byin nas mang po tshol ba dang 'dod pas dngos po la bsngags pa ni gzhogs slong nyid de /
translated: It is hinting, which is the praise of a thing out of desire for it, when one has given a small amount.

original: rnyed pa'i rgyu mtshan du cung zad byin pa la bsngags pa yang ngo //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i rgyu mtshan du cung zad byin pa la bsngags pa yang ngo //
translated: It is also the praise of a small gift as the reason for gain.

original: legs par kun du spyod pa ni dge ba'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: legs par kun du spyod pa ni dge ba'i bya ba'o //
translated: Proper conduct is virtuous action.

original: bdag nyid kyi rnyed pas tshom zhing ma zhen pa nyid dang tshod shes pas nye bar longs spyod pa la sogs pa kha na ma tho ba dang bral ba gang yin pa de nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rnyed pas tshom zhing ma zhen pa nyid dang tshod shes pas nye bar longs spyod pa la sogs pa kha na ma tho ba dang bral ba gang yin pa de nyid do //
translated: It is the absence of the reproach of enjoying things without restraint, etc., because of moderation in one’s own gain and lack of attachment.

original: rjes su gnang ba ni bde ba len pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyis 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su gnang ba ni bde ba len pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyis 'tsho ba'o //
translated: The subsequent permission is the livelihood by means of not taking what is not given and so forth.

original: rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: Exertion is effort.

original: log pa ni mi dge ba'i yul can no //
analyzed: log pa ni mi dge ba'i yul can no //
translated: Wrong is the object of non-virtue.

original: 'jug pa ni sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: Engagement is the effort of application.

original: bsgrub pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni lam mo //
translated: Accomplishment is the path.

original: shin tu nye bar gnas pa ni lam bsgom pa'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: shin tu nye bar gnas pa ni lam bsgom pa'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: Very close placement is in the state of application of cultivating the path.

original: mi g-yo ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa rnams kyis te dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa rnams kyis te dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: Non-wavering is by means of the non-true conceptualization, etc., in the state of the main practice.

original: drang po ni gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid kyi yul can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: drang po ni gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid kyi yul can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Straight is because of being the object of the non-dual suchness.

original: mi 'khyogs pa ni lam log pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'khyogs pa ni lam log pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: Not crooked is the complete abandonment of the wrong path.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa'i lam la 'di yis yang dag par sbyor ro zhes pas yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa'i lam la 'di yis yang dag par sbyor ro zhes pas yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is the correct application because it is said, “By this one is correctly applied to the noble path.”

original: yang dag pa nyid ni tshang mas 'thad pa'i de kho na nyid rang bzhin med pa nyid de //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid ni tshang mas 'thad pa'i de kho na nyid rang bzhin med pa nyid de //
translated: The suchness is the suchness of the correct, which is the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: des ting nge 'dzin no //🔽'o na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa mya ngan las 'das pa la mchog tu @30a * //
analyzed: des ting nge 'dzin no // 'o na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa mya ngan las 'das pa la mchog tu @30a * //
translated: That is concentration.🔽If that is so, then the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment is only for those in the vehicles of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas who are intent on nirvana,

original: gzhol ba rnams kho na la rigs kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni ma yin te ji skad du 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhus pa rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul theg pa chen po'i mdor gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhol ba rnams kho na la rigs kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni ma yin te ji skad du 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhus pa rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul theg pa chen po'i mdor gsungs pa /
translated: but not for bodhisattvas. As it says in the noble Manjusripariprcchd-sutra,

original: 'jam dpal ma 'ongs pa'i dus su dge slong rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ma 'ongs pa'i dus su dge slong rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Manjusri, in the future there will be monks

original: de rnams mi gtsang ba las lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag par ston par 'gyur ro nas ji srid du 'di kho na don dam pa'o zhes pa'i bar du'o zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams mi gtsang ba las lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag par ston par 'gyur ro nas ji srid du 'di kho na don dam pa'o zhes pa'i bar du'o zhe na /
translated: who will teach the contemplation of the body in the body as the foundation of mindfulness, and so on up to: this alone is the ultimate.

original: 'di skyon med de byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad rtogs pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyi phyir dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa lhur len pa nyid kyi phyir na sems can thams cad la phan pa sgrub pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba la yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du yon tan mthong ba /
analyzed: 'di skyon med de byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad rtogs pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyi phyir dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa lhur len pa nyid kyi phyir na sems can thams cad la phan pa sgrub pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba la yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du yon tan mthong ba /
translated: This is not a fault, because bodhisattvas, in all their aspects, strive to realize all phenomena, and because they are intent on not objectifying any phenomena, they see the virtues of samsara as they do of nirvana, because they are the cause for accomplishing the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang sems can la phan pa bsgrub pa'i rten ma yin pa nyid las 'khor ba bzhin du mi mthun par lta ba /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang sems can la phan pa bsgrub pa'i rten ma yin pa nyid las 'khor ba bzhin du mi mthun par lta ba /
translated: They see the faults of nirvana as they do of samsara, because it is not the basis for accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings.🔽And they see the equality of samsara and nirvana, because they are just the same in terms of their reality.

original: chos nyid tsam nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa bdag mnyam pa nyid du lta ba rnams kyang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa so sor rtog pa'i don kho nar byang chub kyi phyogs rnams sgom par byed do //
analyzed: chos nyid tsam nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa bdag mnyam pa nyid du lta ba rnams kyang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa so sor rtog pa'i don kho nar byang chub kyi phyogs rnams sgom par byed do //
translated: Thus, they cultivate the elements that lead to enlightenment, which have the sole purpose of discerning the nonapprehension of intrinsic reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgya bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgya bar gsungs pa /
translated: The Blessed Lady, the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, says:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi dmigs pa nyid nye bar bzung nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi dmigs pa nyid nye bar bzung nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The close placement of mindfulness is not apprehended, and so on.

original: 'di rnams byang chub kyi phyogs mngon du byed par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'am mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di rnams byang chub kyi phyogs mngon du byed par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'am mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du mi byed do //
translated: These are only for manifesting the factors of awakening, but they do not manifest the fruit of stream-entry and so on or nirvāṇa.

original: de skad du yang stong phrag nyi shu lnga par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang stong phrag nyi shu lnga par gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said in the Twenty-five Thousand:

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la gnas pa nyid shes te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la gnas pa nyid shes te /
translated: One knows how to abide in the factors of awakening.

original: 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi 'di mngon du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi 'di mngon du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the time for thorough familiarity, but not the time for manifestation. And so on.

original: de'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs rnams bsgom pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du mi byed kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs rnams bsgom pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du mi byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, by cultivating the factors of awakening, one does not manifest nirvāṇa.

original: de rnams kho na goms par byed cing rab tu mthun par byed pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: de rnams kho na goms par byed cing rab tu mthun par byed pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: One merely becomes accustomed to them and makes them very compatible.

original: ji skad du mdo de nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo de nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in that sūtra:

original: bcom ldan 'das don dam pa dran pa nye bar @30b gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar blta bar bya /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das don dam pa dran pa nye bar @30b gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar blta bar bya /
translated: Blessed One, how should one view the ultimate applications of mindfulness and so forth?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: 'jam dpal gang gis lus nam mkha' dang mnyam par mthong ba 'di ni lus la lus kyi rjes su blta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang gis lus nam mkha' dang mnyam par mthong ba 'di ni lus la lus kyi rjes su blta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, when one sees the body as equal to space, this is the application of mindfulness of body in regard to the body.

original: gang gis tshor ba dang sems dang dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa nas ji srid 'jam dpal de ltar don dam par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams blta bar bya'o nas ji srid du gang rang bzhin gyis snyoms
analyzed: gang gis tshor ba dang sems dang dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa nas ji srid 'jam dpal de ltar don dam par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams blta bar bya'o nas ji srid du gang rang bzhin gyis snyoms
translated: When one does not observe feelings, mind, virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena, and so forth, up to Mañjuśrī, one should view the ultimate four applications of mindfulness in that way.

original: par zhugs pa dang / rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba med par chos thams cad blta ste /
analyzed: par zhugs pa dang / rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba med par chos thams cad blta ste /
translated: Up to the point where one sees all phenomena as naturally settled and naturally free from distraction,

original: dmigs pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: this is right concentration, because the object of observation is not observed.

original: 'jam dpal gang la la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang la la /
translated: Mañjuśrī, whoever

original: 'di lta bur dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du yang dag par rjes su lta ba de ni rgal ba pha rol tu 'gro bar nga smra'o nas /
analyzed: 'di lta bur dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du yang dag par rjes su lta ba de ni rgal ba pha rol tu 'gro bar nga smra'o nas /
translated: I say that one who thus observes the applications of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path crosses over and goes to the far shore.

original: ji srid rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'dod pas chos 'di rnams la mos pa bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'dod pas chos 'di rnams la mos pa bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: As long as one wishes to fully awaken to the knowledge of a knower of all aspects, one should be devoted to these dharmas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams byang chub kyi sems kyi nang du 'dus par gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams byang chub kyi sems kyi nang du 'dus par gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, these are said to be included in the thought of awakening.

original: bsgom par bya ba shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The thought of awakening, which is to be cultivated and has the nature of wisdom and method, is also twofold.

original: ae ma ma la bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi sangs rgyas nyid kyi ched du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya'o zhes don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa smon pa'i sems dang ; rab tu 'jug pa'i rnam pa can 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: ae ma ma la bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi sangs rgyas nyid kyi ched du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya'o zhes don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa smon pa'i sems dang ; rab tu 'jug pa'i rnam pa can 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: The thought of engagement is the thought, I will do it!

original: de la smod pa'i sems ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la smod pa'i sems ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The aspiration thought is threefold:

original: 'dun pa dang ldan pa chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i rang bzhin dang / bsam pa dang ldan pa pha rol du phyin pa drug spyod par 'dod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can yang dag par spong ba sgom pa'i rang bzhin dang /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang ldan pa chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i rang bzhin dang / bsam pa dang ldan pa pha rol du phyin pa drug spyod par 'dod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can yang dag par spong ba sgom pa'i rang bzhin dang /
translated: The thought of aspiration that has the nature of the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness, which has the characteristic of the desire to fully awaken to all dharmas. The thought of aspiration that has the nature of the cultivation of the correct abandonments, which has the characteristic of the desire to practice the six perfections.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom par 'dod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi @31a * //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom par 'dod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi @31a * //
translated: The four bases of supernormal powers are defined as the desire to cultivate the thirty-seven elements that lead to enlightenment, which are possessed by those with superior intention.

original: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The four bases of supernatural power have the nature of the cultivation of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, which are characterized by the desire to cultivate the aids to enlightenment, which are possessed by one who has the superior intention.

original: gsum po 'di ni las dang po pa'i sa tshogs kyi lam thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di ni las dang po pa'i sa tshogs kyi lam thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: These three should be called the roots of the wholesome that are conducive to liberation, which are the path of accumulation for beginners.

original: thar pa'i cha ni thob pa ste /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha ni thob pa ste /
translated: The part of liberation is the attainment of liberation.

original: de'i ched du phan pa'o zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: de'i ched du phan pa'o zhes byas nas so //
translated: They are conducive to that, because they are beneficial for that.

original: 'jug pa'i sems ni sa bcu gnyis rnams te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems ni sa bcu gnyis rnams te /
translated: The thought of entering is the twelve stages.

original: de la gcig ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs rin po che pad ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la gcig ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs rin po che pad ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: One of them is the stage of preparation, which has the nature of the perfection of jewels and lotuses.

original: bcu ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin rgyu'i gnas skabs rnams so //
analyzed: bcu ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin rgyu'i gnas skabs rnams so //
translated: Ten are the stages of cause, which have the nature of the perfections of generosity and so on.

original: tha ma ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs rdo rje las kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs rdo rje las kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: The last is the realization of the perfection of vajra action in the state of the result, the culmination of the best.

original: de la sbyor pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la sbyor pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four states of application:

original: dro ba dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang chos mchog ces pa ste /
analyzed: dro ba dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang chos mchog ces pa ste /
translated: heat, peak, patience, and the highest worldly dharma.

original: rim pa ji lta bar srub shing bsrubs pa las me'i rang bzhin du mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba spros pa med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas nyid kyi phyir dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bar srub shing bsrubs pa las me'i rang bzhin du mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba spros pa med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas nyid kyi phyir dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: In order, they are called the path of seeing, because they are the signs of the fire of the wisdom of the transcendent state free of elaborations that arise from churning the churning stick of the view of emptiness with the wind of the motivation of compassion; the peak of the movement of the root of virtue;

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog la bzod pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽'dir dang po gnyis dbang po'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog la bzod pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi phyir ro // 'dir dang po gnyis dbang po'i rang bzhin te /
translated: patience with regard to the highest worldly dharma; and the highest of all worldly dharmas.🔽Here, the first two are the nature of the faculties,

original: tha ma gnyis ni stobs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tha ma gnyis ni stobs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: and the last two are the nature of the powers.

original: 'di ltar yang gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir phul du byung ba'i sbyor ba ni rab tu sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir phul du byung ba'i sbyor ba ni rab tu sbyor ba ste /
translated: Thus, it is the highest practice, because it is superior to the other practices.

original: bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam myur bar skye ba'o //
analyzed: bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam myur bar skye ba'o //
translated: If there are no obstacles, the path of insight arises quickly.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la brten pa nyid kyis na 'jig rten pa'i sgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la brten pa nyid kyis na 'jig rten pa'i sgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is the mundane path of meditative development, because it is based on the mundane meditative absorptions and formless attainments.

original: nges par 'byed pa brten pa la phan pa'i dge ba yang ste /🔽rnam par mi rtog pas 'byed pa ni nges par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa brten pa la phan pa'i dge ba yang ste / rnam par mi rtog pas 'byed pa ni nges par 'byed pa ste /
translated: It is also the virtue that is conducive to penetration.🔽Penetration is the path of insight, because it is the differentiation of the truths.

original: mthong ba'i lam yin zhing de sten par byed pa ni bsten pa ste thob pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam yin zhing de sten par byed pa ni bsten pa ste thob pa'o //
translated: It is conducive to that, because it is the means of attaining it.🔽It is conducive to that, because it is the means of attaining it.

original: de'i ched du phan pa'o zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: de'i ched du phan pa'o zhes byas nas so //
translated: It is for the sake of that, because it is the means of attaining it.

original: gnas skabs 'dir rnal 'byor ba'i mos pa gtso bo nyid kyi phyir dang yon tan gyi rten du grub pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i mos pa spyod pa'i sa 'di'o zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'dir rnal 'byor ba'i mos pa gtso bo nyid kyi phyir dang yon tan gyi rten du grub pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i mos pa spyod pa'i sa 'di'o zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This stage of action in faith is called the stage of action in faith because the faith of the spiritual practitioner is predominant in this stage and because it is the foundation of the virtues.

original: 'dun pa dang bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba'i bdag nyid sems bskyed pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyang brda las byung ba dang kun rdzob pa dang 'jig @31b rten pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba'i bdag nyid sems bskyed pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyang brda las byung ba dang kun rdzob pa dang 'jig @31b rten pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: These four kinds of generation of the will, consisting of will, aspiration, superior aspiration, and application, are conventional, mundane, and derived from teaching.

original: de las gong ma'i sems bskyed pa rnams ni don dam pa pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang zag pa med pa rnams te /🔽gong nas gong du yon tan gyi rten du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir na rab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa dang 'od byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba dang sbyang dka' ba dang mngon du gyur pa dang ring du song ba dang mi g-yo ba dang
analyzed: de las gong ma'i sems bskyed pa rnams ni don dam pa pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang zag pa med pa rnams te / gong nas gong du yon tan gyi rten du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir na rab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa dang 'od byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba dang sbyang dka' ba dang mngon du gyur pa dang ring du song ba dang mi g-yo ba dang
translated: The higher kinds of generation of the will are ultimate, supramundane, and uncontaminated.

original: legs pa'i blo gros dang chos kyi sprin dang / kun du 'od ces pa sa bcu gcig po rnams su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros dang chos kyi sprin dang / kun du 'od ces pa sa bcu gcig po rnams su blta bar bya'o //
translated: They are the Joyful, the Stainless, the Radiant, the Brilliant, the Immovably Heroic, the Gone Afar, the Immovable, the Excellent Intelligence, the Cloud of Dharma, and the All-Light, which are the eleven stages.

original: de la sems bskyed pa dang po mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi ngo bo la nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa las lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa dang po mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi ngo bo la nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa las lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: The first generation of the Thought is the nature of the path of seeing, and the essence of the seven members of enlightenment.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar ma mthong ba'i de kho na nyid rang dang gzhan gyi don grub par byed pa mthong ba las yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa mchod 'os rnams la mchod pa'i bsam pa dang de las gzhan
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar ma mthong ba'i de kho na nyid rang dang gzhan gyi don grub par byed pa mthong ba las yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa mchod 'os rnams la mchod pa'i bsam pa dang de las gzhan
translated: The Bodhisattva of pure superior intention, who has abandoned all defilements, is so called because he has the intention to make offerings to those worthy of offerings, such as the Omniscient One, the One Gone to Bliss, etc., by means of the vision of the suchness not seen in beginningless cyclic life, which accomplishes the aims of self and other.

original: pa rnams la dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po la phan 'dogs par 'dod pas ster bar byed de /
analyzed: pa rnams la dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po la phan 'dogs par 'dod pas ster bar byed de /
translated: And he is so called because he gives to others, desiring to benefit the great elements of the sense faculties.

original: gang gis de rang gi ba nyid yongs su gtong zhing pha rol po'i rang gi bar byed pa'i sems ni sbyin pa'o zhes pa 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can chos dang zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i lhag pa nyid kyis mu
analyzed: gang gis de rang gi ba nyid yongs su gtong zhing pha rol po'i rang gi bar byed pa'i sems ni sbyin pa'o zhes pa 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can chos dang zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i lhag pa nyid kyis mu
translated: Generosity is the thought that gives up one's own and makes another's one's own.

original: mtha' med pa'i sems can tshim par byed na yang yongs su mi zad pa'i phyir rab tu dga'o //
analyzed: mtha' med pa'i sems can tshim par byed na yang yongs su mi zad pa'i phyir rab tu dga'o //
translated: It is the perfection of generosity, which is superior to the others, because it delights in satisfying the endless number of sentient beings without ever being exhausted.

original: de'i phyir 'di rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the ground of Perfect Joy.

original: de las phyi ma rnams ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnams te /
analyzed: de las phyi ma rnams ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnams te /
translated: The subsequent grounds are included in the eightfold noble path.

original: de la gang gi phyir 'dir bdag dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir 'gyod pa med cing rab tu dga' ba nyid kyi sbyor bas nyon mongs pa mi gnas pa'i phyir dang mi dge ba bcu las ldog pas sam sems kyi 'gyod pa'i
analyzed: de la gang gi phyir 'dir bdag dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir 'gyod pa med cing rab tu dga' ba nyid kyi sbyor bas nyon mongs pa mi gnas pa'i phyir dang mi dge ba bcu las ldog pas sam sems kyi 'gyod pa'i
translated: On this ground, there is no regret because one is engaged in caring for oneself and others. Since one is joyful, the afflictions do not remain. One turns away from the ten nonvirtuous actions or from the regret that arises in the mind.

original: me nye bar zhi bas bsil ba len pa'i sems ni tshul khrims so zhes pa sdom pa dang chos yang dag par sdud pa dang sems can gyi don bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa nyid kyi tshul khrims 'chal
analyzed: me nye bar zhi bas bsil ba len pa'i sems ni tshul khrims so zhes pa sdom pa dang chos yang dag par sdud pa dang sems can gyi don bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa nyid kyi tshul khrims 'chal
translated: The perfection of morality, which has the characteristics of restraint, correctly gathering the Dharma, and acting for the benefit of sentient beings, is superior here, free from the stain of immorality.

original: pa'i dri ma dang bral ba ste de'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir 'dir gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang sdug @32a * //
analyzed: pa'i dri ma dang bral ba ste de'i phyir dri ma med pa'o // gang gi phyir 'dir gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang sdug @32a * //
translated: Therefore it is stainless.🔽Because here one is indifferent to others’ harm, one accepts suffering, and one is patient with the Dharma.

original: bsngal dang du len pa dang / chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i dbye ba las rnam pa gsum po sran tshugs pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa nyid las mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pa thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs pa nyid kyi phyir ma
analyzed: bsngal dang du len pa dang / chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i dbye ba las rnam pa gsum po sran tshugs pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa nyid las mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pa thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs pa nyid kyi phyir ma
translated: The perfection of patience, which has the characteristic of steadfastness, is superior here, because one is unperturbed by all unwanted events that befall one.

original: nyams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i chos kyi snang ba chen po byed pa de'i phyir 'od byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i chos kyi snang ba chen po byed pa de'i phyir 'od byed pa'o //
translated: The light of the Dharma, based on the concentration of diminution, is produced, and therefore it is the shining.

original: gang las 'dir lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dge ba'i chos kyi tshogs kyi rgyun 'jug pa can dang sems can gyi don rjes su 'brel pa can dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed pa rnam pa gsum po spro ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi brtson🔽'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa nyid las byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bsregs te /
analyzed: gang las 'dir lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dge ba'i chos kyi tshogs kyi rgyun 'jug pa can dang sems can gyi don rjes su 'brel pa can dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed pa rnam pa gsum po spro ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa nyid las byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bsregs te /
translated: Here, the perfection of vigor is preeminent, because the stream of the accumulation of the wholesome of body, speech, and mind flows from it, the benefit of beings is connected with it, and the three kinds of purification of the Buddha-land are made.🔽The factors of enlightenment burn up the fuel of the afflictions, and therefore it is the radiant.

original: de'i phyir ye shes kyi 'od zer 'byung ba'i phyir 'od 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ye shes kyi 'od zer 'byung ba'i phyir 'od 'phro ba'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is preeminent, because the light of intuition is produced from it, and therefore it is the blazing.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir chos rnams thams cad la bri ba dang gang ba nyid med pa'i phyir skyon sel bar byed pa dang gnas pa can dang 'byor pa can gyi mtshan nyid can gsum gyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa nyid las dmigs pa'i
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir chos rnams thams cad la bri ba dang gang ba nyid med pa'i phyir skyon sel bar byed pa dang gnas pa can dang 'byor pa can gyi mtshan nyid can gsum gyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa nyid las dmigs pa'i
translated: Because here, since all phenomena are neither diminished nor increased, the perfection of meditative stabilization, which has the nature of eliminating faults, abiding, and enrichment, is superior.🔽When it is unshaken by distraction, it is difficult to purify, because mundane and supramundane knowledge and knowledge of the truths are mutually exclusive.

original: rnam par g-yeng bas mi bskyod pa na yang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gi rig pa dang bden pa'i shes pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir yongs su sbyang ba bya dka' ba dang / gang gi phyir yang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na gnas pa'i bdud rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' thub par mi nus te de'i phyir sbyang dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng bas mi bskyod pa na yang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gi rig pa dang bden pa'i shes pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir yongs su sbyang ba bya dka' ba dang / gang gi phyir yang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na gnas pa'i bdud rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' thub par mi nus te de'i phyir sbyang dka' ba'o //
translated: And because all māras who abide in all worldly realms are unable to overcome the bodhisattva, it is difficult to purify.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa rab tu mi gnas pa'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa thos pa dang / bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol la tu phyin pa rnam pa gsum po lhag pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa las dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rab tu rnam par 'byed
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa rab tu mi gnas pa'i sems ni byang chub kyi sems dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa thos pa dang / bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol la tu phyin pa rnam pa gsum po lhag pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa las dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rab tu rnam par 'byed
translated: From the three types of perfection of wisdom, which are the natures of listening, reflection, and meditation, the superior pacification of all afflictive and knowledge obscurations arises.

original: pa las chags pa med pa'i sgo zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa las chags pa med pa'i sgo zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: From the thorough differentiation of dependent origination, the manifest approach of the perfection of wisdom called the “door of nonattachment” arises.

original: de'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is manifest.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rdzas su na drug po 'di rnams ming gis bcur 'gyur te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rdzas su na drug po 'di rnams ming gis bcur 'gyur te /
translated: These six perfections in substance become ten by name.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @32b pa kho na khyad par gyi rnam par zhugs pa rnams thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin par mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @32b pa kho na khyad par gyi rnam par zhugs pa rnams thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin par mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom alone, when it has entered into the special aspects, is described as the perfections of means, vows, the powers, and knowledge.

original: de ltar ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis nye bar bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba rang gi skyon sel bar byed pa dang sems can gyi don la 'jug
analyzed: de ltar ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis nye bar bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba rang gi skyon sel bar byed pa dang sems can gyi don la 'jug
translated: Thus, the dedication of the roots of virtue accumulated by the six perfections to unsurpassed, true, complete enlightenment, which removes one’s own faults, engages in the welfare of sentient beings,

original: par byed pa dang / myur du bde blag tu mngon par byang chub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: par byed pa dang / myur du bde blag tu mngon par byang chub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: and has the character of quickly and easily bringing about manifest enlightenment, is the perfection of means.

original: thabs des de mi zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs des de mi zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by that means, it makes that inexhaustible.

original: smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa smon lam grangs med pa rnams ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin cing tshogs kyi rgyun can dang sems can gyi don rjes su 'brel pa can dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing sbyong bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi
analyzed: smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa smon lam grangs med pa rnams ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin cing tshogs kyi rgyun can dang sems can gyi don rjes su 'brel pa can dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing sbyong bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi
translated: The perfection of vows is the countless vows such as the ten great vows.

original: dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It has three types:

original: gang gis skye ba so sor pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis skye ba so sor pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'o //
translated: the vow to practice the six perfections in each lifetime;

original: bsgom pa'i stobs dang so sor rtog pa'i stobs ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin zhing /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs dang so sor rtog pa'i stobs ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin zhing /
translated: the perfection of power is the power of meditation and the power of discernment.🔽It has three types:

original: las ldog par byed pa dang nyon mongs pa sel bar byed pa dang / bdud dang phas kyi rgol bzlog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste /🔽gang gis nyi ma so so'am skad cig so sor de rnams la spyod pa'o ;
analyzed: las ldog par byed pa dang nyon mongs pa sel bar byed pa dang / bdud dang phas kyi rgol bzlog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste /🔽gang gis nyi ma so so'am skad cig so sor de rnams la spyod pa'o ;
translated: the power to turn away from actions; the power to eliminate afflictions; and the power to overcome demons and opponents.🔽The perfection of pristine awareness is the pristine awareness of the four investigations.🔽It has three types:🔽the pristine awareness that investigates phenomena; the pristine awareness that investigates meanings; the pristine awareness that investigates languages; and the pristine awareness that investigates the readiness to learn.

original: / dgongs pa ji lta ba dang sgra ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par theg pa chen po shes pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: / dgongs pa ji lta ba dang sgra ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par theg pa chen po shes pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the knowledge of the universal vehicle, not as it is intended nor as it is expressed.

original: rnam par mi rtog par byed pa dang rnam par rtog pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa dang sems can gyi don gyi thabs lkog tu ma gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par byed pa dang rnam par rtog pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa dang sems can gyi don gyi thabs lkog tu ma gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is threefold by way of its divisions, which are: the cause of non-discrimination, the cause of the realization of the equality of discrimination, and the cause of the non-obscuration of the means for the benefit of beings.

original: de la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid can tshad med pa mi zad pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis na gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba las
analyzed: de la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid can tshad med pa mi zad pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis na gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba las
translated: The perfection of means is the possession of the imperishability of the immeasurables, which have the nature of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity, by means of which, in all situations, one does not abandon the benefit of beings.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir byang chub kyi phyogs dang bden pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i gnas pa rtsol bas 'byung ste de'i phyir ring du song ba'o //🔽gang gi phyir 'dir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pas smon lam ji lta ba bzhin 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang bden pa dang rten cing @33a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir byang chub kyi phyogs dang bden pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i gnas pa rtsol bas 'byung ste de'i phyir ring du song ba'o // gang gi phyir 'dir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pas smon lam ji lta ba bzhin 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang bden pa dang rten cing @33a * //
translated: Because here the signless abiding that focuses on the factors of enlightenment, the truths, and dependent origination arises through exertion, therefore it is the far-reaching.

original: 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i gnas pa rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i gnas pa rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: Because here the signless abiding that focuses on the factors of enlightenment, the truths, and dependent origination arises naturally, due to the perfection of aspiration, as the result of aspiration, therefore it is immovable.

original: de'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Therefore it is the immovable.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sbyin pa dang stan par smra ba dang don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'i mtshan nyid can bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi mi zad pa rnams kyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sbyin pa dang stan par smra ba dang don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'i mtshan nyid can bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi mi zad pa rnams kyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i
translated: Because here, through the perfection of power, the four means of gathering disciples, which are characterized by generosity, pleasant speech, meaningful actions, and consistency between words and deeds, are inexhaustible.

original: phyir / chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis chos ston pa po nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' legs pa ste de'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros so //
analyzed: phyir / chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis chos ston pa po nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' legs pa ste de'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros so //
translated: Because he is the teacher of the Dharma through the four correct knowledges of phenomena, meaning, language, and confidence, the bodhisattva is excellent. Therefore, he is called Excellent Mind.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams la rgyal tshab kyi ched du dbang bskur te de'i phyir chos kyi sprin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams la rgyal tshab kyi ched du dbang bskur te de'i phyir chos kyi sprin te /
translated: Because here the bodhisattva is consecrated as regent of the Dharma, he is called Cloud of Dharma.

original: mi ha bran pa la'o //
analyzed: mi ha bran pa la'o //
translated: miha means to be anointed, and brāhmaṇa means anointed one.

original: gha nya ste ming la gha nyid do //
analyzed: gha nya ste ming la gha nyid do //
translated: Gha means name, and nya means to have.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa rnams kyis gdul bya 'dun par byed pa'i chos ston pa po nyid kyi phyir sprin chen po bzhin du rtsol ba med par chos thams cad mngon par char du 'babs
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa rnams kyis gdul bya 'dun par byed pa'i chos ston pa po nyid kyi phyir sprin chen po bzhin du rtsol ba med par chos thams cad mngon par char du 'babs
translated: The great cloud is the stage of the great cloud, because it is the cloud of Dharma that rains down the rain of the great Dharma of the extensive explanation of the great vehicle.🔽The stage of the cloud of Dharma is the stage of Dharma cloud, because it is the cloud of Dharma that rains down the rain of the great Dharma of the extensive explanation of the great vehicle.

original: 'di gsungs mod /
analyzed: 'di gsungs mod /
translated: That is said,

original: 'di'i thabs bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i thabs bstan pa ni ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir de yang rim pa 'di kho nas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that [state of no bliss] should also be understood by this very process.

analyzed: de skad du yang rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub par gsungs pa /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis rang gi sems zla ba'i rnam par ltos shig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Son of the family, look at your own mind in the form of the moon.”

analyzed: de ci pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis byang chub pa med dam zhe na /

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /

analyzed: mchog tu mthar thug pa na yang nges par thabs 'di la ltos so zhes brjod par bya ste /

translated: For example, just as the Lord of the Śākyas, dwelling at the foot of the Bodhi tree, relied on the empowerment of wisdom granted by the perfect Buddhas dwelling in the sky at midnight for the sake of attaining enlightenment, and just as the Blessed One was empowered by this very one alone with the vajra essence and the supreme drop, it is said in the extensive [texts].

translated: and that very moment, without a break, the state of the result, the nature of ultimate awakening mind, is the vajra holder.

original: 'di tsam kho nas rdo rje 'dzin pa mchog ma yin gyi 'on kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i ched du phyag rgya la ltos par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di tsam kho nas rdo rje 'dzin pa mchog ma yin gyi 'on kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i ched du phyag rgya la ltos par bya ste /
translated: This alone is not the supreme vajra holder, but rather, in order to realize the suchness of the connate, one should rely on a consort.

original: sum cu rtsa bdun par phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni phyag rgya dang lhan cig kho na'o zhes nges par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun par phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ni phyag rgya dang lhan cig kho na'o zhes nges par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the Thirty-Seven, it is ascertained that the spiritual power of the great seal is only with a consort.

original: de ltar gyur pa na rang lus nyid la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa na rang lus nyid la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: When that occurs, one should rely on a consort, and so on.

original: ci gzhan du yang sangs rgyas nyid du 'dod pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci gzhan du yang sangs rgyas nyid du 'dod pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is buddhahood asserted to be elsewhere?

original: yod de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams so //
analyzed: yod de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams so //
translated: It is, for those of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha vehicles.

original: de rnams ni phung po lnga 'gags pa na phung po lhag ma med pa 'dus ma byas pa thob bya rtag pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni sangs rgyas nyid du rjod par byed do //🔽dbang po la sogs pa rnams rdo rje 'dzin @35a * //
analyzed: de rnams ni phung po lnga 'gags pa na phung po lhag ma med pa 'dus ma byas pa thob bya rtag pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni sangs rgyas nyid du rjod par byed do // dbang po la sogs pa rnams rdo rje 'dzin @35a * //
translated: When those cease, the cessation of the five aggregates, the unconditioned, the object to be attained, is said to be buddhahood, the eternal nirvāṇa.

original: pa nyid du gsal bar byed de /🔽rang lus gnas zhes pa la sogs pa ste rang gi lus las log pa ma yin par 'jug pa'i phyir rang lus gnas pa'o //
analyzed: pa nyid du gsal bar byed de / rang lus gnas zhes pa la sogs pa ste rang gi lus las log pa ma yin par 'jug pa'i phyir rang lus gnas pa'o //
translated: The sense faculties and so on are clarified as being Vajradhara.

original: chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba nyid kyis ye shes chen po'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba nyid kyis ye shes chen po'o //
translated: The root of all phenomena is great pristine consciousness.

original: stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi bde ba chen po'i nyid kyis rtog pa thams cad rnam spangs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi bde ba chen po'i nyid kyis rtog pa thams cad rnam spangs pa'o //
translated: Great bliss, which is of the same taste as emptiness, is free from all concepts.

original: dngos po kun la khyab pa po //
analyzed: dngos po kun la khyab pa po //
translated: It is the pervader of all things.

original: zhes pas thams cad du nye bar mi 'bral ba'i nyams su myong ba las bde ba chen po gsal ba nyid du gsungs te chu yis rlabs rnams la bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pas thams cad du nye bar mi 'bral ba'i nyams su myong ba las bde ba chen po gsal ba nyid du gsungs te chu yis rlabs rnams la bzhin no //
translated: It is said that great bliss is clearly manifest from the experience of never being separate from everything, like waves in water.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: lus la gnas kyang lus skyes min //
analyzed: lus la gnas kyang lus skyes min //
translated: Although it abides in the body, it is not born from the body.

original: zhes pa lus nyid ni de las de dang ro gcig tu 'byung ba'i phyir te chu rlabs ni chu las bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa lus nyid ni de las de dang ro gcig tu 'byung ba'i phyir te chu rlabs ni chu las bzhin no //
translated: The body itself is of the same taste as that, because it arises from that, like a wave from water.

original: de ltar dngos po thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid kyis dkyil 'khor ba dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbang phyug shes mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid kyis dkyil 'khor ba dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbang phyug shes mod kyi /
translated: Thus, one should know the lord of the maṇḍala, along with the maṇḍala, by means of the pervasion of all things.

original: de lta na yang dkyil 'khor pa'i lha khyad par du shes pa'i ched du zhu ba /
analyzed: de lta na yang dkyil 'khor pa'i lha khyad par du shes pa'i ched du zhu ba /
translated: However, in order to know the special deities of the maṇḍala, [the Bhagavān] asks:

original: lus la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: What are the names of the nāḍīs in the body?

original: rtsa rnams kyang rang bzhin spyi dang khyad par du rgyas par ston par bzhed pas dang por grangs kho na gsungs pa /
analyzed: rtsa rnams kyang rang bzhin spyi dang khyad par du rgyas par ston par bzhed pas dang por grangs kho na gsungs pa /
translated: Since he wishes to teach the general and specific natures of the nāḍīs extensively, he first teaches the number:🔽One hundred and twenty,

original: bcu phrag gnyis lhag brgya phrag gcig / ces pa ste nyi shu lhag pa'o //
analyzed: bcu phrag gnyis lhag brgya phrag gcig / ces pa ste nyi shu lhag pa'o //
translated: that is, twenty more.

original: spyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: spyir gsungs pa /
translated: In general, it is said:

original: 'khor lo bzhi yi rab dbye las //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi yi rab dbye las //
translated: From the divisions of the four cakras,

original: zhes pa sprul pa dang chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo rnams kyi drug cu rtsa bzhi dang brgyad dang bcu drug dang sum cu rtsa gnyis rtsa'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: zhes pa sprul pa dang chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo rnams kyi drug cu rtsa bzhi dang brgyad dang bcu drug dang sum cu rtsa gnyis rtsa'i dbye ba las so //
translated: Thus, from the division of the channels into sixty-four, eight, sixteen, and thirty-two in the emanation, dharma, enjoyment, and great bliss cakras, respectively.

original: khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The special [channels] are mentioned:

original: byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin gyis zhes pa byang chub kyi sems kho na rang ste bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin gyis zhes pa byang chub kyi sems kho na rang ste bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: By the nature of bodhicitta, that is, by the very essence of bodhicitta itself,

original: phal cher de 'bab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal cher de 'bab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the bodhicitta mostly flows there.

original: de skad du yang brtag pa gnyis par byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis 'bab pa bde ba chen po'i gnas su 'dzag pa rnams so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du yang brtag pa gnyis par byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis 'bab pa bde ba chen po'i gnas su 'dzag pa rnams so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, in the second chapter, it is said that the thirty-two bodhicitta channels drip into the place of great bliss.
