original: dga' ba ma zhes pa dga' ba'i gdong can ma'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ma zhes pa dga' ba'i gdong can ma'o //
translated: The non-joy is the one with a face of joy.

original: nag mo zhes klog pa la ni nag po'i gdong can zhes pa ming gzhan te /
analyzed: nag mo zhes klog pa la ni nag po'i gdong can zhes pa ming gzhan te /
translated: If one reads black, the other name is one with a black face.

original: ji ltar rgyud gzhan du gzhan no //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyud gzhan du gzhan no //
translated: It is like the other [channels] in other tantras.

original: kha dog ma zhes pa ni gzugs can ma'o //
analyzed: kha dog ma zhes pa ni gzugs can ma'o //
translated: The color is Rūpiṇī.

original: gtum mo zhes pa gtum byed ma'o //
analyzed: gtum mo zhes pa gtum byed ma'o //
translated: The one called “caṇḍālī” is the one who burns.

original: rtsa 'di rnams kyi lha nyid dang bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad par 'gyur @35b ro //
analyzed: rtsa 'di rnams kyi lha nyid dang bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad par 'gyur @35b ro //
translated: The deities of these channels, their functions, and so on, will be explained below.

original: de ltar mdor bstan pa'i rtsa rnams kyi don dam pa'i rang bzhin shes par bya ba'i ched du zhus pa 'di rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pa'i rtsa rnams kyi don dam pa'i rang bzhin shes par bya ba'i ched du zhus pa 'di rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to understand the ultimate nature of the channels that were briefly presented, the question is asked, “What are they?” and so on.

original: srid gsum ni lus dang ngag dang sems rnams te khu ba dang khrag dang sems rnams so //
analyzed: srid gsum ni lus dang ngag dang sems rnams te khu ba dang khrag dang sems rnams so //
translated: The three existences are body, speech, and mind, which are semen, blood, and mind.

original: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba /
translated: As will be said:

original: snying stobs lus te rdul ni ngag //
analyzed: snying stobs lus te rdul ni ngag //
translated: The body is sattva, speech is rajas,

original: sems ni mun pa'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: sems ni mun pa'i rang bzhin las //
translated: and mind is the nature of tamas.

original: snying stobs khu ba rdul ni khrag / mun pa skye ba kho na'o //
analyzed: snying stobs khu ba rdul ni khrag / mun pa skye ba kho na'o //
translated: Sattva is semen, rajas is blood, and tamas is birth.

original: zhes so // de rnams las de'i ngo bor yongs gyur rnams so //
analyzed: zhes so // de rnams las de'i ngo bor yongs gyur rnams so //
translated: From those, the ones that transform into their nature are the channels.

original: de la kun 'dar ma ni gtso bor sems 'bab pa'i phyir sems kyi ngo bor yongs su gyur pa nyid do zhes gzhan du rnam par bzhag go //
analyzed: de la kun 'dar ma ni gtso bor sems 'bab pa'i phyir sems kyi ngo bor yongs su gyur pa nyid do zhes gzhan du rnam par bzhag go //
translated: In that regard, the avadhūti is primarily the descent of the mind, and therefore it is said elsewhere that it is the transformation into the nature of the mind.

original: brkyang ma ni lus 'bab pa'i phyir lus kyi ngo bor ro //
analyzed: brkyang ma ni lus 'bab pa'i phyir lus kyi ngo bor ro //
translated: The lalanā is the body, because the body descends from it.

original: ro ma ni ngag gi ngo bor ro //
analyzed: ro ma ni ngag gi ngo bor ro //
translated: The rasanā is the voice,🔽because the voice arises from it.

original: ngag gi skye gnas rlung 'bab pa'i phyir rkyang ma dang ro ma dag ngag gi ngo bor zhes kyang ste /
analyzed: ngag gi skye gnas rlung 'bab pa'i phyir rkyang ma dang ro ma dag ngag gi ngo bor zhes kyang ste /
translated: The lalanā and rasanā are the voice, because the voice arises from the wind that flows from them.

original: de las gzhan rnams lus 'bab pa'i phyir lus kyi ngo bor ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan rnams lus 'bab pa'i phyir lus kyi ngo bor ro //
translated: The others are the body, because the body descends from them.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bor gyur pa rnams thams cad /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bor gyur pa rnams thams cad /
translated: All of them, which have such natures,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba /
translated: are free from the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: spros pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams te stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams te stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: They are of the nature of the absence of conceptual elaborations, which means that they are of the same taste as emptiness.

original: de ltar na yang kun 'dar ma ni khyad par du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid dang bral ba'i zhes rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang kun 'dar ma ni khyad par du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid dang bral ba'i zhes rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Even so, the avadhūti is to be understood as being especially free from the apprehended and the apprehender,

original: spros pa med pa'i bde ba chen po 'char ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i bde ba chen po 'char ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause for the arising of the great bliss that is free from conceptual elaborations.

original: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: kun 'dar ma ni dbus gnas su //
analyzed: kun 'dar ma ni dbus gnas su //
translated: The avadhūti is in the middle.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
translated: Free from the apprehended and apprehender.

original: zhes so // de ltar stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang thabs kyi ngo bo nyid du bsgrub pa na stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid kho nar 'di rnams don dam par bsgrub par 'gyur ro zhes pa rdzogs pa'i
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang thabs kyi ngo bo nyid du bsgrub pa na stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid kho nar 'di rnams don dam par bsgrub par 'gyur ro zhes pa rdzogs pa'i
translated: Thus, when the essence of emptiness and the essence of method are established, these are ultimately established as the essence of the awakening mind of indivisible emptiness and compassion.

original: dkyil 'khor mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the summary of the mandala.

original: rgya cher ni rgyas par bshad pa la gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgya cher ni rgyas par bshad pa la gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the extensive explanation, it will be clarified.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la lam gyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems gang gis 'jug pa de ni de skad ces bya'o //🔽de mngon par brjod pa'i gzhung gi tshogs kyang de skad do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la lam gyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems gang gis 'jug pa de ni de skad ces bya'o // de mngon par brjod pa'i gzhung gi tshogs kyang de skad do //
translated: The awakening mind at the stage of the result is the awakening mind that is the nature of the path. The one who enters that is called that.🔽The collection of texts that express that are also called that.

original: mdor bstan pa tsam gyis rab tu gsal bar 'dis byed do zhes pa rab tu byed pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa tsam gyis rab tu gsal bar 'dis byed do zhes pa rab tu byed pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This makes it very clear through just a brief presentation.

original: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /🔽man ngag gi snye @36a * //
analyzed: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa / man ngag gi snye @36a * //
translated: The commentary on the glorious Heruka's Tantra.

original: mar snye ma gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: mar snye ma gnyis pa'o /
translated: The two bunches of instructions.

original: // / bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sems bstan pas bya ba byas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don gyi ched du gsol ba 'debs par mdzad pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: // / bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sems bstan pas bya ba byas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don gyi ched du gsol ba 'debs par mdzad pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Tathagatas, who have done what was to be done by teaching the unsurpassed thought of enlightenment, are entreated by the Bodhisattvas for the sake of their welfare.

original: stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid kyis bstan pa nyid kyi phyir snying po'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid kyis bstan pa nyid kyi phyir snying po'o //
translated: The essence is so called because it is taught as being of one taste in emptiness.

original: gsang chen ni sbas pa ste /
analyzed: gsang chen ni sbas pa ste /
translated: The great secret is hidden,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las gzhan rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las gzhan rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of others besides the Tathagatas.

original: ye shes ni byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: ye shes ni byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The wisdom is the thought of enlightenment,

original: bla med ni srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pas de las mchog med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla med ni srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pas de las mchog med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unsurpassed, since it does not abide in existence or in peace, and because there is nothing higher than it.

original: mkhyen nas ni mngon du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: mkhyen nas ni mngon du mdzad nas so //
translated: Having known, having realized,

original: rgyud thams cad kyi snying po zhes bya ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi snying po zhes bya ba bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of the essence of all tantras is finished.

original: ye shes kho na sgron ma ste /
analyzed: ye shes kho na sgron ma ste /
translated: Wisdom alone is the lamp,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i mun pa 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i mun pa 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it destroys the darkness of conceptual thoughts such as existence and nonexistence.

original: de kho na rdo rje stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: de kho na rdo rje stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: Thatness is the vajra, because it is of one taste with emptiness.

original: / de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas te rnam pa thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa'i shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i thugs brtan por mdzad nas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: / de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas te rnam pa thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa'i shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i thugs brtan por mdzad nas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Having entered into the meditative concentration called that, that is, having made firm the mind that realizes the nonduality of wisdom and method, which is the complete purification of all aspects, is the meaning.

original: gsang chen zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'di skad bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa'i ngag gi don 'dir yang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang chen zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'di skad bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa'i ngag gi don 'dir yang bstan par bya'o //
translated: The great secret and so forth should be taught here also with the meaning of the words thus have I heard and so forth.

original: gsang ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: gsang ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
translated: The word secret refers to all the tathagatas.

original: de la chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yod pa ni gsang chen chos 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yod pa ni gsang chen chos 'byung ngo //
translated: The existence of the nature of the Reality realm is the great secret source.

original: der ri rab kyi steng gi khang pa brtsegs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: der ri rab kyi steng gi khang pa brtsegs par gnas pa'o //
translated: It is located in the tower on top of Mt. Meru.

original: yang na de lta kho na'i gsang chen du ste 'khyud pa'i lha mo'i bha ga la'o //
analyzed: yang na de lta kho na'i gsang chen du ste 'khyud pa'i lha mo'i bha ga la'o //
translated: Or, it is in the bhaga of the embracing goddess, the great secret itself.

original: yang na de lta bu kho na'i gsang chen sprul pa la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams te sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin spyan ma la sogs pa btsun mo'i bha gar bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na de lta bu kho na'i gsang chen sprul pa la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams te sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin spyan ma la sogs pa btsun mo'i bha gar bshad pa rnams so //
translated: Or, it is in the bhaga of the queen Locana, etc., which are the great secret wheels of emanation, etc., which are of the nature of earth, etc.

original: yang na gsang chen ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i bha ga stong pa nyid dang / der gnas pa ni bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gsang chen ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i bha ga stong pa nyid dang / der gnas pa ni bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Or, the great secret is the emptiness of the bhaga of the Perfection of Wisdom, and the location there is the abode.

original: cir gyur pa'i gsang chen du zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: cir gyur pa'i gsang chen du zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: In what way is it the great secret? It is said:

original: mchog gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mchog gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: The supreme.

original: mchog gyur ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa gang na yin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog gyur ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa gang na yin pa'o //
translated: The supreme is where all the supramundane perfections are.

original: yang na mchog gi ye shes kyi yul na'o //
analyzed: yang na mchog gi ye shes kyi yul na'o //
translated: Or, it is the object of the supreme intuition.

original: yang na mchog mya ngan las @36b 'das pa rnam pa ji zhig ltar 'bras bu nyid kyis na 'dir 'jal bar byed yongs su gcod par byed ces pas mchog 'jal lo //
analyzed: yang na mchog mya ngan las @36b 'das pa rnam pa ji zhig ltar 'bras bu nyid kyis na 'dir 'jal bar byed yongs su gcod par byed ces pas mchog 'jal lo //
translated: Or else, the supreme is the nirvana, which is measured here, i.e., determined, by the result in some way.

original: yang na pha rol dgra po nyon mongs pa rnams rgyu'i gnas skabs su gang gis gsod par byed cing chung ngur byed pa ste mchog go //
analyzed: yang na pha rol dgra po nyon mongs pa rnams rgyu'i gnas skabs su gang gis gsod par byed cing chung ngur byed pa ste mchog go //
translated: Or else, the supreme is that by which the enemy, the afflictions, are killed, i.e., reduced, in the causal state.

original: dgyes pas na kye spyan ma la sogs pa mtha' yas pa'i lha mo dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i bde ba chen po'i rol pa'i bya bas dga' bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir mchog tu bde ba bskyed pa'i spyod yul na'o //
analyzed: dgyes pas na kye spyan ma la sogs pa mtha' yas pa'i lha mo dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i bde ba chen po'i rol pa'i bya bas dga' bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir mchog tu bde ba bskyed pa'i spyod yul na'o //
translated: The supreme bliss is generated in the field of the play of the great bliss of the union with the infinite goddesses such as Locanā, etc., because of the delight.

original: thams cad bdag nyid la zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir gsang chen thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid la zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir gsang chen thams cad do //
translated: All of the nature of the self, i.e., all of the nature of the Tathāgatas, is the great secret.

original: yang na me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir thams cad bdag nyid do //
analyzed: yang na me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir thams cad bdag nyid do //
translated: Or else, all of the nature of the self is the nature of the mirror-like intuition, etc.

original: yang na thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: yang na thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: Or else, all is Vajradhara,

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir de de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir de de skad ces bya'o //
translated: because he is of his nature.

original: 'dis gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //🔽rtag tu bzhugs zhes pa 'tsham pa med pa'i dus su gang du yang ma bzhud pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so // rtag tu bzhugs zhes pa 'tsham pa med pa'i dus su gang du yang ma bzhud pa ste /
translated: This states the excellence of the place.

original: sna tshogs pa de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Always dwelling means that he does not depart anywhere at any time, because he is the nature of all things.

original: da ltar byung ba nyid kyi rang bzhin dang rgyun gyis byung ba'i rtag pa nyid kyis na chos dang lhan cig skyes pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i ngo bo ni 'dir bstan pa'i gnas na mtha' yas pa'i btsun mo'i dbus su bzhugs so zhes pa'i
analyzed: da ltar byung ba nyid kyi rang bzhin dang rgyun gyis byung ba'i rtag pa nyid kyis na chos dang lhan cig skyes pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i ngo bo ni 'dir bstan pa'i gnas na mtha' yas pa'i btsun mo'i dbus su bzhugs so zhes pa'i
translated: Since he is eternal by nature and by continuity, he is always dwelling in the midst of his infinite queens in the place of teaching, which is the nature of the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body, and the Transformation Body.

original: don to // gzhan yang ra zhes pa la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu drug gis brjod par bya ba'i khams rnams bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'o zhes nyi shu rtsa gcig pa dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi par gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi don rnam pa
analyzed: don to // gzhan yang ra zhes pa la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu drug gis brjod par bya ba'i khams rnams bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'o zhes nyi shu rtsa gcig pa dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi par gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi don rnam pa
translated: Thus, the meaning of the words beginning with secret in the twenty-first and twenty-fourth chapters is explained in three ways.

original: gsum rnams bshad pas lnga'i khams dang ye shes dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su nges par bstan nas /
analyzed: gsum rnams bshad pas lnga'i khams dang ye shes dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su nges par bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the five elements, the pristine consciousnesses, and the tathāgatas,

original: de'i rang bzhin rdo rje sems dpa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rdo rje sems dpa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: it will be explained that their nature is Vajrasattva.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i rtag pa la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i rtag pa la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: All buddhas are the constant ones equal to the particles of all world systems.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir dang / de'i rgyu can nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kun dngos so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir dang / de'i rgyu can nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kun dngos so //
translated: Because they are the nature of that, and because they are the cause of that, they are the entity of all buddhas.

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su bskor ba nyid kyi phyir 'khor phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //🔽sems can rnams dang sa bcu'i @37a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su bskor ba nyid kyi phyir 'khor phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so // sems can rnams dang sa bcu'i @37a * //
translated: This declares the excellence of the retinue, because it is surrounded by all the Buddhas.

original: dbang phyug rnams dang gzhan rnams kyi dngos dang brgyud pas don bya ba shin tu nus pa nyid kyi phyir sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug rnams dang gzhan rnams kyi dngos dang brgyud pas don bya ba shin tu nus pa nyid kyi phyir sems dpa'o //
translated: The hero is the hero because of his great ability to act for the sake of sentient beings, of the lords of the ten stages, and of others, directly and indirectly.

original: 'dis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gsungs so //
translated: This declares the Body of Bliss.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid chos kyi sku dang snying rje bde ba'i bdag nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i sku dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid chos kyi sku dang snying rje bde ba'i bdag nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i sku dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Vajrasattva is the nature of the Thought of Enlightenment, which is the indivisibility of the Body of Dharma, which is the nature of emptiness, and the Body of Bliss, which is the nature of compassion, and is the nature of wisdom and means.

original: mchog ste zag pa med pa mi 'gyur ba dang bde ba chen po ste de'i rang bzhin rdo rje sems dpa' lhan cig skyes pa'i sku bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ste zag pa med pa mi 'gyur ba dang bde ba chen po ste de'i rang bzhin rdo rje sems dpa' lhan cig skyes pa'i sku bzhi pa'o //
translated: It is supreme, uncontaminated, unchanging, and great bliss. That is the nature of Vajrasattva, the fourth, the Innate Body.

original: 'o na sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba'i mkha' 'gro ma dra ba'i sdom pa 'chad par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan ci zhig brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba'i mkha' 'gro ma dra ba'i sdom pa 'chad par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan ci zhig brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, since you want to explain the dakini-tantra of the union of all buddhas, what else is there to say?

original: 'di ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma yin te /
translated: It is not like that.

original: ni ste gang gi phyir 'dir ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa gang da lta rgyas par bshad pa de kho na sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba ma mkha' 'gro ma dra ba'i sdom pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni ste gang gi phyir 'dir ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa gang da lta rgyas par bshad pa de kho na sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba ma mkha' 'gro ma dra ba'i sdom pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because here, the union of all buddhas is the dakini-tantra, which is the perfection of one's own and others' goals, just as it has been extensively explained.

original: rnal 'byor ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje zung du 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje zung du 'brel ba'o //
translated: Yoga is the union of emptiness and compassion.

original: yang na lha mo rnams dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i bde bas sbyor bar byed pas rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: yang na lha mo rnams dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i bde bas sbyor bar byed pas rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Or, it is yoga because it causes one to engage in the bliss of true union with the goddesses.

original: brtan pa ste rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis mi g-yo ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa ste rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis mi g-yo ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is firm, because it is unshaken by the winds of conceptuality.

original: rtag pa ni phyi ma'i mtha' ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni phyi ma'i mtha' ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is eternal, because it endures as long as the end of time.

original: yid thub mchog ni phul du dbyung du med pa'i rjes su chags pas lha mo thams cad kyi yid srub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid thub mchog ni phul du dbyung du med pa'i rjes su chags pas lha mo thams cad kyi yid srub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme mind-captivator is the most excellent of all, because it captivates the minds of all goddesses with its supreme attachment.

original: so so zhes pa so sor chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: so so zhes pa so sor chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: The individual is the individual nature of all phenomena.

original: byung ba ni yod bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba ni yod bzhin pa'o //
translated: The arisen is the existent.

original: yang na da ltar byung ba ni 'jug bzhin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na da ltar byung ba ni 'jug bzhin pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the present is the engaged.

original: rtag tu zhes pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The permanent is the past and future.

original: gang gi phyir 'di rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid kyi phyir dus gsum du 'jug pa'i chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid kyi phyir dus gsum du 'jug pa'i chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Because it is the nature of all phenomena that engage in the three times, since it is the nature of the dharmakāya, which is devoid of nature.

original: kun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni thams cad yod //
translated: Everything exists conventionally.

original: don dam par ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: don dam par ni yod ma yin //
translated: Nothing exists ultimately.

original: chos rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid //
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid //
translated: The absence of nature of phenomena

original: dam pa'i don du nye bar bstan //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du nye bar bstan //
translated: is taught to be the ultimate.

original: zhes chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdor gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdor gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: This is stated in the Dharmasangīti Sūtra.

original: don dam par rang bzhin med pa 'di rnams kyi rtag tu rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi bdag nyid ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin med pa 'di rnams kyi rtag tu rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi bdag nyid ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The ultimate naturelessness of these is the nature of their permanent naturelessness.

original: tshad mas 'thad pa nyid kyi phyir 'da' dka' @37b ba ste thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis kyang 'gom par bya ba ma yin na gzhan rnams kyis lta ci smos te /
analyzed: tshad mas 'thad pa nyid kyi phyir 'da' dka' @37b ba ste thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis kyang 'gom par bya ba ma yin na gzhan rnams kyis lta ci smos te /
translated: It is difficult to transgress because it is established by valid cognition. If it cannot be transgressed even by the omniscient ones, what need is there to speak of others?

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it has been said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung kyang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung kyang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa kho na ste /
translated: Whether the Tathagatas arise or not, this dharmata of dharmas just stays.

original: 'di lta ste stong pa nyid dang de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste stong pa nyid dang de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is this: emptiness, thusness, the perfect end.

original: 'di rnams kyis chos kyi sku bshad do //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis chos kyi sku bshad do //
translated: These explain the dharmakaya.

original: sprul pa'i sku rtogs par byed bzhin pas gsungs pa /🔽sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku rtogs par byed bzhin pas gsungs pa / sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to understand the nirmanakaya, he says:🔽From various actions, etc.

original: sna tshogs las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Various actions are the performance of desire, etc.

original: cho ga sna tshogs ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bor bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga sna tshogs ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bor bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The various rites are the accomplishments in the nature of Vajrasattva, etc.

original: de ltar ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa rnams rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i cho ga 'dod par 'gyur zhing de rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po rnams ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa rnams rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i cho ga 'dod par 'gyur zhing de rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po rnams ni /
translated: Thus, those who practice desire, etc. will desire the rites of Vajrasattva, etc. And their antidotes to desire, etc. are

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin sogs pa rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin sogs pa rnams //
translated: the Buddhas, Vajra-holders, etc.

original: zhes pa / sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad ni gti mug gi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa / sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad ni gti mug gi gnyen po'o //
translated: The Buddha Vairocana is the antidote to delusion.

original: yang na sangs rgyas ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste /
translated: Or else, the Buddha is the Lord of the ten stages,

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: as it is said:

original: sa bcu pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kho nar brjod par bya'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kho nar brjod par bya'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: “On the tenth stage, the Bodhisattva is to be called a Buddha, but not a Perfectly Enlightened One.”

original: rdo rje 'dzin ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o //
translated: The Vajra-holder is the Vajra of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: mdzad pa rnams ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: mdzad pa rnams ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: The deeds are those whose nature is the conventional truth.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su bcom pas ni sems can rnams dri ma med pa nyid du 'dren par byed do zhes pa 'dul ba rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su bcom pas ni sems can rnams dri ma med pa nyid du 'dren par byed do zhes pa 'dul ba rnams so //
translated: And by completely destroying the resistances to the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to the knowable, they lead sentient beings to the state of stainlessness.

original: dran pa rnams ni bsgom par 'gyur ba rnams te /
analyzed: dran pa rnams ni bsgom par 'gyur ba rnams te /
translated: The mindfulnesses are those that are cultivated,

original: thos pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: thos pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: not those that are merely heard.

original: yang na dran pa rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu'i gnas skabs su rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo sprul pa'i thabs rnams kyis sems can 'dul bar 'gyur ro zhes gang bsams pa rnams te /
analyzed: yang na dran pa rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu'i gnas skabs su rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo sprul pa'i thabs rnams kyis sems can 'dul bar 'gyur ro zhes gang bsams pa rnams te /
translated: Or else, the mindfulnesses are those that the Lord has in mind in the causal period, thinking, “By means of these various kinds of emanation techniques, I will discipline sentient beings.”

original: de rnams 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su rnam par mi rtog par spro bar byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su rnam par mi rtog par spro bar byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: He projects them in the resultant period without conceptual thought.

original: de ltar sku bzhi'i bdag nyid byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'di ni sangs rgyas kun dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos @38a * //
analyzed: de ltar sku bzhi'i bdag nyid byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'di ni sangs rgyas kun dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos @38a * //
translated: Thus, this mind of enlightenment, the nature of the four bodies, is the vajra of all buddhas, bodhisattvas, and so on, the essence of the stable and the moving.🔽

original: po thams cad kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: po thams cad kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, this Vajra of the Mind of Enlightenment, which is the nature of the four Bodies, is the nature of all things, both moving and unmoving, such as the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and so on.

original: rang gi sems las tha dad par gyur pa'i brtan pa rnams kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems las tha dad par gyur pa'i brtan pa rnams kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are no unmoving things that are different from one's own mind.

original: de lta bu 'di ci yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta bu 'di ci yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is this like? It is said:

original: kun zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: All the Buddhas and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kun rnams ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun rnams ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All the Buddhas are Vairochana and so on, who are the nature of the mirror-like wisdom and so on.

original: de rnams dang lhan cig stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sangs rgyas kun gyi ngo bo nyid kyis na 'gro ba'i don du gsal bar gyur pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i yang dag par sbyor ba ste bde ba chen
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sangs rgyas kun gyi ngo bo nyid kyis na 'gro ba'i don du gsal bar gyur pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i yang dag par sbyor ba ste bde ba chen
translated: By the nature of the nectar of wisdom, which is of one taste with emptiness together with them, he is the nature of all the Buddhas. For the sake of migrating beings, he is the true union of Vajrasattva, who is the great bliss

original: po'i rang bzhin bcu gsum pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sar 'dus pa gang gi yin pa'o //
analyzed: po'i rang bzhin bcu gsum pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sar 'dus pa gang gi yin pa'o //
translated: The nature of the thirteenth stage, the stage of the Vajra Holder, is the nature of the dakinis.

original: de yang yin zhing /
analyzed: de yang yin zhing /
translated: And that is so.

original: mkha' 'gro'i ngo bo ni mkha' 'gro ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro'i ngo bo ni mkha' 'gro ste /
translated: The essence of the dakinis is the dakinis.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba'o //
translated: They move in the sky.

original: mkha' 'gro'i sgra ni gsum pa'o /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro'i sgra ni gsum pa'o /
translated: The word dakini is the third.

original: aag aag gya gyur 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: aag aag gya gyur 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Ag ag is for moving in a crooked way.

original: 'dir thams cad nas 'gro ba ni gyu gyur 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad nas 'gro ba ni gyu gyur 'gro ba'o //
translated: Here, moving in a crooked way means moving in all directions.

original: mkha' la 'gro ba yis gya gyur 'gro ba'i dang tshul 'di'i yin pas mkha' 'gro ma ste rdzu 'phrul gyis lus dpag tu med pa rnams kyis cig car thams cad du 'gro ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mkha' la 'gro ba yis gya gyur 'gro ba'i dang tshul 'di'i yin pas mkha' 'gro ma ste rdzu 'phrul gyis lus dpag tu med pa rnams kyis cig car thams cad du 'gro ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The dakinis are so called because they move in a crooked way through the sky. The meaning is that by means of their magical powers, their bodies move simultaneously in all directions.

original: 'ga' zhig tu gzhan la rdo rje spros pa ni phyi rol gyi mkha' 'gro ma rnam par bcad pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu gzhan la rdo rje spros pa ni phyi rol gyi mkha' 'gro ma rnam par bcad pa'i don du ste /
translated: In some places, the term dakini is used to exclude the external dakinis.

original: rdo rje yang de rnams yin la spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyang yin pas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams so zhes pa'i don las so //
analyzed: rdo rje yang de rnams yin la spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyang yin pas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams so zhes pa'i don las so //
translated: The vajra is those, and the dakinis are the nature of the non-elaborate gnosis.

original: 'dir 'di lta bu'i ni thams cad du 'gro ba kho nas rnam par gcod do zhes pa dgongs pa'o //🔽yang na mkha' la 'gro ba ste dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes bdag nyid du byed pa'i ngang tshul 'di'i yin bzhis d'a yi n'i dang nges pa'i tshig la ka ru gyur pa na d'a ki n'i ste shes rab stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir 'di lta bu'i ni thams cad du 'gro ba kho nas rnam par gcod do zhes pa dgongs pa'o // yang na mkha' la 'gro ba ste dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes bdag nyid du byed pa'i ngang tshul 'di'i yin bzhis d'a yi n'i dang nges pa'i tshig la ka ru gyur pa na d'a ki n'i ste shes rab stong pa nyid do //
translated: The thought here is that this is excluded everywhere, just like that.

original: dra ba ni thabs snying rje'o //
analyzed: dra ba ni thabs snying rje'o //
translated: Or else, the dakinis are those who have the nature of the gnosis that is free from reference points, and the dakinis are the nature of the wisdom of emptiness, and the net is the method of compassion.

original: de dag las sham bde ba dang bar mchog gang gi yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag las sham bde ba dang bar mchog gang gi yin pa ste /
translated: From those, the dakinis are those who have the supreme bliss in between.

original: spros pa med pa nyid dang chen po nyid dang rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid dang mthar thug pa med pa'i dus su gnas pa nyid mchog rnams kyis de kha na ma tho ba rnams las phyi rol du byas nas mchog tu byed do zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma
analyzed: spros pa med pa nyid dang chen po nyid dang rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid dang mthar thug pa med pa'i dus su gnas pa nyid mchog rnams kyis de kha na ma tho ba rnams las phyi rol du byas nas mchog tu byed do zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma
translated: The supreme ones, having excluded them from the sin, make them supreme.

original: dra ba bde mchog ste nges pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dra ba bde mchog ste nges pa'i don du'o //
translated: This is the dakini-jala-heruka, in the definitive meaning.

original: drang ba'i don du ni /
analyzed: drang ba'i don du ni /
translated: In the interpretable meaning,

original: sangs @38b rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor bas te gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'dus pas /
analyzed: sangs @38b rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor bas te gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'dus pas /
translated: by uniting with all buddhas, the essence of the aggregate of form, etc., is Vairochana, etc.,

original: mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni nang gi rdul gyi ngo bo rnams sam rtsa rnams te /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni nang gi rdul gyi ngo bo rnams sam rtsa rnams te /
translated: the dakinis are the essence of the inner atoms, or the channels,

original: de rnams kyi dra ba ni tshogs dang / de bcom ldan 'das khu ba'i bdag nyid dang 'dus pas bde mchog tu byed pa bde ba chen po dang ro gcig tu byed do zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma dra ba bde mchog go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dra ba ni tshogs dang / de bcom ldan 'das khu ba'i bdag nyid dang 'dus pas bde mchog tu byed pa bde ba chen po dang ro gcig tu byed do zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma dra ba bde mchog go //
translated: and their net is the collection, and by the Bhagavat's uniting with them, the essence of semen, he makes them supreme, making them of one taste with great bliss. This is the dakini-jala-heruka.

original: yang na sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor bas te dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'dus pas na /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor bas te dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'dus pas na /
translated: Or else, because of being united with all buddhas, because of the gathering of the mandala circle of Vairochana and so on,

original: phyogs bcu rnams su nam mkhar 'gro ba yang dag par ston pa'i ngang tshul can gyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams gang gi dra ba ste rgyu ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu rnams su nam mkhar 'gro ba yang dag par ston pa'i ngang tshul can gyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams gang gi dra ba ste rgyu ma yin pa ste /
translated: the dakinis who have the nature of displaying movement in space in the ten directions are not the cause of his net.

original: mngon brjod kyi bstan bcos su dz'a la tshogs dang dra sgo dag la ste /🔽me tog phon po nya rgya sgyu la yang //
analyzed: mngon brjod kyi bstan bcos su dz'a la tshogs dang dra sgo dag la ste / me tog phon po nya rgya sgyu la yang //
translated: In the treatise on etymologies, it is explained that jala means a collection and dra means a door.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: It is also explained as a bouquet of flowers, a net, and a deception.

original: glang po che la sogs pa'i sgyu ma bzhin du mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bud med kyis gdul ba'i skye bo 'dun par bya ba'i ched du goo r'i la sogs pa'i rdo rje lha mo'i gzugs kyi sgyu ma ston pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa'i sgyu ma bzhin du mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bud med kyis gdul ba'i skye bo 'dun par bya ba'i ched du goo r'i la sogs pa'i rdo rje lha mo'i gzugs kyi sgyu ma ston pa'i phyir ro
translated: Because of being like the illusions of elephants and so on, Akshobya and so on display the illusion of the vajra goddesses such as Gauri and so on in the form of women in order to attract beings to be tamed by women.

original: // de yang yin la sdom pa yang yin pa'o zhes pa /
analyzed: // de yang yin la sdom pa yang yin pa'o zhes pa /
translated: It is a vow because it is that and it is a vow.

original: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The union with all Buddhas,

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i sgyu ma sdom pa rdo rje 'dzin pa kho na 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi rang gi ngo bo sku bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i sgyu ma sdom pa rdo rje 'dzin pa kho na 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi rang gi ngo bo sku bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: the vajra-holder, the very essence of the result tantra, is the nature of the four bodies.

original: 'di kho na mchog tu rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di kho na mchog tu rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This alone is the perfection of one's own aim and the perfection of others' aim.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni sngar sems dpa'i sgras thun mong ma yin pa dang / dngos dang brgyud pas ni thun mong bar zhar las byung bar brjod nas da lta ni gtso bor brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni sngar sems dpa'i sgras thun mong ma yin pa dang / dngos dang brgyud pas ni thun mong bar zhar las byung bar brjod nas da lta ni gtso bor brjod par bya'o //
translated: The result tantra was previously mentioned in passing as the uncommon and common by the word hero, and now it should be stated primarily.

original: 'di yis ni ste rnam pa 'di lta bur gyur pas so //
analyzed: 'di yis ni ste rnam pa 'di lta bur gyur pas so //
translated: By this means by this kind of nature.

original: thams cad du ni ste yul dang dus thams cad rnams su'o //
analyzed: thams cad du ni ste yul dang dus thams cad rnams su'o //
translated: Everywhere means in all places and times.

original: ji ltar rigs par sna tshogs pa'i gzugs rnams kyis 'dren no zhes pa 'dul 'os te /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par sna tshogs pa'i gzugs rnams kyis 'dren no zhes pa 'dul 'os te /
translated: Attracts means that it attracts those to be tamed by various forms as appropriate.

original: de rnams kyis 'grub pa ste 'dul bar byed pa zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis 'grub pa ste 'dul bar byed pa zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: Their accomplishment means that it accomplishes and tames them. The rest is understood.

original: sna tshogs ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: Various means of various kinds,

original: rigs ji lta ba dang bsod nams kyi bag chags sad pa'i dus ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs mtha' yas pa sprul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs ji lta ba dang bsod nams kyi bag chags sad pa'i dus ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs mtha' yas pa sprul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it emanates infinite forms in accordance with the types of beings and the times when the instincts of merit are awakened.

original: mchog ste bde blag pa'i thabs yang dag par ston pa nyid @39a * //
analyzed: mchog ste bde blag pa'i thabs yang dag par ston pa nyid @39a * //
translated: Supreme means that it is the best, because it is the teaching of the method of ease.

original: kyis so // grub pa ni rdzogs pa ste sangs rgyas kyi sar rnam par rtog pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyis so // grub pa ni rdzogs pa ste sangs rgyas kyi sar rnam par rtog pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Accomplishment means perfection, because it is the entrance into the stage of buddhahood without discursive thought.

original: yang na grub pa ni rtag pa ste mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud rnams la rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na grub pa ni rtag pa ste mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud rnams la rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, accomplishment means permanence, because it is the uninterrupted entrance into the mental streams of infinite sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams thams cad kyi don 'di las so zhes pa sems can kun don can te /
analyzed: sems can rnams thams cad kyi don 'di las so zhes pa sems can kun don can te /
translated: It has the aim of all sentient beings, because it is the aim of all sentient beings.

original: dbang po tha ma dang 'bring dang rab kyi so so skye bo'i sems can rnams kyi dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid can cung zad yongs su dag pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du gnyer bar bya zhing bsgrub par bya ba skyes bu'i don
analyzed: dbang po tha ma dang 'bring dang rab kyi so so skye bo'i sems can rnams kyi dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid can cung zad yongs su dag pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du gnyer bar bya zhing bsgrub par bya ba skyes bu'i don
translated: The purpose of the three kinds of persons is to be pursued and accomplished for the sake of ordinary beings of lesser, middling and greater capacity, and for the sake of beings with a slightly purified mind who are of the nature of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽

original: gyi mchog mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyi mchog mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme goal of persons is to be sought and accomplished for the sake of ordinary beings of weak, middling, and sharp faculties, and for the sake of beings who are slightly purified, who are of the nature of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, in order to attain nonabiding nirvāṇa.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ste /
translated: Therefore, it is supreme.

original: gzhug pa ldem por dgongs pas theg pa gsum bstan pa las theg pa chen po'i chen po mthar thug pa ston pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhug pa ldem por dgongs pas theg pa gsum bstan pa las theg pa chen po'i chen po mthar thug pa ston pa'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: It is also because it teaches the ultimate of the Mahāyāna, from among the teachings of the three vehicles by the indirect intention of introduction.

original: yang na sna tshogs ni bde 'gro dang grol ba gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na sna tshogs ni bde 'gro dang grol ba gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is diverse because it has the nature of the three—happy rebirth and liberation.

original: mchog ni gzhan gyis brjod pa'i grol ba rnams las so //
analyzed: mchog ni gzhan gyis brjod pa'i grol ba rnams las so //
translated: It is supreme because it is superior to the liberations taught by others.

original: grub pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste grub pa bzhin pa dang 'grub par 'gyur ba yang ngo //
analyzed: grub pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste grub pa bzhin pa dang 'grub par 'gyur ba yang ngo //
translated: Accomplishment is an illustration; it is like an accomplishment and will be accomplished.

original: sems can rnams kun gyi don mchog ni bde 'gro la sogs pa las kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mchog nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kun gyi don mchog ni bde 'gro la sogs pa las kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mchog nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The supreme purpose of all sentient beings is the supreme, perfect enlightenment, even more than the higher realms and so forth.

original: 'di rnams la ma ning gi rtags nyid ni lung nyid do //🔽da ni ji skad bshad pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' 'grub pa'i don du gtso bo'i thabs kyi rgyud rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: 'di rnams la ma ning gi rtags nyid ni lung nyid do // da ni ji skad bshad pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' 'grub pa'i don du gtso bo'i thabs kyi rgyud rgyas par ston te /
translated: The neuter signs of these are the scriptures themselves.

original: kun zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to accomplish the Vajrasattva as explained, the extensive tantra of the principal method is taught, beginning with “all” and so forth.

original: bud med rnams thams cad ni rang gi gzugs sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i rten 'ga' zhig sgrib pa phra mor byas pa nyid kyis dang 'ga' zhig sgrib pa med pa nyid du yongs su bsgyur ba rnams kyis sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du grub ste /
analyzed: bud med rnams thams cad ni rang gi gzugs sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i rten 'ga' zhig sgrib pa phra mor byas pa nyid kyis dang 'ga' zhig sgrib pa med pa nyid du yongs su bsgyur ba rnams kyis sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du grub ste /
translated: All women are established as having the nature of illusion by some having their own form with obscurations, some having subtle obscurations, and some having no obscurations at all.

original: grub pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: grub pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The accomplished yoginīs and vajra yoginīs are accomplished.

original: bsten pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sbyin par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bsten pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sbyin par 'gyur zhing /
translated: By relying on them, the great seal is granted.

original: mi dge ba gdug pa rnams la spyod pa'i ngang tshul 'di rnams kyi yin pa de rnams kyang mi dge ba spangs pas dge ba'i rjes su bsgrub ba pa lhur len pa rnams kyis de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba gdug pa rnams la spyod pa'i ngang tshul 'di rnams kyi yin pa de rnams kyang mi dge ba spangs pas dge ba'i rjes su bsgrub ba pa lhur len pa rnams kyis de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are devoted to the practice of virtue by abandoning non-virtue will accomplish this.

original: ci ltar zhe na kun rnams kyis te ji ltar tshogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul nye bar @39b longs spyod pa 'khyud pa dang 'o byed pa dang / rdo rje rab tu 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis thob par bya'o zhes pas kun thob kyang de yin la bde ba lhan cig skyes pa yang yin zhing /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na kun rnams kyis te ji ltar tshogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul nye bar @39b longs spyod pa 'khyud pa dang 'o byed pa dang / rdo rje rab tu 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis thob par bya'o zhes pas kun thob kyang de yin la bde ba lhan cig skyes pa yang yin zhing /
translated: How? By all, by the enjoyment of the objects of form and so forth of the assembly, by the attainment of embracing, kissing, the insertion of the vajra, and so forth.

original: de'i dga' ston ni gong nas gong du rjes su 'brel zhing skye ba rnams te /
analyzed: de'i dga' ston ni gong nas gong du rjes su 'brel zhing skye ba rnams te /
translated: The festival of that is the arising of the connate bliss in a continuous and increasing manner.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu de rnams kyis so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu de rnams kyis so //
translated: By those causes of appropriation.

original: bud med de rnams thams cad kyang rim pa gnyis la lha'i rang gi ngo bor mos par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: bud med de rnams thams cad kyang rim pa gnyis la lha'i rang gi ngo bor mos par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: All those women should be imagined as the divine nature of the two stages.

original: sna tshogs zhes pa rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes pa rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The variety is the various forms of Vajravarahi, etc.

original: sgyu ma ni don dam par rang bzhin med pa nyid na yang kun rdzob tu so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma ni don dam par rang bzhin med pa nyid na yang kun rdzob tu so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: An illusion is something that, although ultimately devoid of intrinsic reality, appears individually on the relative level.

original: phyag rgya ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa ste /
translated: A seal is the explanation that will be given below.

original: de kho na mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: de kho na mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: That is the dakini.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: zhes bya ba la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i brda yis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i brda yis te /
translated: By the sign that will be explained below.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi brda yis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi brda yis so //
translated: By the sign of the Bhagavat.

original: de ltar ni dee zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni dee zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, de and so forth.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba ni stong pa nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba ni stong pa nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: Flying in the sky is the realization of emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: thams cad nam mkha' chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad nam mkha' chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: All is sky, all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: de spyod de de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes pa thams cad nam mkha' spyod pa 'dis 'grub par byed do zhes pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: de spyod de de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes pa thams cad nam mkha' spyod pa 'dis 'grub par byed do zhes pa grub pa'o //
translated: Practicing that, one becomes of that nature. Thus, all is sky practice is the accomplishment.🔽 🔽Accomplishment is the accomplishment of that.

original: de mkha' 'gro ma ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa de ltar brjod pa bud med rnams la de'i bdag nyid du mos bzhin pa 'di'o //
analyzed: de mkha' 'gro ma ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa de ltar brjod pa bud med rnams la de'i bdag nyid du mos bzhin pa 'di'o //
translated: In this way, one should imagine that all women are of her nature.

original: 'ga' zhig tu 'gro ba zhes klog pa de'i tshe 'gro'o ste 'dis dngos po la sogs par mngon par zhen pa 'gro'o zhes pas 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu 'gro ba zhes klog pa de'i tshe 'gro'o ste 'dis dngos po la sogs par mngon par zhen pa 'gro'o zhes pas 'gro'o //
translated: In some places, one reads “going,” and in that case, one should go, because one goes to the things, etc., with the thought “I will go.”

original: phyag rgya zhes mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par ston te /🔽kun du zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par ston te / kun du zhes pa'o //
translated: The seal is taught in detail in the brief presentation.🔽Everywhere means in all ten directions.

original: kun du ste phyogs bcu rnams su sna tshogs te phung po la sogs pa rgyas 'debs par byed cing dga' ba len par byed do zhes pa'am /
analyzed: kun du ste phyogs bcu rnams su sna tshogs te phung po la sogs pa rgyas 'debs par byed cing dga' ba len par byed do zhes pa'am /
translated: One seals the various aggregates, etc., and takes up the joy.

original: sna tshogs pa'i phyag rgya ni sna tshogs phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i phyag rgya ni sna tshogs phyag rgya'o //
translated: Or, the various seals are the various seals.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: kun du ste gzugs la sogs pa'i yul nye bar longs spyod pa la sna tshogs kyis te sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba mchog dam pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: kun du ste gzugs la sogs pa'i yul nye bar longs spyod pa la sna tshogs kyis te sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba mchog dam pa rnams kyis te /
translated: In every way, i.e., in the enjoyment of objects such as form, by means of the various, i.e., manifold, natures of supreme, sublime bliss.

original: stong pa nyid kyis yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa de ltar lhag par mos pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa lha mo'i rang bzhin 'di rnams kyi rigs rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa de ltar lhag par mos pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa lha mo'i rang bzhin 'di rnams kyi rigs rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: Because of the purity of emptiness, these families of the goddesses such as Lochana, who have such an exalted resolve, become the vajra,

original: rdo rje @40a * //
analyzed: rdo rje @40a * //
translated: vajra-holder,🔽lotus,🔽jewel,🔽and sword families.

original: ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Vajra is Akshobhya, whose nature is nondual intuition.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Vajra-holder is Vajrasattva.

original: padma dang 'dra bas padma ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: padma dang 'dra bas padma ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: Lotus is Vairochana, who is like a lotus,

original: chu'i skyon gyis mi gnod pa'i padma bzhin du 'khor ba'i skyon rnams kyis mi gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chu'i skyon gyis mi gnod pa'i padma bzhin du 'khor ba'i skyon rnams kyis mi gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is not harmed by the faults of cyclic existence, like a lotus is not harmed by the faults of the water.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa med pa nyid gsal bar byed pa'i dgongs pa can 'dir nye bar brtags pa ni nye bar mtshon pa lhur byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa med pa nyid gsal bar byed pa'i dgongs pa can 'dir nye bar brtags pa ni nye bar mtshon pa lhur byed pa'o //
translated: The intention here is to illuminate the unobstructedness of all the Tathagatas.

original: padma 'dzin pa ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: padma 'dzin pa ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The lotus-holder is Amitabha.

original: nor bu dang ldan pa'i phyir nor bu ste rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: nor bu dang ldan pa'i phyir nor bu ste rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The jewel is Ratnasambhava, because he is endowed with a jewel.

original: nor bu 'dzin pa ni don yod grub pa ste nor bu ral gri rin po che 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu 'dzin pa ni don yod grub pa ste nor bu ral gri rin po che 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The jewel-holder is Amoghasiddhi, because he holds the jewel sword.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gang yang rung ba'i gzugs rang rang gi gzugs mkha' 'gro mas yongs su bskor bar bdag nyid rdzogs par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa 'grub po zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gang yang rung ba'i gzugs rang rang gi gzugs mkha' 'gro mas yongs su bskor bar bdag nyid rdzogs par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa 'grub po zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The yogin who visualizes himself in the form of any one of Vajradhara and so on, surrounded by the dakinis, will achieve perfection.

original: de ltar 'dis ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya yang gsal bar mdzad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar 'dis ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya yang gsal bar mdzad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus he also elucidates the wisdom consort.

original: de ltar thabs kyi rgyud bka' stsal nas rgyu'i rgyud bla na med pa'i rgyur gyur pa byang chub kyi sems ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar thabs kyi rgyud bka' stsal nas rgyu'i rgyud bla na med pa'i rgyur gyur pa byang chub kyi sems ston pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the method tantra, the teaching of the thought of enlightenment, which is the cause of the cause of the unexcelled tantra, is as follows:

original: de nas zhes pa ste thams gsal bar mdzad pa'i bar ma chad par ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ste thams gsal bar mdzad pa'i bar ma chad par ro //
translated: Then, without interruption, he illuminated all.

original: thams cad ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid rnams so //
translated: All means those of the outer and inner natures.

original: de bzhin te sgrib pa gnyis kyi bag chags cha phra mo dang lhan cig pa nyid du gshegs pa'i phung po lnga po rnams gang du zil gyis gnon cing stong pa nyid du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin te sgrib pa gnyis kyi bag chags cha phra mo dang lhan cig pa nyid du gshegs pa'i phung po lnga po rnams gang du zil gyis gnon cing stong pa nyid du byed pa'o //
translated: Just so, the five aggregates, which are accompanied by the subtle part of the instinct for the two obstructions, are overwhelmed and made empty in him.

original: de yang yin la de nyid kyi phyir bag chags dang bral ba nyid kyis na rdul dang bral ba yang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de yang yin la de nyid kyi phyir bag chags dang bral ba nyid kyis na rdul dang bral ba yang yin pa ste /
translated: And that is so, and because of that, he is also free of dust, by virtue of being free of instinct,

original: rdul dang 'dra bas rdul zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul dang 'dra bas rdul zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of being called dust because of being like dust.

original: gnas kyang ste rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa mthar thug pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas byang chub kyi sems gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par 'dzin pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: gnas kyang ste rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa mthar thug pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas byang chub kyi sems gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par 'dzin pa dang bral ba /
translated: Having entered into meditative equipoise on that, the bodhicitta free from the grasping of apprehender and apprehended,

original: stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa /
translated: one taste with emptiness,

original: phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems kyi mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan te /
analyzed: phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems kyi mtshan nyid rgyas par bstan te /
translated: the body, speech, and mind that are not different from each other are explained in detail.

original: ting nge 'dzin de kho na'i ji lta ba bzhin snyoms par zhugs pa phyag rgya chen po dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i go 'phang mchog gi ngo bo rgyu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang gi ngo bo gsungs so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de kho na'i ji lta ba bzhin snyoms par zhugs pa phyag rgya chen po dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i go 'phang mchog gi ngo bo rgyu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang gi ngo bo gsungs so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the nature of the supreme state of union with mahāmudrā, which is the meditative equipoise on that samādhi just as it is, is the nature of the causal vajra holder.

original: stong pa skur pa @40b 'debs pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa skur pa @40b 'debs pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: Emptiness is not the nature of the seal.

original: kun rdzob tu so sor snang bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu so sor snang bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is because it appears individually in the relative.

original: mi stong min pa ni don dam par rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi stong min pa ni don dam par rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not nonempty because it is not ultimately natureless.

original: don dam pa ba zhig rab tu gsal ba'i lus kyis med pa ma yin zhing de las gzhan pa gzung ba la sogs pa rnams kyis yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba dbu ma'i lam du dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa ba zhig rab tu gsal ba'i lus kyis med pa ma yin zhing de las gzhan pa gzung ba la sogs pa rnams kyis yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba dbu ma'i lam du dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent because it is not nonexistent by the body of ultimate reality. It is not existent because it is not existent by the other, such as the apprehended. Therefore, it is not even observed in the middle path of the world.

original: gang gi phyir de'i sgrub par byed pa ni dmigs pa yin na de yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum du yod pa ma yin pas so zhes pas sgrub byed kyi tshad ma med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i sgrub par byed pa ni dmigs pa yin na de yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum du yod pa ma yin pas so zhes pas sgrub byed kyi tshad ma med do //
translated: Because its proof is an observation, and that does not exist in the direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: gnod byed kyi tshad ma ni /🔽ji ltar me long ngos rnams la //
analyzed: gnod byed kyi tshad ma ni / ji ltar me long ngos rnams la //
translated: The valid cognition that refutes it is🔽as stated in the following quotations from sutra and so forth:🔽Just as a form🔽that is neither the same nor different

original: gcig dang gzhan nyid spangs pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: gcig dang gzhan nyid spangs pa'i gzugs //
translated: appears in the facets of a mirror,

original: snang yang de la yod ma yin //
analyzed: snang yang de la yod ma yin //
translated: though it does not exist there,

original: de ltar dngos la rang bzhin med //
analyzed: de ltar dngos la rang bzhin med //
translated: so too entities are natureless.

original: ces pa la sogs pas mdo la sogs pa rnams su mang du gsal bar byas so zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pas mdo la sogs pa rnams su mang du gsal bar byas so zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention.

original: de ltar phyed snga mas stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar phyed snga mas stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: Thus, the first half clarifies the reality of emptiness.

original: de kho na yang rgyu'i rgyud ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na yang rgyu'i rgyud ma yin te /
translated: And that reality is not the causal continuum,🔽because the compassionate nature of that vajra, the nature of the result, is joined with the perfection of wisdom, with emptiness.

original: ni ste gang gi phyir snying rje'i bdag nyid de rdo rje'i rang gi ngo bo shes rab pha rol phyin dang ste stong pa nyid dang sbyor ba ste de'i bdag nyid ni thabs te 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ni ste gang gi phyir snying rje'i bdag nyid de rdo rje'i rang gi ngo bo shes rab pha rol phyin dang ste stong pa nyid dang sbyor ba ste de'i bdag nyid ni thabs te 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The method, whose nature is that, is the cause of the resultant Vajradhara.

original: kha cig tu snying rje'i bdag nyid kyis zhes klog go //
analyzed: kha cig tu snying rje'i bdag nyid kyis zhes klog go //
translated: In some [texts], it is read as by the compassionate nature.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir snying rje bzang po ste dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po gang gis de'i bdag nyid du 'brel ba las thabs yin pa de ni shes rab pha rol phyin pa kho na gsal ba'o ste kun rdzob tu rab
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir snying rje bzang po ste dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po gang gis de'i bdag nyid du 'brel ba las thabs yin pa de ni shes rab pha rol phyin pa kho na gsal ba'o ste kun rdzob tu rab
translated: Because that is so, the good compassion, the great non-objectifying compassion, by whose nature it is connected, is the method. That is the clarity of the perfection of wisdom itself, which is the relative bodhicitta.

original: tu gsal bzhin pa ni byang chub kyi sems so zhes sbrel to //
analyzed: tu gsal bzhin pa ni byang chub kyi sems so zhes sbrel to //
translated: The one who is clearly present is the bodhicitta.

original: 'dis ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi 'gro ba kho na bla na med pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems su gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi 'gro ba kho na bla na med pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems su gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This declares that the very being of the world, which is emptiness devoid of beginning and end and the nature of compassion, is the enlightenment mind which is the cause of the unsurpassed.

original: de rtogs pa'i thabs bsgom pa le'u drug par rgyas par ston par 'gyur ba mdor ston pa /
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i thabs bsgom pa le'u drug par rgyas par ston par 'gyur ba mdor ston pa /
translated: The means of realizing that, which will be taught extensively in Chapter VI, is summarized here:

original: rnam par mi rtog ces pa sgro 'dogs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos rnams la ste gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams la dngos po bsgom par bya ba'i rang bzhin med de chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ces pa sgro 'dogs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos rnams la ste gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams la dngos po bsgom par bya ba'i rang bzhin med de chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no reality to be cultivated in the five aggregates such as form, etc., which are the dharmas free from all superimposition and are said to be “non-conceptual.” This is because all dharmas are empty by nature.

original: sgom pa'am sgom pa po med de bsgom par bya ba med pa'i phyir te /🔽chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa kho na sgom @41a * //
analyzed: sgom pa'am sgom pa po med de bsgom par bya ba med pa'i phyir te / chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa kho na sgom @41a * //
translated: There is no cultivation or cultivator, because there is nothing to be cultivated.

original: pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it is only the non-conceptuality of all dharmas that is the cultivation.

original: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gsung bar 'gyur ba /
translated: This is what will be said:

original: gang la sgom byed cung zad med //
analyzed: gang la sgom byed cung zad med //
translated: There is no cultivation whatsoever.

original: sgom pa'ang cung zad med pas na //
analyzed: sgom pa'ang cung zad med pas na //
translated: Since there is not even a little meditation,

original: bsgom bya'ang yod pa min pa de //
analyzed: bsgom bya'ang yod pa min pa de //
translated: and also there is no object of meditation,

original: de kho na nyid sgom par brjod //
analyzed: de kho na nyid sgom par brjod //
translated: that is called meditation on reality.

original: ces so // gal te rnam par mi rtog na ci ltar dam tshig bsten pa la sogs pa las rang gi rtog pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ram gzhan gyi don rdzogs par byed ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces so // gal te rnam par mi rtog na ci ltar dam tshig bsten pa la sogs pa las rang gi rtog pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ram gzhan gyi don rdzogs par byed ce na gsungs pa /
translated: If one is non-conceptual, how does one complete the special state of one’s own thought from reliance on the commitments, etc., or the benefit of others?

original: rnam mi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam mi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said:

original: rnam mi rtog par mos pa la'ang ste gyur pa la dam tshig bsten pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams thams cad rnal 'byor pas rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam mi rtog par mos pa la'ang ste gyur pa la dam tshig bsten pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams thams cad rnal 'byor pas rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Even in the non-conceptual imagination, all the thoughts of reliance on the commitments, etc., are completed by the yogi.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la lhag par mos pa na phal cher gzhan don la phyir phyogs pa srid de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la lhag par mos pa na phal cher gzhan don la phyir phyogs pa srid de /
translated: When one is devoted to non-conceptuality, it is possible that one turns away from the benefit of others.

original: slar yang sems can gyi don la sbyor ba ni rnam par mi rtog ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang sems can gyi don la sbyor ba ni rnam par mi rtog ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Again, the application to the benefit of sentient beings is stated in “non-conceptually, etc.”

original: de ltar 'dis dang po goms par byed pa'i skabs su lhag par mos pa kho nas rnam par mi rtog pa 'byung zhing der yang thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes mngon par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dis dang po goms par byed pa'i skabs su lhag par mos pa kho nas rnam par mi rtog pa 'byung zhing der yang thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes mngon par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, when one is first cultivating it, non-conceptuality arises only through special imagination, and one should accomplish everything in that way.

original: gang gi tshe bsgoms pa las rim gyis rab kyi mthar phyin pa na byang chub kyi sems ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsgoms pa las rim gyis rab kyi mthar phyin pa na byang chub kyi sems ni /
translated: When one has gradually reached the culmination of the practice, the thought of awakening

original: de bzhin gshegs kun bdag nyid chos //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs kun bdag nyid chos //
translated: is the nature of all the Tathāgatas.

original: chos kyi skur 'gyur ba de'i tshe //
analyzed: chos kyi skur 'gyur ba de'i tshe //
translated: At that time, it is the Dharma Body.

original: chos can gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po med de rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po med de rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: At that time, there are no aggregates of form, etc., which are phenomena, because they are essenceless.

original: de'i chos kho na'i chos nyid stong pa nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: de'i chos kho na'i chos nyid stong pa nyid kyang med do //
translated: Even the emptiness which is the reality of just those phenomena does not exist.

original: kun rdzob tu ni gnyis ka yang dbyer med par yod do zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni gnyis ka yang dbyer med par yod do zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Conventionally, both are established as existing inseparably,

original: stong pa nyid ni dngos po rnams las log pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni dngos po rnams las log pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because emptiness is not the opposite of things.

original: de skad du yang rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs su gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs su gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Avatāra-vyākhyā-dhāraṇī:

original: dam chos 'di la rgyal ba'i sras //
analyzed: dam chos 'di la rgyal ba'i sras //
translated: In this holy Dharma, the Bodhisattvas

original: rnam par mi rtog bsams gyur nas //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog bsams gyur nas //
translated: Think of the non-conceptual,

original: rnam rtog bgrod dka' las 'das te //
analyzed: rnam rtog bgrod dka' las 'das te //
translated: And, having gone beyond the conceptual, difficult to traverse,

original: rim gyis mi rtog thob par byed //🔽rab tu zhi ba mi g-yo mchog / dbang sgyur mnyam dang mi mnyam pa //
analyzed: rim gyis mi rtog thob par byed // rab tu zhi ba mi g-yo mchog / dbang sgyur mnyam dang mi mnyam pa //
translated: They gradually attain the non-conceptual.🔽The non-conceptual is the pacification, the immobility, the supreme,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa de de'i phyir ;
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa de de'i phyir ;
translated: The mastery, the equal, and the unequal.

original: / byang chub sems dpa' rtogs par byed //
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa' rtogs par byed //
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattvas realize🔽The non-conceptual.

original: ces so // 'dir rnam par mi rtog bsam pa ni /
analyzed: ces so // 'dir rnam par mi rtog bsam pa ni /
translated: Here, “thinking of the non-conceptual”

original: rnam par mi rtog par lhag par mos pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par lhag par mos pa bstan pa'o //
translated: teaches the non-conceptual superior intention.

original: dam chos la ste de kho na nyid la'o //
analyzed: dam chos la ste de kho na nyid la'o //
translated: “In the holy Dharma” means in reality.

original: rnam rtog kho na rnam pa bzhi'i bgrod dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog kho na rnam pa bzhi'i bgrod dka' ba'o //
translated: “Conceptual” is the difficult to traverse fourfold conceptualization.

original: rim pa ni goms nas so //
analyzed: rim pa ni goms nas so //
translated: “Gradually” means after cultivation.

original: mi @41b rtog pa spros pa med pa'i ye shes 'thob bo //
analyzed: mi @41b rtog pa spros pa med pa'i ye shes 'thob bo //
translated: “Attain the non-conceptual” means attain the non-conceptual, non-elaborated wisdom.

original: de'i phyir ye shes las bde ba rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ye shes las bde ba rtogs par byed do //
translated: Therefore, “realize the bliss from wisdom.”

original: rab tu zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Pacification” is because of the absence of afflictions.

original: mi g-yo ba ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The immovable is because of the absence of complete degeneration.

original: mchog ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyi phyir ro //
