translated: The supreme is because of the supremacy of all mundane and supramundane bliss.

original: dbang sgyur ni ji ltar 'dod pa dang ji srid 'dod par yang dag par mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang sgyur ni ji ltar 'dod pa dang ji srid 'dod par yang dag par mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mastery is because of the actualization of whatever is desired and for as long as is desired.

original: mnyam pa ni de las gzhan pa'i bde ba rnams dang bde ba'i rigs su mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa ni de las gzhan pa'i bde ba rnams dang bde ba'i rigs su mnyam pa'o //
translated: The equal is the equality of that bliss with all other types of bliss.

original: mi mnyam pa ni khyad par bzhi po 'di rnams kho nas so //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni khyad par bzhi po 'di rnams kho nas so //
translated: The unequal is because of these four distinctions.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog rnams la zhes pa la sogs pas 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa nub par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog rnams la zhes pa la sogs pas 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa nub par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the resultant Vajradhara, who is free from all conceptual thought, is the one who is intended to be the one who has caused the subsiding of all conceptual thought.

original: de lta yin yang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis mu mtha' med pa'i gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa de las 'jug ces gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta yin yang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis mu mtha' med pa'i gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa de las 'jug ces gsungs pa /
translated: However, by the power of his previous aspirations, he is the one who engages in the benefit of others, which is limitless.

original: brag ca'i sgra dang mtshungs pa yi //
analyzed: brag ca'i sgra dang mtshungs pa yi //
translated: Like an echo.

original: zhes pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid kyis dang rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid kyis dang rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the similarity of the absence of conceptual differentiation and the absence of intrinsic reality of the motivating force, respectively.

original: chos kyi ste rang gis rtogs pa'i rgyu'i rgyud la sogs pa'i ngag ste yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud la sogs pa theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: chos kyi ste rang gis rtogs pa'i rgyu'i rgyud la sogs pa'i ngag ste yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud la sogs pa theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The Dharma is the speech of the cause, etc. of one's own realization, i.e. the cause, etc. of the speech of the perfect union, etc.🔽Thus, the unsurpassed enlightenment-citta, the basis of the perfect fulfillment of one's own and others' aims, is the result of the cause, i.e. the enlightenment-citta.

original: de ltar rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rab tu gyur pa'i rten 'bras bur gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems bla na med pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyi zhar las byung ba las rgyu kho na rnam par dag pa ni 'bras bu'o zhes mngon🔽par dgongs nas gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rab tu gyur pa'i rten 'bras bur gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems bla na med pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyi zhar las byung ba las rgyu kho na rnam par dag pa ni 'bras bu'o zhes mngon par dgongs nas gsungs so //
translated: Having understood this, the Exalted One declared, The cause is pure, the result is pure.🔽With this meaning in mind, the Tathagatas, Vairocana, etc.

original: don 'di la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rtogs nas dang po bstod pas nye bar bstan pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: don 'di la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rtogs nas dang po bstod pas nye bar bstan pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: , having understood, declared the following in order to teach the praise of the first generation of the enlightenment-citta.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.🔽

original: gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bus gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par byed pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin pa de la yang dag par bstod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bus gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par byed pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin pa de la yang dag par bstod pa'o //
translated: Now, the praise of the Vajra-Holder, who is the one who has the perfection of the benefit of others by means of cause and effect, is as follows.

original: de bgrod par bya thob par bya ba gtso bo'i theg pa ste /
analyzed: de bgrod par bya thob par bya ba gtso bo'i theg pa ste /
translated: The vehicle of the chief one, which is to be gone to and attained, is the vehicle of the chief one.

original: 'bras bu dang / 'dis 'gro'o zhes pa ni de'i don nyid las phal pa'i theg pa lam ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / 'dis 'gro'o zhes pa ni de'i don nyid las phal pa'i theg pa lam ste /
translated: The vehicle of the common people is the path, which is the vehicle of the common people, since it goes by this.

original: de gnyis ka rjod par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs kyang ngo //
analyzed: de gnyis ka rjod par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs kyang ngo //
translated: The collection of texts that express both of those is also the vehicle.🔽The vehicle of the Sravakas and so on is the vehicle of the common people.🔽The vehicle of the chief one is the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas.🔽The vehicle of the chief one is the vehicle of the Buddhas.🔽The vehicle of the chief one is the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas, because it is the vehicle of the chief ones, the Bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa rnams las thub pa'i @42a * //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa rnams las thub pa'i @42a * //
translated: The vehicle of the common people is the vehicle of the Sravakas and so on.🔽The vehicle of the chief one is the vehicle of the Buddhas, because it is the vehicle of the chief one, the Buddha.

original: dgongs pa'i rgyan du rnam par phye ba'i chen po nyid rnam pa dgu dang ldan pa'i phyir chen po yang de yin la theg pa yang de yin pa zhes pa theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i rgyan du rnam par phye ba'i chen po nyid rnam pa dgu dang ldan pa'i phyir chen po yang de yin la theg pa yang de yin pa zhes pa theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The vehicle of the chief one is the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas, because it is the vehicle of the chief ones, the Bodhisattvas.🔽The vehicle of the common people is the vehicle of the Sravakas and so on.🔽The vehicle of the chief one is the vehicle of the Buddhas, because it is the vehicle of the chief one, the Buddha.

original: de la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i yon tan gang rnams kyi yang dag par 'byung zhing rab tu skye ba de rnams rgyas pa ste rgya che ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i yon tan gang rnams kyi yang dag par 'byung zhing rab tu skye ba de rnams rgyas pa ste rgya che ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The arising and generation of those qualities that will be explained is their expansion, that is, their vastness.

original: dus gsum ni dus rnams te de rnams su byung ba ni dus gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum ni dus rnams te de rnams su byung ba ni dus gsum pa'o //
translated: The three times are the times, and what occurs in them is of the three times.

original: de la gang 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir ston pa la sogs pa'i bya ba zhig pa de rnams 'das pa rnams so zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la gang 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir ston pa la sogs pa'i bya ba zhig pa de rnams 'das pa rnams so zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Among them, those that have ceased in this world, such as the deeds of the Teacher, are posited as past.

original: yod kyang cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid kyis na med pa dang 'dra ba rnams so zhes dgongs pas so //
analyzed: yod kyang cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid kyis na med pa dang 'dra ba rnams so zhes dgongs pas so //
translated: Since they exist but do not perform any function at all, they are like nonexistents.

original: gang ston pa de rnams da ltar byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang ston pa de rnams da ltar byung ba'o //
translated: Those that are the Teacher are present.

original: gang ston par 'gyur ba de rnams ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang ston par 'gyur ba de rnams ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: Those that will be the Teacher are future.

original: yang thams cad yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yang thams cad yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, all exist.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du yang 'di ltar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du yang 'di ltar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: They are also posited in this way in other world systems.

original: rnal 'byor ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: Yoga is the essence of the mind of enlightenment.

original: de la dbang ba nyid kyis na rnal 'byor bdag po'o //
analyzed: de la dbang ba nyid kyis na rnal 'byor bdag po'o //
translated: The Lord of Yoga is the master of the yoga, because of his mastery of that.

original: 'di yis rang don phun sum tshogs pas bstod pa gsungs nas /
analyzed: 'di yis rang don phun sum tshogs pas bstod pa gsungs nas /
translated: Having praised him with the perfection of his own aim,

original: gzhan don phun sum tshogs pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan don phun sum tshogs pas gsungs pa /
translated: he speaks of the perfection of the aim of others:

original: sems can sgrol byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems can sgrol byed ces bya'o //
translated: he is called the liberator of beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin nyid kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin nyid kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: He also speaks of him as the nature of the five Tathagatas:

original: kun gyi bdag nyid skyes zhes pa ste /
analyzed: kun gyi bdag nyid skyes zhes pa ste /
translated: he is born as the nature of all.

original: kun gyi ste rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid de rang bzhin du skyes pa zhes pa kun gyi bdag skyes te rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: kun gyi ste rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid de rang bzhin du skyes pa zhes pa kun gyi bdag skyes te rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: He is born as the nature of all, as the nature of Vairochana and so on. He is born as the nature of all, as Vajrasattva.

original: kun gyi bdag nyid du skyes pa nyid kho na rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: kun gyi bdag nyid du skyes pa nyid kho na rgyas par ston te /
translated: He is born as the nature of all, and that is elaborated:

original: gcig gis sgom byed ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gcig gis sgom byed ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: he experiences the one with the one, and so on.

original: gcig gis te mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis sna tshogs pa ro gcig pa nyid du nyams su myong ngo zhes pas gcig gis myong byed de rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: gcig gis te mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis sna tshogs pa ro gcig pa nyid du nyams su myong ngo zhes pas gcig gis myong byed de rin chen 'byung ldan no //

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis rmongs pa gcod pa rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis rmongs pa gcod pa rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: By the nature of mirror-like primordial wisdom, the delusion-cutting Vairochana.

original: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis don thams cad byed pa'i phyir thams cad ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis don thams cad byed pa'i phyir thams cad ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: By the nature of all-accomplishing primordial wisdom, all is Amoghasiddhi, because it accomplishes all aims.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: thams cad kun bdag nyid la gnas //
analyzed: thams cad kun bdag nyid la gnas //
translated: All is present in the nature of all.

original: zhes so // so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis spros pa med pa'i bde ba chen po'i de kho na nyid kyis 'gro ba las so sor rtog pa'i phyir de nyid ni 'dir 'od @42b dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis spros pa med pa'i bde ba chen po'i de kho na nyid kyis 'gro ba las so sor rtog pa'i phyir de nyid ni 'dir 'od @42b dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: By the nature of discerning primordial wisdom, the discerning of the world by the reality of great bliss without conceptual elaborations is here Amitabha.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: bde ba dam pas de nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba dam pas de nyid do //
translated: That is reality, with sublime bliss.

original: zhes so // chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis na mi bskyod pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes so // chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis na mi bskyod pa ni ye shes so //
translated: By the nature of the primordial wisdom of the extremely pure sphere of reality, Akshobhya is primordial wisdom.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gcig pu 'dren pa byang chub kyi sems rdo rje bcom ldan 'das ni gdul bya'i dor mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i gzugs su ston to zhes pas ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gcig pu 'dren pa byang chub kyi sems rdo rje bcom ldan 'das ni gdul bya'i dor mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i gzugs su ston to zhes pas ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, the Bodhicittavajra, the Leader, who is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, is shown to teach by manifesting in the forms of Akṣobhya and so forth for the sake of those to be trained.

original: bdag ces pa de bzhin gshegs pa gcig go //
analyzed: bdag ces pa de bzhin gshegs pa gcig go //
translated: The word “himself” refers to the one Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin du thams cad rnams so sor phyag mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad rnams so sor phyag mdzad pa'o //
translated: Similarly, he makes obeisance to all of them individually.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sdud pa pos bstod pa rnams zhes mang po'i tshig tu gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sdud pa pos bstod pa rnams zhes mang po'i tshig tu gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, the compiler says “the praises” in the plural.

original: rgyu'i rgyud nyid khyab par byed pa nyid du rtogs par 'dod pa rnams gsol ba 'debs par byed do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyud nyid khyab par byed pa nyid du rtogs par 'dod pa rnams gsol ba 'debs par byed do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Those who wish to understand the causal continuum itself as the all-pervading one make a request, as stated [in the root text]:

original: yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Again…” and so forth.

original: snying po ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: snying po ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The essence is the bodhicitta.

original: chos rnams kun gcig pa gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid gang du bsdus pa ste nang du 'dus pa de ni chos kun gcig tu bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gcig pa gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid gang du bsdus pa ste nang du 'dus pa de ni chos kun gcig tu bsdus pa'o //
translated: Where all phenomena are included, gathered within the non-dual nature of oneness, that is the single inclusion of all phenomena.

original: dbang po rnams ni mig la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni mig la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The faculties are the eye, etc.

original: de rnams kyi lam nyid ni yul nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lam nyid ni yul nyid do //
translated: Their path is their object.

original: myur te thob pa gang dang gang dngos po cung zad mthong ba dang nyan pa dang snom pa dang ro myang ba dang reg pa dang sems pa de dang de so sor mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: myur te thob pa gang dang gang dngos po cung zad mthong ba dang nyan pa dang snom pa dang ro myang ba dang reg pa dang sems pa de dang de so sor mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes 'brel lo //
translated: Whatever things are quickly seen, heard, smelled, tasted, touched, or cognized, that is their individual meditative concentration.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni dngos po ste gnyug mas zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni dngos po ste gnyug mas zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “by the yoga of non-equipoise” is as follows:

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings ni chos rnams thams cad kyi gnyug ma'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings ni chos rnams thams cad kyi gnyug ma'o //
translated: The reality realm without beginning or end is the innate nature of all things.

original: ci ltar zhe na /🔽mi mnyam gzhag pa'i rnal 'byor gyis te mi mnyam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i byang chub kyi sems spros pa med pa rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / mi mnyam gzhag pa'i rnal 'byor gyis te mi mnyam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i byang chub kyi sems spros pa med pa rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How so?

original: de la gzhag pa kun nas 'dzin pa ni mi mnyam gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzhag pa kun nas 'dzin pa ni mi mnyam gzhag pa'o //
translated: By the yoga of non-equipoise, i.e., by the yoga of non-equipoise which is the apprehension of the non-equipoise which is the non-equipoise of the mind on that reality realm.

original: de la rnal 'byor ni lhag par mos pa ste des so //
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor ni lhag par mos pa ste des so //
translated: The yoga there is the imagination of that reality realm.

original: mthong byed la sogs pa la so sor snang bzhin pa blta bya la sogs pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rang gi ngo bo kho nar mos pas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mthong byed la sogs pa la so sor snang bzhin pa blta bya la sogs pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rang gi ngo bo kho nar mos pas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the objects of seeing, etc., which appear individually to the eye, etc., are imagined to be just the nature of Vajrasattva.

original: rtag tu ni ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs dag tu'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs dag tu'o //
translated: Always, in the impure and pure states.

original: mnyam par te stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems la gzhag pa ste de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par te stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems la gzhag pa ste de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Equally, in the thought of enlightenment, which is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, he is to be placed, that is, held as its self.

original: 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi dang ma @43a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi dang ma @43a * //
translated: By this, it is said, the pervader of the forms, etc.,

original: dag pa dang dag pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs rnams kyi khyab par byed pa ni de'o zhes gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag pa dang dag pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs rnams kyi khyab par byed pa ni de'o zhes gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and of the impure and pure states of mind is he.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor ma bzhi yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor ma bzhi yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
translated: For this very reason, it is said in the Caturyoginisambara-tantra:

original: gang gang dbang po'i lam nyid du //
analyzed: gang gang dbang po'i lam nyid du //
translated: Whatever is the path of the senses,

original: 'gyur ba de de rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: 'gyur ba de de rang bzhin gyis //
translated: that is naturally

original: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod pas //
analyzed: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod pas //
translated: By enjoying all desires,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'thob //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'thob //
translated: one attains the nature of all the Buddhas.

original: ces so // gal te rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gzhag pa yin na 'o na mi mnyam gzhag par lhag par mos pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: ces so // gal te rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gzhag pa yin na 'o na mi mnyam gzhag par lhag par mos pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: If it is naturally in equipoise, then what is the use of aspiring to be in equipoise, since it is not in equipoise?

original: gang gi phyir rtogs par ma gyur to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtogs par ma gyur to //
translated: Because it is not realized.

original: phung por zhes pa'i rigs la gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: phung por zhes pa'i rigs la gcig gi tshig go //
translated: In the line “the aggregates,” the word “one” is elided.

original: bdag gzhan med pa'i phyir phung po lnga'i ngo bo'i bdag ni rnam par shes te khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes pa byang chub kyi sems la brten pa ni kun gyi bdag nyid kyis te de'i bdag nyid du'o zhes mngon sum gyis mi rtogs so //
analyzed: bdag gzhan med pa'i phyir phung po lnga'i ngo bo'i bdag ni rnam par shes te khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes pa byang chub kyi sems la brten pa ni kun gyi bdag nyid kyis te de'i bdag nyid du'o zhes mngon sum gyis mi rtogs so //
translated: The self that is the nature of the five aggregates is not realized to be consciousness, which is the basis of the exalted wisdom of bodhicitta, by means of its own nature, by means of its own identity, because it does not exist.

original: blun sems zhes pa blun pa'i sems ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: blun sems zhes pa blun pa'i sems ldan pa rnams so //
translated: “Those with foolish minds” are those who have foolish minds.

original: tha shal mi rnams zhes pa mu stegs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: tha shal mi rnams zhes pa mu stegs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: “Inferior people” are tīrthikas and so on.

original: de rnams ni byang chub kyi sems kho na la 'khrul pa rnams sems byed la sogs par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams ni byang chub kyi sems kho na la 'khrul pa rnams sems byed la sogs par rtogs par byed do //
translated: They mistake bodhicitta itself for the mind that creates everything.

original: de la sems byed ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la sems byed ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The mind that creates everything is the consciousness of the impermanent self.

original: skyes bu'i dbang phyug go zhes dbang phyug smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i dbang phyug go zhes dbang phyug smra ba rnams so //
translated: The puruṣa is the master.

original: sog byed ces klog pa la ni dge ba dang mi dge ba sog par byed phung por byed ces pa'i don to //🔽sems te sems can no sems can du smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: sog byed ces klog pa la ni dge ba dang mi dge ba sog par byed phung por byed ces pa'i don to // sems te sems can no sems can du smra ba rnams so //
translated: The puruṣa is the one who accumulates and who creates the aggregates.🔽The puruṣa is the sentient being.

original: sems pa'i dngos te skyes bu zhes grangs can pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems pa'i dngos te skyes bu zhes grangs can pa rnams so //
translated: The puruṣa is the agent of the mental process.

original: rnam shes thams cad do zhes pa nyer ston pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam shes thams cad do zhes pa nyer ston pa rnams so //
translated: The puruṣa is all consciousness.

original: shes bya'i rang bzhin zhes pa bdag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i rang bzhin zhes pa bdag la sogs pa'o //
translated: The puruṣa is the nature of the object of consciousness.

original: de la bdag kho na sems can bzhin du skye'o rgas so 'chi'o 'ching ngo grol lo zhes bdag tu smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la bdag kho na sems can bzhin du skye'o rgas so 'chi'o 'ching ngo grol lo zhes bdag tu smra ba rnams so //
translated: The puruṣa is the one who is born, who grows old, who dies, who is bound, who is liberated.

original: de ltar srog ces nam mkha'i gos can rnams so //🔽dus kyis 'byung ba rnams spro byed //
analyzed: de ltar srog ces nam mkha'i gos can rnams so // dus kyis 'byung ba rnams spro byed //
translated: The puruṣa is the life force.🔽Time creates the elements.

original: dus kyis skye dgu sdud par byed //
analyzed: dus kyis skye dgu sdud par byed //
translated: Time destroys living beings.

original: ces dus smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: ces dus smra ba rnams so //
translated: Time is the cause of the world.

original: yang dang yang du 'gro ba rnams su gnas pa'i gnas 'cha' ba'i phyir gang zag ces pa'am /
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'gro ba rnams su gnas pa'i gnas 'cha' ba'i phyir gang zag ces pa'am /
translated: Or, since it is the abode of the one who goes again and again to the various migrations, it is a person.

original: las rnams kyis gang zhing de rnams kho na nges par nub pa'i phyir zag pa'o zhes gang zag tu smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: las rnams kyis gang zhing de rnams kho na nges par nub pa'i phyir zag pa'o zhes gang zag tu smra ba rnams so //
translated: Or, since it is filled with actions and is definitely extinguished by them, it is a defilement.🔽Or, since it is the cause of the collection of effects, it is a cause.

original: rgyu nyid ces pa 'bras bu'i tshogs kyi rgyu ni dbang @43b phyug kho na'i zhes dbang phyug smra ba rnams kho na'o //🔽chos can sgom pa zhes pa zhib pa'i grub pa'i mthar bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'jug pa po dbang phyug go zhes de rnams kho na'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid ces pa 'bras bu'i tshogs kyi rgyu ni dbang @43b phyug kho na'i zhes dbang phyug smra ba rnams kho na'o // chos can sgom pa zhes pa zhib pa'i grub pa'i mthar bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'jug pa po dbang phyug go zhes de rnams kho na'o //
translated: Or, since it is the object of meditation, it is a reality.🔽Thus, those who imagine a self in the aggregates are of various opinions.

original: 'dis ni 'di rnams kyi gang yul 'di grub mtha' ngan pas 'khrul pa de de kho na nyid do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di rnams kyi gang yul 'di grub mtha' ngan pas 'khrul pa de de kho na nyid do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is not the self, because it is a collection, like the saṃgha; because it is appropriated, like the possessions of one who appropriates; because it is a cause, like the elements; and because it is an object, like any other object.

original: de ltar 'khrul zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul zhe na /
translated: Thus, the self is not a reality, because it is not perceived.

original: gang gi phyir chos rnams te sems byed la sogs pa rnams mang po nyid kyis de kho na nyid mang po nyid du 'thad pa ma yin zhes pa drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rnams te sems byed la sogs pa rnams mang po nyid kyis de kho na nyid mang po nyid du 'thad pa ma yin zhes pa drang ba'i don to //
translated: Since many phenomena, such as the mind, are not tenable as many realities, it is interpretable in meaning.

original: nges pa'i don ni tha shal mi rnams zhes pa so so'i skye bo rnams ma rig pa thog ma med pa'i srid par 'byung bas yang dag pa ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du mi 'gyur🔽ro zhes pas //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni tha shal mi rnams zhes pa so so'i skye bo rnams ma rig pa thog ma med pa'i srid par 'byung bas yang dag pa ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro zhes pas //
translated: The definitive meaning is that ordinary people, being ordinary beings, do not perceive reality as it is, because of the superimposition of the unreal, due to ignorance occurring in beginningless existence.

original: de mngon sum du bya ba nyid kyi ched du so so'i skye bo rnams lhag par mos pa rigs so //
analyzed: de mngon sum du bya ba nyid kyi ched du so so'i skye bo rnams lhag par mos pa rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate that ordinary beings should aspire to perceive it.

original: bdag 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only the self,🔽but also the mind, etc., are consciousness.

original: sems byed ces pa la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa'o zhes ma rtogs pas /
analyzed: sems byed ces pa la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa'o zhes ma rtogs pas /
translated: Not understanding this,

original: slar yang don gzhan la brten nas /
analyzed: slar yang don gzhan la brten nas /
translated: they again rely on other objects.

original: don de kho na 'das pa yin zhes pa'i rigs pas /
analyzed: don de kho na 'das pa yin zhes pa'i rigs pas /
translated: By the reasoning that “that object is past,”

original: slar yang rnam par shes pa gsungs so //
analyzed: slar yang rnam par shes pa gsungs so //
translated: consciousness is again taught.

original: sems byed ni mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems byed ni mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa ste /
translated: The mind is the collection of eye, etc.

original: de'i shes pa ni sems so //
analyzed: de'i shes pa ni sems so //
translated: Its consciousness is the mind.

original: sems kyis blta bar bya ba'o zhes pa sems gzugs te sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis blta bar bya ba'o zhes pa sems gzugs te sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object of the mind is form, such as blue, etc.

original: r'u pa lta ba la la'o zhes pa byings so //
analyzed: r'u pa lta ba la la'o zhes pa byings so //
translated: The verbal root is “to see.”

original: de ltar khams bco brgyad po rnams byang chub sems kyi rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ltar khams bco brgyad po rnams byang chub sems kyi rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: Thus, the eighteen elements are the intrinsic reality of the mind of enlightenment.

original: de yang shes bya'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: de yang shes bya'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: Moreover, it is the intrinsic reality of the knowable.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis shes bya mngon sum du bya ba'i rang bzhin te don dam pa stong pa nyid gang gi rang bzhin yin pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis shes bya mngon sum du bya ba'i rang bzhin te don dam pa stong pa nyid gang gi rang bzhin yin pa'o //
translated: The intrinsic reality of the ultimate emptiness is the intrinsic reality of the knowable, which is directly perceived by ordinary beings.

original: de'i phyir mos par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mos par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one should be devoted to it—this is the intended meaning.

original: gal te de ltar lhag par mos pa bsgom pas de mngon sum du bya ba'o zhes pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar lhag par mos pa bsgom pas de mngon sum du bya ba'o zhes pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na /
translated: If one cultivates devotion in this way, it is directly perceived. Thus, if it is the nature of cause and effect,

original: stong pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa chos can rnams kyi chos kyang ched du gtad pas bsgom par bya'o zhes pas chos dang chos can gyi dngos po yang byang chub kyi sems las gzhan du 'gyur bas na de khyab byed ma yin no zhe na gsungs pa /🔽'bras bu rnams la zhes pa ste gong nas gong du rtogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa chos can rnams kyi chos kyang ched du gtad pas bsgom par bya'o zhes pas chos dang chos can gyi dngos po yang byang chub kyi sems las gzhan du 'gyur bas na de khyab byed ma yin no zhe na gsungs pa / 'bras bu rnams la zhes pa ste gong nas gong du rtogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: One should meditate on the emptiness of forms and so on, the phenomena, by directing one's attention to them. Since the entities of phenomena and the entities of the subjects are different from the thought of awakening, they are not its pervader.

original: chos rnams ni @44a * //
analyzed: chos rnams ni @44a * //
translated: The response to that is with regard to the effects. The effects are the realizations that are higher and higher.

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid dang skad cig pa nyid dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid dang skad cig pa nyid dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The phenomena are the lack of intrinsic reality, momentariness, and the freedom from the nature of object apprehended and apprehending subject, and so on.

original: de rnams chos can rnams la sgom pa ni chos can bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams chos can rnams la sgom pa ni chos can bsgom pa'o //
translated: The meditation on those with regard to the subjects is the meditation on the subjects.

original: gang cung zad rgyu dang 'bras bu rnams dang gang ci yang rung ba'i chos dang chos can rnams sam de'i dngos po de rnams ni byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid kho na'o zhes pas stong pa nyid ni khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang cung zad rgyu dang 'bras bu rnams dang gang ci yang rung ba'i chos dang chos can rnams sam de'i dngos po de rnams ni byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid kho na'o zhes pas stong pa nyid ni khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, emptiness is the pervader.

original: 'o na chos can rnams so sor rang nyid tha dad pa'i phyir de'i chos rang bzhin med pa nyid kyang don dam par chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa na /
analyzed: 'o na chos can rnams so sor rang nyid tha dad pa'i phyir de'i chos rang bzhin med pa nyid kyang don dam par chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa na /
translated: Well, since the subjects are individually different from each other, the absence of intrinsic existence in them is also not different from the nature of the subjects in the ultimate.

original: chos can so so tha dad pa la ci ltar khyab par byed pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos can so so tha dad pa la ci ltar khyab par byed pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: So, how can it be the pervader of the individual different subjects?🔽It is said:

original: gang gi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because of that, and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos gzugs la sogs pa rnams mang po nyid du tha dad pas de'i chos brten pa de kho na nyid mang po nyid du tha dad par rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos gzugs la sogs pa rnams mang po nyid du tha dad pas de'i chos brten pa de kho na nyid mang po nyid du tha dad par rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Since the many phenomena such as form are different from each other in terms of their individual characteristics, the phenomenon of their dependent reality is not understood to be different in terms of multiplicity.

original: dper na chu bo rnams kyi rgyun mang po rang nyid nang du ston pa rnams kyang khyab par byed pa rgya mtshor mang po nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu bo rnams kyi rgyun mang po rang nyid nang du ston pa rnams kyang khyab par byed pa rgya mtshor mang po nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the many streams of rivers, which are themselves many, are pervaded by the one universal, the ocean.

original: chu bo'i rgyun zhes pa rigs pa gcig gi tshig dang drug pa'i don la mang po ste /
analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun zhes pa rigs pa gcig gi tshig dang drug pa'i don la mang po ste /
translated: The word “stream” is a single word in the singular, but it means “many,”

original: chu ba'o rgyun rnams kyi mang po nyid du zhes sbrel lo //
analyzed: chu ba'o rgyun rnams kyi mang po nyid du zhes sbrel lo //
translated: as in “the many streams.”

original: ci'i phyir rtogs bya min zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtogs bya min zhe na /
translated: Why is it not to be realized?

original: gang phyir te gang gi phyir thar bar byed ces pa aa tsa yid thar pa byang chub kyi sems rgyu'i rgyud gcig kho na yin pas so //
analyzed: gang phyir te gang gi phyir thar bar byed ces pa aa tsa yid thar pa byang chub kyi sems rgyu'i rgyud gcig kho na yin pas so //
translated: Because, that is, since the one universal, the mind of enlightenment, is the cause of liberation.

original: 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: stong pa nyid kho na chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kho na chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid de /
translated: Emptiness alone is the reality of all phenomena.

original: de yang sgro 'dogs pa mtha' dag las ldog pa'i ngo bo'i gcig kho nar tha snyad bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang sgro 'dogs pa mtha' dag las ldog pa'i ngo bo'i gcig kho nar tha snyad bya ba ste /
translated: Moreover, it is to be conventionally designated as the one universal, the nature of which is the negation of all superimpositions,

original: kun rdzob tu dngos po so so la de'i bdag nyid du de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu dngos po so so la de'i bdag nyid du de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in the nature of each thing on the conventional level.
